tasks.title: Monorepo and Project Scaffolding
tasks.description: Initialize local-first monorepo with client and server workspaces, TypeScript configs, linting, testing, and runtime env management.
tasks.details:
- Structure:
  - repo root: pnpm workspaces; packages: server (Node/TS), ui_frontend (React/TS), shared (types, schemas), scripts (CLIs), content (packs)
- Tooling:
  - Node 20+, pnpm, TypeScript strict, ESLint+Prettier, Jest+ts-jest, Playwright for E2E
  - Env: dotenv-safe for local-only, no remote telemetry by default
- Folder map:
  - src/server: LLM orchestration, missions, rules, memory, persistence, realtime, images, scheduling, video (flagged)
  - src/ui_frontend: voice capture, HUD, campaign browser, schedule editor, captions
  - framework_docs/ (from repo)
- Scripts: dev (concurrently server+client), build, test, e2e, lint, typecheck
- Git hooks: pre-commit lint-staged; commitlint conventional commits
- Security: .env.local in .gitignore; example env file with placeholders; keyring location documented
- Accessibility baseline: eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y
- Vite for UI; ts-node/tsx for server dev
- CRDT lib placeholder (Automerge/Yjs) added as dep for later tasks
tasks.testStrategy:
- CI runs lint, typecheck, unit tests on push
- Playwright scaffold test opens app shell and loads WebSocket handshake stub
- Verify no external network calls during startup (mock global fetch and assert none)
- Ensure workspace build succeeds end-to-end with pnpm -r build

subtasks.title: Define acceptance tests for monorepo scaffolding (TC001–TC006)
subtasks.description: Author repository-level tests that codify the core acceptance criteria before any implementation. Cover workspace layout, scripts, TypeScript strictness, linting/formatting, unit/e2e test runners, environment isolation, and absence of external telemetry on startup.
subtasks.details:
- Create a temporary sandbox (e.g., scripts/scaffold-tests/setupSandbox.ts) to run CLI scaffolding and assertions.
- Write Jest tests (root-level) for:
  - TC001: pnpm -r build succeeds for all workspaces and produces expected dist outputs.
  - TC002: Workspace graph contains server, ui_frontend, shared, scripts, content with correct package.json config (name, private, type, main/module, scripts).
  - TC003: TypeScript strict mode enabled across root and packages (tsc --noEmit) and fails on an intentional ts error fixture.
  - TC004: ESLint + Prettier configured; lint-staged and commitlint configured; pre-commit hook triggers lint on staged files.
  - TC005: Jest + ts-jest runs unit tests in server and shared; Playwright scaffold can launch dev server and open app shell.
  - TC006: Startup makes no external network calls: mock global.fetch and node dns/http/https to assert no outbound during dev bootstrap.
- Write a Playwright spec (e2e/app-smoke.spec.ts) that:
  - Boots the dev servers via a test harness, visits http://localhost:5173, asserts app shell renders and a WebSocket handshake stub is attempted and intercepted.
- Add minimal fixtures to assert directory presence and env files exist with placeholders. Do not implement scaffolding yet; tests should fail initially.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run tests locally: pnpm i; pnpm test; pnpm e2e. Ensure CI job (temporary GitHub Actions in .github/workflows/ci.yml) runs lint, typecheck, unit, and e2e in the sandbox.

subtasks.title: Initialize pnpm workspaces and root configuration
subtasks.description: Create the monorepo root with pnpm workspaces, shared engines/pnpm version, base scripts, gitignore, editorconfig, and Node tool versions.
subtasks.details:
- Initialize repo: git init.
- Add package.json at root:
  - private: true, packageManager: "pnpm@9.x", engines: { node: ">=20" }.
  - workspaces: ["packages/*", "framework_docs"].
  - scripts: dev, build, test, e2e, lint, typecheck, format, prepare (husky install).
- Add pnpm-workspace.yaml specifying packages/* and excluding framework_docs from publishing.
- Add .gitignore covering node_modules, dist, coverage, .env.local, .env.*, playwright/.cache.
- Add .editorconfig with standard settings.
- Add README with monorepo overview and local-first principles.
- Commit and run tests from 1; fix workspace discovery failures until TC002 workspace presence checks pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC002 partial checks to ensure workspaces resolve. Ensure pnpm -r list shows no packages yet but workspace config loads.

subtasks.title: Scaffold shared package (types and schemas)
subtasks.description: Create packages/shared with strict TS config, Jest setup, and initial Zod schema placeholders shared across server and UI.
subtasks.details:
- Create packages/shared/package.json with name "@app/shared", type: module, main: dist/index.js, types: dist/index.d.ts, files: ["dist"], sideEffects: false.
- Add src/index.ts exporting placeholder zod schemas (e.g., MessageEnvelope, Channel, EnvConfig) and shared types.
- Add tsconfig.json extending root base with "strict": true, composite: true, declaration: true, moduleResolution: bundler, module: ESNext, target: ES2022.
- Add jest.config.ts with ts-jest preset and transforms for ESM.
- Add basic unit tests verifying schema parse and type inferences (TC005 unit coverage for shared).
- Add build script: tsup or tsc build; prefer tsc for simplicity: "build": "tsc -b".
- Run tests; ensure TC003 strict mode and TC005 shared unit tests pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: pnpm --filter @app/shared test; pnpm -r typecheck; verify emitted d.ts and noImplicitAny violations.

subtasks.title: Scaffold server workspace (Node/TS with tsx dev)
subtasks.description: Create packages/server with Node 20+ TypeScript, tsx for dev, ts-jest for unit tests, dotenv-safe for local-only env, and baseline runtime.
subtasks.details:
- packages/server/package.json: name "@app/server", type module, main dist/index.js, scripts: dev: "tsx src/index.ts", build: "tsc -b", test: jest, lint, typecheck.
- Add dependencies: dotenv, dotenv-safe, zod; devDeps: tsx, ts-jest, jest, @types/jest, ts-node (if needed), typescript.
- tsconfig.json extends root, sets NodeNext moduleResolution, strict, outDir dist, rootDir src, skipLibCheck false.
- src/index.ts: load env via dotenv-safe (require .env.local and .env.example), initialize minimal HTTP server with no outbound calls, log structured startup.
- src/config/env.ts: zod-validated env loader; export getEnv() used by index.
- Add jest config and sample unit tests for env validation and startup without external calls (mock http/https/fetch) to satisfy TC006.
- Document .env.example placeholders and ensure .env.local is gitignored per security baseline.
- Run tests; ensure TC006 passes for server.
subtasks.testStrategy: Isolate network modules with jest.mock; assert that startup completes without any http/https requests; assert process.env is validated.

subtasks.title: Scaffold UI workspace with Vite React TypeScript
subtasks.description: Create packages/ui_frontend using Vite React TS template, Playwright config, eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y, and strict TypeScript.
subtasks.details:
- Initialize Vite app into packages/ui_frontend (no telemetry): pnpm create vite . --template react-ts (run in that dir) and remove analytics.
- package.json: name "@app/ui_frontend", scripts: dev: "vite", build: "tsc -b && vite build", preview, test (jest for unit), e2e (playwright).
- Add Playwright config with devServer that runs vite on port 5173; add a smoke spec loading the app shell and intercepting WS handshake stub (TC005 e2e).
- Add eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y and configure rules; add basic App shell with accessible landmarks and keyboard nav baseline.
- TypeScript strict: enable in tsconfig.app.json; set moduleResolution bundler.
- Add a unit test for a small component and a11y attributes.
- Run e2e and unit tests; ensure TC005 part (UI) passes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm --filter @app/ui_frontend e2e headed and headless; assert title, role=main present; intercept WS URL with Playwright route.

subtasks.title: Root TypeScript project references and strict config
subtasks.description: Establish root tsconfig with project references and strictness propagated to all workspaces, enabling tsc -b across repo.
subtasks.details:
- Root tsconfig.base.json: compilerOptions strict true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess true, exactOptionalPropertyTypes true, noImplicitOverride true, incremental true.
- Root tsconfig.json: references to ./packages/shared, ./packages/server, ./packages/ui_frontend where applicable; set exclude for node_modules and dist.
- Ensure each package tsconfig references shared where imported.
- Run tsc -b -v at root; fix path aliases if used (via tsconfig paths) and ensure builds to dist.
- Update root scripts: "typecheck": "tsc -b --pretty false"; "build": "pnpm -r build".
- Run tests; TC003 and TC001 build now should be achievable.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm typecheck; intentionally add a failing type in a throwaway test to verify CI fails; remove after verification.

subtasks.title: ESLint, Prettier, and a11y linting baseline
subtasks.description: Configure ESLint with TypeScript, import/order, monorepo-aware overrides, Prettier integration, and jsx-a11y for UI.
subtasks.details:
- Add .eslintrc.cjs at root with parser @typescript-eslint, plugins: @typescript-eslint, import, unused-imports, jsx-a11y (scoped to UI), jest.
- Add eslint-configs per workspace via overrides: server (node, commonjs globals), ui (browser, react), shared (lib rules).
- Add .prettierrc with standard formatting; setup lint-staged to run eslint --fix and prettier --write on staged files.
- Add scripts: lint, format in root and packages; ensure pnpm -r lint works.
- Add minimal violations to ensure rules work, then fix them.
- Ensure TC004 passes including pre-commit hook behavior.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run eslint on changed files via lint-staged simulation; commit a change to confirm pre-commit hook runs and blocks on errors.

subtasks.title: Husky, lint-staged, and commitlint hooks
subtasks.description: Install and configure Git hooks: pre-commit for lint-staged and commit-msg for conventional commits with commitlint.
subtasks.details:
- Install husky, lint-staged, @commitlint/config-conventional, @commitlint/cli.
- Add prepare script to root package.json and run pnpm prepare to generate .husky/.
- Create .husky/pre-commit with: pnpm lint-staged.
- Configure lint-staged in package.json or .lintstagedrc to run eslint and prettier on staged ts/tsx/json/yaml.
- Create .husky/commit-msg with: pnpm commitlint --edit "$1".
- Add commitlint.config.cjs extending @commitlint/config-conventional.
- Verify TC004 hook behavior.
subtasks.testStrategy: Attempt a non-conforming commit message; expect failure. Attempt conforming message; expect success. Ensure staged lint fixes are applied.

subtasks.title: Jest configuration across monorepo
subtasks.description: Unify Jest config to support ESM TypeScript in all packages with ts-jest, coverage reports, and isolated test envs.
subtasks.details:
- Create jest.preset.ts at root exporting common config: preset ts-jest, testEnvironment node/jsdom by package, extensionsToTreatAsEsm, transform for ts with useESM, moduleNameMapper for TS paths.
- Update each package jest.config.ts to extend from root preset.
- Add coverage thresholds and collectCoverageFrom per package.
- Ensure server and shared unit tests run; for UI, keep component tests minimal if Playwright covers UI e2e.
- Run tests; confirm TC005 unit test coverage across packages.
subtasks.testStrategy: pnpm -r test with --coverage; verify that ESM interop works and no Babel needed.

subtasks.title: Playwright e2e setup and devServer orchestration
subtasks.description: Finalize Playwright project with devServer orchestration to spin up both server and UI concurrently for e2e smoke.
subtasks.details:
- In e2e/playwright.config.ts at root, define projects: ui. Configure webServer to start: pnpm --filter @app/server dev and pnpm --filter @app/ui_frontend dev via a wrapper script using concurrently or a custom node launcher.
- Implement scripts/dev.ts in repo root to spawn both processes, wait for ports (server e.g., 4000, UI 5173), and expose readiness.
- Add Playwright route interception to stub WS handshake to localhost without touching network.
- Ensure TC005 end-to-end smoke passes reliably in CI.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm e2e locally and in CI; add retry and timeout settings; capture traces on failure.

subtasks.title: Runtime environment management with dotenv-safe
subtasks.description: Standardize environment variable management, examples, and documentation; enforce local-only defaults and no telemetry.
subtasks.details:
- Create .env.example at repo root with placeholders and comments for all required variables for server and UI (prefixed VITE_ for UI if needed). Include OFFLINE=true default.
- Ensure .env.local is in .gitignore and referenced in docs.
- Update server env loader to respect OFFLINE flag and explicitly deny outbound by default (but do not implement network guard policy yet; just set flags).
- Document keyring location expectations (future tasks) and environment conventions in README.
- Update tests to check presence of example env and that startup honors OFFLINE in logs (no network).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run server startup under OFFLINE=true and assert logs reflect offline mode; ensure TC006 remains passing.

subtasks.title: Dev, build, test, e2e, lint, typecheck scripts wiring
subtasks.description: Wire root and per-package scripts and concurrently-based dev script to run server+client together.
subtasks.details:
- Add root scripts:
  - dev: "node scripts/dev.js" (or ts-node/tsx if TypeScript) to run both workspaces.
  - build: "pnpm -r build".
  - test: "pnpm -r test".
  - e2e: "playwright test".
  - lint: "pnpm -r lint"; format: "pnpm -r format"; typecheck: "tsc -b".
- Ensure package-level scripts align and dev servers bind to non-conflicting ports.
- Validate TC001: pnpm -r build passes and produces outputs for server and shared; UI build produces dist.
- Ensure CI uses these scripts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm build and verify artifacts; run pnpm dev and access UI; ensure e2e passes.

subtasks.title: CI pipeline: lint, typecheck, unit, and e2e on push
subtasks.description: Add GitHub Actions workflow to run lint, typecheck, unit tests, and Playwright e2e on pushes/PRs; cache pnpm and Playwright browsers.
subtasks.details:
- .github/workflows/ci.yml:
  - Use actions/setup-node@v4 with Node 20.x; setup pnpm; cache pnpm store.
  - Jobs: lint+typecheck, unit, e2e with matrix for OS if needed (start with ubuntu-latest).
  - Install Playwright browsers with npx playwright install --with-deps.
  - Artifacts: upload playwright traces on failure and coverage reports.
- Gate merges by requiring CI pass (docs; optional branch protection).
subtasks.testStrategy: Open a PR to trigger CI; ensure all TC001–TC006 checks run and are green.

subtasks.title: Security and git hygiene baselines
subtasks.description: Ensure sensitive files are ignored, add CODEOWNERS, basic security policy, and configure minimal access boundaries.
subtasks.details:
- Verify .gitignore covers .env.local and any keys; add .env.* patterns as needed.
- Add SECURITY.md and CONTRIBUTING.md describing local-first, no telemetry defaults.
- Add CODEOWNERS to declare ownership for packages/server, packages/ui_frontend, packages/shared, scripts, content.
- Add npmrc/pnpm config to avoid sending telemetry if any and lock registry to npmjs.
- Add a simple script to scan for accidental keys in commits using a regex pre-commit optional step.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a simulated commit containing a dummy API key and confirm the scanner flags it; verify TC006 still passes.

subtasks.title: Content and scripts workspaces scaffolding
subtasks.description: Create packages/content and packages/scripts workspaces with minimal structure and testing harness.
subtasks.details:
- packages/content: package.json name "@app/content", type module; src/ with placeholder pack JSON and loader types referencing @app/shared.
- packages/scripts: package.json name "@app/scripts", bin entries for future CLIs; tsconfig; jest config; sample CLI that prints workspace graph safely (no network).
- Add unit tests for scripts CLI and content schema validation.
- Ensure build and tests integrate into pnpm -r build/test.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm --filter @app/scripts test and build; ensure TC001 still green.

subtasks.title: CRDT library placeholder dependencies
subtasks.description: Add CRDT dependency placeholders (Automerge/Yjs) without implementation; verify build integrity and tree-shaking.
subtasks.details:
- Add dependencies to shared or server where appropriate as optionalDependencies to avoid inflating builds prematurely.
- Provide minimal type exports that wrap these libs behind an interface stub (no runtime usage yet).
- Ensure optional import paths are type-safe but not executed in dev smoke.
- Document future integration points in shared README.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm -r build to confirm no bundling issues; ensure e2e smoke unaffected.

subtasks.title: Finalize folder map and docs import
subtasks.description: Lay out src/server subfolders (llm orchestration, missions, rules, memory, persistence, realtime, images, scheduling, video-flagged) and src/ui_frontend features (voice capture, HUD, campaign browser, schedule editor, captions), plus framework_docs/.
subtasks.details:
- Create empty folder structure with README.md in each domain describing purpose and boundaries.
- Add index.ts placeholders exporting nothing to keep TS project references valid.
- Add a feature flag for video areas in server and UI (simple boolean in env types) and ensure excluded from builds when false.
- Ensure imports do not create circular deps.
- Import existing framework_docs/ if provided and exclude from build.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run pnpm typecheck to ensure no stray imports; run pnpm -r build; ensure TC001 remains green.

subtasks.title: Verification sweep and harden tests (TC001–TC006)
subtasks.description: Run and harden all tests, improve flake resistance, and ensure acceptance criteria fully met before closing task.
subtasks.details:
- Stabilize Playwright devServer startup with wait-on and retry.
- Ensure no external network calls by stubbing DNS lookups and setting env OFFLINE in e2e.
- Validate pnpm -r build works from a clean clone; test incremental builds.
- Ensure lint-staged and commitlint enforce policies consistently.
- Update docs with setup steps and troubleshooting.
subtasks.testStrategy: Cold CI run in a fresh environment; collect traces; run tests twice to detect flakes; ensure all TC001–TC006 pass consistently.

tasks.title: Local SQLite and Vector Index Setup
tasks.description: Implement local-first persistence with SQLite and pluggable vector index (FAISS or SQLite-VSS), schema migrations, and access layer.
tasks.details:
- Use better-sqlite3 for sync local db; drizzle-orm or Kysely for typed queries
- Vector: prefer sqlite-vss (if available for platform) with fallback FAISS via node bindings; abstraction interface VectorIndex with namespaces campaign:<id>, player:<id>
- Migrations: drizzle-kit or Knex; seed script for dev
- Tables: players, characters, campaigns, sessions, world_states, events, memories, missions, mission_progress, inventory, items, images, videos (featureFlag), llm_messages, settings, schedules
- Indices: events(session_id, seq), memories(namespace, ts), images(hash/style), schedules(campaign_id, next_fire_at)
- Snapshots table for periodic snapshots
- Local asset cache dirs: cache/images, cache/video, logs/
- Encryption at rest for provider keys: OS keychain via keytar; settings table stores key ids not secrets
tasks.testStrategy:
- Unit tests: CRUD for core tables, migrations up/down idempotency
- Vector tests: insert/query cosine similarity, namespace isolation
- Performance smoke: simple benchmark ensures typical inserts >2k/s, vector query <50ms on small set
- Verify keys never stored in plaintext in DB by scanning settings table

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and write tests first (DB + Vector + Security + Perf)
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive test suite that encodes the core acceptance criteria for local-first persistence, migrations, vector index behavior (sqlite-vss and FAISS fallback), access layer, encryption-at-rest via keytar, and basic performance smoke checks. No production code beyond test scaffolding should be implemented here.
subtasks.details:
• Set up test harness with Node.js + TypeScript: vitest/jest, ts-node/ts-jest, and a temporary filesystem sandbox per test.
• Define TC IDs and coverage mapping:
  - TC001: Migrations up/down idempotency and versioning.
  - TC002: CRUD for core tables (players, campaigns, sessions, events, memories) covering inserts, updates, deletes, and queries with indices.
  - TC003: Vector index insert and cosine similarity search returns expected order; validate namespace isolation (campaign:<id>, player:<id>).
  - TC004: Fallback from sqlite-vss to FAISS when vss extension unavailable.
  - TC005: Keys are not stored in plaintext in DB; settings table stores key IDs only; keytar used for secret retrieval.
  - TC006: Seed script populates dev data deterministically and re-runnable without duplication.
  - TC007: Indices exist and are used (events(session_id, seq), memories(namespace, ts), images(hash, style), schedules(campaign_id, next_fire_at)).
  - TC008: Snapshots table creation and periodic write/read integrity.
  - TC009: Performance smoke: typical inserts >2000 rows/s; vector top-k query <50ms on small set.
  - TC010: Feature flag toggles videos table creation and access layer exposure.
• Create fixtures for sample entities and small vector sets.
• Provide mock/shim for keytar in tests to simulate OS keychain.
• Stub FAISS bindings with simple in-memory vector store behind the same interface for unit tests if native module is not available in CI.
• Set up test database paths in a temp directory; ensure cleanup.
• Do not implement production modules; write tests that reference planned module contracts and interfaces.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the test suite; all tests expected to fail initially (red). Ensure CI runs on push and PR.

subtasks.title: Project scaffolding and package setup
subtasks.description: Initialize packages, TypeScript config, testing framework, scripts, and environment scaffolding for local-first SQLite and vector index development.
subtasks.details:
• Add dependencies: better-sqlite3, drizzle-orm or kysely (choose one), drizzle-kit or knex, keytar, zod, dotenv, fast-glob, and optionally sqlite-vss package/loader; add FAISS node bindings dependency (optional peer) and a lightweight fallback dev stub.
• Add dev dependencies: vitest/jest, ts-node/tsx, types for node, eslint, prettier, tsup/tsc build.
• Configure tsconfig for ES2020 target and NodeNext module resolution.
• Add NPM scripts: test, test:watch, db:migrate, db:seed, db:reset, build, lint, typecheck, perf:smoke.
• Create environment loader: .env schema with DB_FILE, FEATURE_VIDEOS, VSS_EXTENSION_PATH, FAISS_ENABLED, APP_ENV.
• Provide platform notes for loading sqlite-vss (dlopen) and FAISS optional load.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run test suite; ensure it executes and fails only on unimplemented features, not on environment issues.

subtasks.title: Database connection and lifecycle module (better-sqlite3)
subtasks.description: Implement a robust SQLite connection factory using better-sqlite3 with safe open, WAL mode, PRAGMA defaults, and a standardized path layout for local-first storage.
subtasks.details:
• Implement db/connection.ts: create or open DB at DB_FILE; set PRAGMAs: journal_mode=WAL, synchronous=NORMAL, foreign_keys=ON, cache_size=-20000, temp_store=MEMORY; busy_timeout=5000.
• Ensure directories exist: ./cache/images, ./cache/video, ./logs.
• Expose a singleton getDb() and a withTransaction<T>(fn) helper using db.transaction.
• Implement graceful shutdown hook; close DB on process exit.
• Export a lightweight query interface if using better-sqlite3 prepared statements.
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: open/close DB, PRAGMAs set, WAL file appears after write, concurrent prepared statements work. Map to TC002 partial infra.

subtasks.title: Schema definition with ORM and migrations baseline
subtasks.description: Define schemas for all required tables and generate initial migration files using drizzle-orm (or Kysely) with drizzle-kit (or Knex).
subtasks.details:
• Choose ORM: drizzle-orm recommended for typed queries; set up schema folder with table definitions for: players, characters, campaigns, sessions, world_states, events, memories, missions, mission_progress, inventory, items, images, videos (featureFlag), llm_messages, settings, schedules, snapshots.
• Define indices:
  - events: composite index (session_id, seq).
  - memories: (namespace, ts).
  - images: (hash), (style) or composite depending on query plan.
  - schedules: (campaign_id, next_fire_at).
• Add foreign keys and ON DELETE/UPDATE behaviors; add created_at/updated_at defaults.
• Implement conditional DDL for videos table controlled by FEATURE_VIDEOS env at migration time.
• Generate initial migration SQL and a migration runner script (db/migrate.ts) with up/down and idempotency guards.
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC001 (idempotent up/down), TC007 (indices exist), and part of TC010 (videos flag) should pass.

subtasks.title: Seed script for development data
subtasks.description: Create a repeatable, idempotent seed script to populate core entities and sample data for development and tests.
subtasks.details:
• Implement db/seed.ts: insert sample players, campaigns, sessions, items, and minimal vectors for memories.
• Use upsert patterns (INSERT ... ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE/NOTHING) keyed by stable IDs to ensure re-runnable seeds.
• Provide small deterministic corpus for vector tests (fixed random seed, small embeddings arrays).
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC006 should pass; verify rows count stable across repeated seeding; ensure referential integrity.

subtasks.title: VectorIndex interface and adapter contracts
subtasks.description: Design a pluggable VectorIndex TypeScript interface with namespace support and define contracts for sqlite-vss and FAISS adapters.
subtasks.details:
• Define types in vector/index.ts:
  - interface VectorIndex { init(): Promise<void>|void; upsert(vecs: {id:string, namespace:string, embedding:number[], metadata?:Record<string,any>}[]): Promise<void>; delete(ids: string[], namespace: string): Promise<void>; query(opts:{namespace:string, embedding:number[], topK:number, filter?:Record<string,any>, metric?:'cosine'|'l2'}): Promise<{id:string, score:number, metadata?:Record<string,any>}[]>; purgeNamespace(namespace:string): Promise<void>; close(): Promise<void>|void }
• Enforce namespace forms: campaign:<id>, player:<id> via zod refinements.
• Define error classes and feature detection helpers for sqlite-vss availability and FAISS bindings.
• Run tests and make them pass for interface existence and validation utilities.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests validate input schemas, namespace regex, and adapter selection logic stubs.

subtasks.title: SQLite-VSS adapter implementation
subtasks.description: Implement VectorIndex using sqlite-vss extension when available, with table creation, indexing, and cosine similarity queries per namespace.
subtasks.details:
• Load sqlite-vss extension via db.loadExtension(VSS_EXTENSION_PATH) or compile-time bundled load; guard per-platform.
• Create vss embeddings table: vss_embeddings(dim INTEGER, namespace TEXT, id TEXT PRIMARY KEY, embedding BLOB, metadata JSON, created_at/updated_at). Create a VSS index over embedding; store embeddings as FLOAT32 array in BLOB.
• Implement upsert: use replace/insert with parameter binding; maintain updated_at.
• Implement query: compute topK via vss_search using cosine distance; translate to similarity score (1 - distance if needed). Apply namespace filter and optional metadata JSON filter via JSON_EXTRACT.
• Implement delete and purgeNamespace.
• Ensure transactions for batch upserts.
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC003 (sqlite-vss path) and TC004 partial (availability detection) pass on environments with extension.

subtasks.title: FAISS adapter implementation (fallback)
subtasks.description: Implement FAISS-based VectorIndex adapter loaded optionally via node bindings, used when sqlite-vss is unavailable.
subtasks.details:
• Attempt to import FAISS; if unavailable, provide a minimal in-memory cosine index fallback for dev to satisfy tests.
• Implement index management: maintain per-namespace index (IndexFlatIP or L2 as configured). Persist index shards to files under ./cache/vector/<namespace>.faiss when possible; else memory-only with warning.
• Implement upsert by re-building or adding vectors; delete by re-indexing namespace excluding IDs; maintain an aux mapping {id->position, metadata} in JSON file per namespace.
• Implement query with topK; return scores normalized to cosine similarity.
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC004 (fallback works) and TC003 (namespace isolation and similarity order) pass with FAISS or in-memory fallback.

subtasks.title: Vector adapter selection and factory
subtasks.description: Implement a factory that selects sqlite-vss when available, else FAISS adapter, exposing a single VectorIndex instance.
subtasks.details:
• Implement vector/factory.ts: detect sqlite-vss by trying to load extension or probing PRAGMA module_list; if successful, return SQLiteVSS adapter, else try FAISS; if both fail, throw descriptive error with remediation.
• Ensure init() sets up necessary tables or files; ensure close() cleans up handles.
• Integrate with env flags to force a particular backend for testing.
• Run tests and make them pass.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC004 should fully pass across environments; add unit tests for forced selection via env.

subtasks.title: Access layer (repositories) with typed queries

tasks.title: Realtime WebSocket Gateway
tasks.description: Create WebSocket server for multiplayer messaging, presence, and pub/sub channels underpinning voice/text synchronization.
tasks.details:

- Channels: 1:1, room/proximity, team/line, party/alliance topics; server enforces membership
- Message types: join, leave, voice-meta, caption, action, ticker-update, crdt-sync
- Backpressure and retries with exponential backoff; heartbeat pings; reconnect tokens
- Serialize with zod schemas in shared package for strict validation
- Rate limit per connection; structured logs to logs/
tasks.testStrategy:
- Integration tests with superwstest/ws mocking multiple clients joining/leaving
- TC002 mapping: verify channel membership and audio routing metadata distribution
- Chaos test: drop packets, ensure reconnect restores subscriptions
- Performance: sustain 100 concurrent clients locally without error

subtasks.title: Define acceptance tests for WebSocket gateway (unit + integration)
subtasks.description: Before implementation, author a comprehensive test suite capturing the core acceptance criteria for the realtime gateway covering connection lifecycle, auth, channel membership enforcement, message routing per type, rate limiting, backpressure handling, heartbeat/reconnect, and basic performance envelopes.
subtasks.details:
Create tests in packages/server/src/realtime/__tests__ with Jest + ts-jest and superwstest or ws test utilities. Add:
- Unit tests for validators (zod schemas), rate limiter, backoff utility, token parsing, and channel authorization rules.
- Integration tests spinning up an ephemeral ws server on a random port with multiple simulated clients using ws or superwstest.
- Tag relevant cases with IDs TC002 (channel membership and audio metadata routing) and reserve TC010–TC014 for lifecycle, resilience, and rate-limit cases.
subtasks.testStrategy:
- Unit: zod schema validation for message types join, leave, voice-meta, caption, action, ticker-update, crdt-sync. Expect parse success/failure on fixtures (TC010).
- Unit: rate limiter blocks excess messages per connection with reset window (TC011).
- Unit: exponential backoff function yields expected sequence with jitter (TC012).
- Integration: auth required—unauthorized handshake rejected; authorized connects succeed (TC013).
- Integration: channel membership enforced—publish blocked if not a member; allowed after join; distribution only to members (TC002).
- Integration: presence events broadcast join/leave to relevant channels (TC014).
- Integration: heartbeat—server pings, client must pong; idle disconnect; reconnect token restores subscriptions (TC015).
- Integration: backpressure—server buffers capped; slow consumer triggers pause/drop policy with signal; retries with backoff from client harness (TC016).
- Integration: sustain 100 concurrent local clients for 30s without error and with <1% message loss for best-effort channels (TC017).

Use ws or uWebSockets.js; start with ws for portability. Wire pnpm scripts: server:dev, server:test. Ensure Jest spins ephemeral server for integration tests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run all tests from 3.1 and ensure the harness boots a server per test and tears down cleanly.

Add parse/serialize helpers and discriminated unions. Version messages with v field for forward compatibility. Include error schema for server errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests from 3.1 TC010 validating success/failure paths and round-trip serialization.

subtasks.title: Authentication and scoping middleware

subtasks.details: On connection upgrade, parse token from query/header; validate format and map to {userId, campaignId, sessionId, roles} via a dev in-memory verifier. Attach auth context to ws. Reject unauthenticated with close code 4001. Maintain a connection registry keyed by sessionId/userId. Ensure all incoming messages are checked against the connection's campaign/session scope.

subtasks.title: Channel model and membership enforcement
subtasks.description: Add server-side channel registry for 1:1, room/proximity, team/line, party/alliance topics with membership rules.
subtasks.details: Design ChannelId type {kind, key} where kind ∈ {direct, room, team, party}. Implement membership service: direct = {a,b}; room/proximity based on session state map; team and party via role/team assignments. Provide join/leave handlers updating membership and presence state. Enforce on publish: block if not a member. Maintain indexes: channel->connections and connection->channels.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC002: attempts to publish without membership fail; after join, messages fan out only to members; presence events sent on join/leave.

subtasks.title: Message routing and handlers per type
subtasks.description: Implement dispatch loop validating messages with zod and routing to appropriate channels with structured logs.
subtasks.details: On message, parse Envelope with zod; reject invalid with error envelope. Route: voice-meta and caption to channel members; action to channel or targeted users; ticker-update broadcast to session scope; crdt-sync enqueue to CRDT module hook (stub for Task 20). Add tracing context (requestId) in logs. Prevent echo to sender when not desired.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend TC002 and add cases for each type to ensure correct targeting and schema validation errors.

subtasks.title: Heartbeat, idle detection, and reconnect tokens
subtasks.description: Add pings at configured interval, close idle connections, and implement reconnect tokens to restore subscriptions.
subtasks.details: Implement server ping loop; mark connection alive on pong; if missed N pings, close with 4002. On close, persist a reconnect token mapping to prior subscriptions and presence for RECONNECT_TTL in memory. On reconnect with token and same auth, restore channel memberships and emit presence restored events.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC015: simulate dropped client; verify disconnect then reconnect with token restores subscriptions and presence notifications.

subtasks.title: Backpressure control and send queue
subtasks.description: Implement per-connection buffered send queues with size caps and policies for slow consumers.
subtasks.details: Wrap ws.send with a queue. If socket bufferedAmount exceeds BACKPRESSURE_LIMIT or queue length exceeds limit, apply policy: drop oldest non-critical messages (e.g., voice-meta, ticker-update) marked best-effort; retain critical (join/leave, action, crdt-sync). Expose metrics. Notify sender of drops via control messages.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC016: create artificial slow consumer; assert queue caps are enforced and best-effort drops occur with notifications; ensure no process crash.

subtasks.title: Client retry strategy and exponential backoff utilities

subtasks.details: Implement backoff.ts with base, cap, jitter. Include recommended retry-after hints in close frames for 4002/overload conditions. Provide sample client harness in tests using the utility to validate retries and eventual reconnect with token.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC012 for utility sequence; integration verifies retries escalate and reconnect succeeds without storming the server.

subtasks.details: Implement a token bucket with configurable tokens/sec and burst. Apply per incoming message before parsing heavy payloads. On exceed, send error envelope and optionally temporarily mute or close with 4003 on sustained abuse. Exempt heartbeat pings/pongs.

tasks.title: Provider Adapter Framework (LLM/STT/TTS/Image/Video/Embeddings)
tasks.description: Design provider-agnostic adapter interfaces selectable at runtime, with registry and config UI.
tasks.details:
- Define interfaces in shared: LLMAdapter, STTAdapter, TTSAdapter, ImageGenAdapter, VideoGenAdapter (flag), EmbeddingsAdapter
- Adapter capabilities describe models, cost, token limits, streaming support
- Registry loads adapters via config; hot-switch per campaign/session
- Initial implementations (MVP):
  - LLM: OpenAI-compatible, local Ollama; STT: Vosk/Whisper local; TTS: Coqui XTTS or system; Image: Stable Diffusion (Automatic1111 or ComfyUI HTTP); Embeddings: text-embedding via local model
  - Video placeholder adapter disabled by flag
- A/B harness scaffold: route % traffic or paired eval; capture latency/tokens to llm_messages
tasks.testStrategy:
- Unit tests ensure each adapter conforms to interface and error handling
- TC011–TC013 partial: conformance checks and metrics capture
- Config UI allows switching providers; persistence in settings without storing raw keys

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and unit/integration tests (TC011–TC013, UI config switching)
subtasks.description: Before implementation, author test suites that define core acceptance criteria for the provider-agnostic adapter framework, registry selection, runtime hot-switching, capability metadata, metrics capture, and config UI switching. Include at least: unit tests for each adapter interface conformance and error handling, integration tests for registry loading and hot-switch per campaign/session, and a UI test for provider switching persistence without storing raw API keys.
subtasks.details: Create test plan mapping: TC011 – adapter conformance and capability reporting; TC012 – metrics capture (latency/tokens) into llm_messages; TC013 – runtime switching via registry/config. Add a UI test case for switching providers and persisting selection. Set up test scaffolding in repo: - shared/tests/adapters/*.spec.ts for interface conformance. - services/registry/*.spec.ts for registry resolution and hot-switch. - db/tests/llm_messages_metrics.spec.ts for metrics capture. - webapp/e2e/config-provider-switch.spec.ts for UI switching. Stub provider mocks for: OpenAI-compatible LLM, Ollama LLM, Whisper local STT, Vosk STT, Coqui XTTS TTS, system TTS, Stable Diffusion (A1111/ComfyUI HTTP), local embeddings. Define fixtures for campaign/session contexts. Define redaction expectations for secrets. Do not implement framework yet; tests should initially fail.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use Jest/Vitest for unit/integration, Playwright/Cypress for UI. Create mocks for network calls. Seed sqlite/test DB for llm_messages. Verify: - Each adapter implements required methods and capability descriptors. - Consistent error mapping across adapters. - Registry loads adapters from config and supports per-campaign and per-session overrides. - Hot-switching does not require process restart. - A/B harness routes by percentage and paired eval mode. - Metrics recorded with latency and token counts. - Config UI switching persists provider keys via secrets manager reference, not raw key.

subtasks.title: Define shared adapter interfaces and capability descriptors
subtasks.description: Implement TypeScript interfaces in shared module: LLMAdapter, STTAdapter, TTSAdapter, ImageGenAdapter, VideoGenAdapter (gated by feature flag), EmbeddingsAdapter. Include standardized request/response shapes, streaming support, and capability descriptors for models, token/context limits, cost, and features.
subtasks.details: In packages/shared/adapters/: define base types. Common: AdapterId, ProviderName, Capability { models: string[], cost: { inputPer1K?: number; outputPer1K?: number; unit?: 'tokens'|'sec'|'image' }, maxTokens?: number, contextWindow?: number, streaming?: boolean, languages?: string[], notes?: string }. Add result/error types and standardized error codes (AdapterErrorCode: 'RATE_LIMIT'|'AUTH'|'UNAVAILABLE'|'TIMEOUT'|'VALIDATION'|'UNKNOWN'). - LLMAdapter: methods: chat(options: { messages: ChatMessage[]; model?: string; temperature?: number; maxTokens?: number; stream?: boolean; tools?: ToolDef[] }): Promise<LLMResult> | AsyncIterable<LLMDelta>; embed(texts: string[]): Promise<number[][]> optional? keep separate in EmbeddingsAdapter per spec. - STTAdapter: transcribe(input: AudioInput, options?): Promise<STTResult>; supports streaming? add streamTranscribe(inputStream, options?): AsyncIterable<STTDelta>. - TTSAdapter: synthesize(input: { text: string; voiceId?: string; rate?: number; volume?: number; format?: 'wav'|'mp3' }, options?): Promise<TTSResult>; streamSynthesize? AsyncIterable<AudioChunk & Timestamps?>. - ImageGenAdapter: generate(input: { prompt: string; negativePrompt?: string; width?: number; height?: number; style?: Record<string, any>; seed?: number }, options?): Promise<ImageResult>; getStatus?(id): Promise<ImageStatus>. - VideoGenAdapter: behind feature flag; define interface similar to Image with disabled default implementation. - EmbeddingsAdapter: embed(texts: string[], options?): Promise<{ vectors: number[][]; model: string }>. Export Capability descriptors in each adapter via getCapabilities(): Promise<Capability>. Include type guards and zod schemas for validation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run tests from 5.1. Ensure type conformance tests compile and fail until implementations; then update tests to import interfaces and validate shape using runtime zod schemas. Verify capability schemas validation and error code enums.

subtasks.title: Implement adapter error normalization and metrics hooks
subtasks.description: Create shared error normalization utility and metrics hook contracts used by all adapters to map provider-specific errors to standardized codes and to capture latency, token counts, and payload sizes.
subtasks.details: Add packages/shared/adapters/errors.ts with AdapterError extends Error { code: AdapterErrorCode; provider?: string; raw?: unknown; httpStatus?: number }. Provide normalizeError(provider, rawError): AdapterError with mappings for common HTTP codes/timeouts. Add metrics interface: AdapterMetricsSink { onRequestStart(ctx), onRequestEnd(ctx, metrics), onRequestError(ctx, err) }. Define Metrics types: { latencyMs, inputTokens?, outputTokens?, bytesIn?, bytesOut?, model }. Implement default no-op sink and allow dependency injection via adapter constructors. Provide helper timers and token estimation hooks for OpenAI/Ollama models using encoding libs when exact not available.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests assert mapping of simulated provider errors to AdapterError codes (TC011/TC012). Verify metrics hooks invoked and capture latency; assert token estimation fallback triggers when providers don't return counts.

subtasks.title: Build Adapter Registry with runtime selection and hot-switching
subtasks.description: Implement a registry that loads adapter instances from configuration, supports per-campaign and per-session overrides, and allows hot-switching without restart.
subtasks.details: Create packages/core/registry/AdapterRegistry.ts. Expose: register(type: 'llm'|'stt'|'tts'|'image'|'video'|'embeddings', id: string, factory: (cfg, deps)=>Adapter); get(type, context: { campaignId?: string; sessionId?: string }): Adapter; list(type): AdapterInfo[]. Load config from settings service (Task 2/4 deps) with schema: providers: { llm: { default: 'openai', perCampaign: { [id]: 'ollama' }, perSession: { [id]: 'openai' } }, ... } and providerConfigs: { openai: { apiKeyRef: 'secret://openai' , baseUrl? }, ollama: { host }, ... }. Implement watcher on config changes to recreate instances lazily. Support hot-switch by context: registry resolves provider id by session override > campaign override > default. Ensure secrets resolved via secrets manager refs (no raw keys kept).
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests from 5.1 should now pass for registry resolution and hot-switch (TC013). Add additional tests for config change triggering provider replacement between calls without process restart.

subtasks.title: MVP LLM adapters: OpenAI-compatible and local Ollama
subtasks.description: Implement two LLMAdapter providers: OpenAI-compatible (chat/completions APIs) and Ollama local. Support streaming and token metrics capture.
subtasks.details: Create packages/providers/llm/openaiAdapter.ts supporting baseUrl override and model listing via /models when available. Streaming via SSE chunks -> AsyncIterable<LLMDelta>. Capture input/output tokens from response if present; else estimate. Implement tool/function call mapping. Create packages/providers/llm/ollamaAdapter.ts using ollama HTTP API (/api/chat, /api/generate) with stream support; map responses to LLMResult/LLMDelta. Provide getCapabilities() with models, contextWindow if known, streaming true, cost unknown or zero for local. Use metrics sink injection and error normalization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests per adapter: conformance, streaming emits deltas, errors normalized (TC011). Integration: registry returns correct adapter by config, A/B routing harness scaffolding can call both and capture metrics (TC012/TC013).

subtasks.title: MVP STT adapters: Whisper local and Vosk
subtasks.description: Implement STTAdapter providers for local Whisper and Vosk engines, with optional streaming if supported, unified timestamps output when available.
subtasks.details: Implement providers/stt/whisperLocalAdapter.ts wrapping local whisper CLI/server; providers/stt/voskAdapter.ts wrapping Vosk model via node binding or HTTP microservice. Normalize outputs to STTResult { text, words?: [{ start, end, word }], language? }. Support streamTranscribe when engine supports partials. Integrate error normalization and metrics (latency).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: adapter conformance, error paths, timestamp presence/absence handled. Integration: registry selection and switching. Performance smoke test optional.

subtasks.title: MVP TTS adapters: Coqui XTTS and System TTS
subtasks.description: Implement TTSAdapter providers for Coqui XTTS (local/server) and a basic System TTS fallback. Provide optional timestamp/captions when available.
subtasks.details: providers/tts/coquiXttsAdapter.ts: call local XTTS server; support voiceId; streamSynthesize if API supports chunks; map viseme/phoneme timestamps if available. providers/tts/systemAdapter.ts: use OS TTS or simple offline engine; no timestamps by default. Both emit audio format metadata and integrate metrics.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: conformance, voice params mapping, error normalization. Integration: registry switching; verify absence of timestamps triggers documented fallback behavior.

subtasks.title: MVP Image generation adapters: Stable Diffusion (A1111 and ComfyUI HTTP)
subtasks.description: Implement ImageGenAdapter providers for Stable Diffusion via Automatic1111 and ComfyUI HTTP APIs, with job status polling and seed/style controls.
subtasks.details: providers/image/sdA1111Adapter.ts calling /sdapi/v1/txt2img/img2img; handle negative prompts, width/height, seed, steps. providers/image/comfyUiAdapter.ts building graph payload; submit, poll status, retrieve image. Normalize outputs to ImageResult { id, images: [Buffer|assetRef], seed?, metadata }. Add getStatus(id) for long jobs. Integrate metrics and error normalization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: payload building and parameter mapping; error cases. Integration: registry selection; ensure long-running job status works. These adapters will be used by Task 8 tests (TC003).

subtasks.title: MVP Embeddings adapter: local model
subtasks.description: Implement EmbeddingsAdapter for a local text-embedding model (e.g., sentence-transformers or llama.cpp embeddings), returning float vectors and model name.
subtasks.details: providers/embeddings/localAdapter.ts: wrap local service or on-device library; batch inputs; return consistent vector length; include model id in result. Add capability descriptor with cost=0 and supported languages.

subtasks.title: Feature-flagged VideoGenAdapter placeholder
subtasks.description: Create a disabled-by-default VideoGenAdapter placeholder behind a feature flag, returning a clear NotEnabled error on invocation.
subtasks.details: Define FeatureFlag 'video.gen.enabled'. Implement providers/video/placeholderAdapter.ts that implements interface but throws AdapterError{ code:'UNAVAILABLE', message:'Video generation disabled by feature flag' }. Register only when flag true; otherwise registry returns placeholder for clarity.

subtasks.title: A/B harness scaffold and paired evaluation
subtasks.description: Implement routing harness to send a percentage of traffic to alternate provider or perform paired evaluations, capturing metrics and persisting to llm_messages.
subtasks.details: Create core/ab/AbHarness.ts supporting modes: percentageSplit{ controlId, variantId, percent }, pairedEval{ aId, bId }. For percentage, randomly route per request using stable hash of session to meet target percent. For paired, call both adapters, store both outputs with linkage id. Integrate metrics sink to write latency/token counts into db.llm_messages with columns: request_id, provider_id, latency_ms, input_tokens, output_tokens, mode, paired_group_id. Provide API to configure per campaign/session.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests (TC012/TC013): verify distribution within tolerance over N requests; paired eval stores two records linked by group id; metrics captured. Property tests for stable routing by session hash.

Add DAO functions logLLMCallMetrics(ctx, data). Wire metrics sink default implementation to call DAO when type='llm'. Prepare views or queries for analytics.

subtasks.title: Security: secrets handling and redaction

subtasks.details: Create secrets module to resolve secret:// refs at runtime from OS keyring/env/VAULT. Inject resolved keys into adapter factories only in-memory. Implement redact(obj) utility to filter keys matching patterns (apiKey, token, Authorization) from logs and errors. Add interceptors to strip secrets from error.raw. Update config UI to only store secretRef strings.

tasks.title: Voice Capture, VAD, STT Pipeline with Captions and Diarization
tasks.description: Implement client voice capture with VAD, push-to-talk fallback, streaming STT, captions rendering, and speaker diarization.
tasks.details:
- Web Audio API + MediaStream; VAD via webrtcvad-wasm; PTT UI toggle
- Stream opus/pcm chunks over WebSocket to server; server forwards to STT adapter
- Diarization: simple client-side speaker tagging by connection id; optional pyannote server bridge later
- Captions: render per speaker with timestamps; adjustable rate/volume controls; accessibility semantics
- Latency target: STT < 800 ms median; use partial hypotheses streaming
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC001: join/voice/action: verify transcript and captions visible in multi-client session
- Measure end-to-end latency with synthetic audio and assert median <800ms locally
- Packet loss simulation to ensure graceful degradation

subtasks.title: Define acceptance tests for voice→captions pipeline (unit + integration)
subtasks.description: Write automated tests that codify the core acceptance criteria: capture mic audio, VAD-driven start/stop with push-to-talk fallback, stream to STT over WebSocket, receive partial/final transcripts, render captions per speaker with timestamps, and basic diarization tags. Include latency and packet loss scenarios.
subtasks.details:
Create a test plan and scaffolding before implementation.
- Unit tests:
  - TC001-U1: VAD state machine transitions (silence→speech→silence) with synthetic PCM frames.
  - TC001-U2: Audio chunker frames at configured size (e.g., 20 ms or 100 ms) and encodes PCM/Opus correctly.
  - TC001-U3: STT adapter client merges partial hypotheses into stable final transcripts.
  - TC001-U4: Caption formatting includes timestamps and speaker tag.
  - TC001-U5: PTT toggle enforces capture-on-hold behavior and bypasses VAD.
- Integration/UI tests:
  - TC001-I1 (maps to TC001): Two simulated clients join a session via WS gateway, stream synthetic audio, verify captions appear for both with correct speaker tags and ordering.
  - TC001-I2: Latency measurement harness injects prerecorded audio and asserts median end-to-end STT latency under 800 ms locally.
  - TC001-I3: Packet loss simulator drops 5–10% WS frames; verify graceful degradation (no crash, captions may have gaps but UI stable).
Artifacts: test utilities to synthesize sinewave/speech-like PCM; a mock STT server emitting partial/final hypotheses; DOM testing for captions region with ARIA roles.
subtasks.testStrategy: Implement with Jest/Vitest + Playwright. Provide a WS mock server, a fake STT adapter, and a clock/HRTime probe for latency. Ensure tests run headless and record metrics.

subtasks.title: Audio capture module with Web Audio API and permissions
subtasks.description: Implement microphone capture using MediaDevices.getUserMedia and Web Audio API, exposing a readable stream of mono PCM frames with configurable sample rate and frame size.
subtasks.details:
Build an AudioCapture class:
- Request mic: navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({ audio: { channelCount: 1, echoCancellation: false, noiseSuppression: false, autoGainControl: false, sampleRate: 16000 } }).
- Use AudioWorklet (preferred) or ScriptProcessor fallback to pull Float32 audio.
- Resample to 16 kHz mono if necessary (polyphase or linear with anti-aliasing).
- Convert Float32 [-1,1] to 16-bit PCM Int16Array frames of N ms (start with 20 ms frames; allow config up to 100 ms for efficiency/latency tradeoff).
- Expose events: onStart, onStop, onFrame(Int16Array, timestamp).
- Handle permission errors and device changes; provide start/stop/dispose methods.
- Disable AGC/noise suppression per provider best practices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run tests from 6.1; add unit tests to validate resampler correctness (RMS/energy preserved within tolerance), frame sizing, and error handling. Mock getUserMedia and AudioWorklet.

subtasks.title: Voice Activity Detection (VAD) integration with webrtcvad-wasm
subtasks.description: Wire up VAD to gate audio frames into speech segments with configurable aggressiveness and hangover time, emitting start/stop speech events.
subtasks.details:
Implement VADController:
- Load webrtcvad-wasm module; initialize with mode (0–3) aggressiveness.
- Feed 10/20/30 ms 16 kHz PCM frames as required by WebRTC VAD.
- Maintain ring buffer to smooth decisions; parameters: pre-roll (e.g., 200 ms), hangover (e.g., 300 ms).
- Emit events: onSpeechStart, onSpeechEnd, onSpeechFrame.
- Provide thresholds to avoid choppy toggling; expose metrics (speech ratio, decisions/sec).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests (from 6.1 TC001-U1) with synthetic voiced/unvoiced signals; verify transitions and pre-roll/hangover behavior. Property tests to ensure decisions deterministic.

subtasks.title: Push-to-talk (PTT) UI and control flow
subtasks.description: Create a UI toggle/button to enable push-to-talk, bypassing VAD when pressed/held and muting capture when released, with full keyboard accessibility.
subtasks.details:
Implement a PTTButton component:
- States: idle, pressed, locked (toggle mode), disabled.
- Keyboard: Space/Enter to press/hold; toggle via T; ARIA role='button', aria-pressed.
- Integrate with capture pipeline: when PTT active, forward frames regardless of VAD; when inactive, rely on VAD.
- Visual feedback (recording indicator) and tooltip. Persist user preference for VAD/PTT mode.
- Debounce to avoid flapping on quick taps.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests: simulate keyboard/mouse; verify state changes and that frames are forwarded while held. Map to TC001-U5 and TC001-I1 checks for accessibility attributes.

subtasks.title: Opus/PCM framing and WebSocket client streaming
subtasks.description: Implement audio chunker and WS client to send PCM or Opus-encoded frames to server with metadata for session and speaker.
subtasks.details:
Build StreamSender:
- Config: encoding=PCM16 or Opus; frameDurationMs (20/40/60/100); maxBufferedFrames; reconnect/backoff.
- For Opus, integrate encoder (e.g., opus-recorder/opus-media-recorder or wasm opus) at 16 kHz mono, bitrate ~16–24 kbps, complexity tuned for latency.
- Package messages: { type: 'audio-chunk', ts, seq, encoding, sampleRate, speakerId, sessionId, channelId, payload }.
- Handle backpressure: if WS bufferedAmount exceeds threshold, drop or downsample per policy and mark with loss hints.
- Heartbeat pings and resume with seq continuity; include reconnect token.
- Security: do not include PII; use session token from Task 3 auth.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: encode/decode sanity, framing correctness, seq monotonicity, backpressure behavior. Integration: echo server validates schema and ordering; packet loss injection for TC001-I3.

subtasks.title: STT adapter client with partial/final hypothesis handling
subtasks.description: Implement client-side STT stream handler that receives partial and final transcripts from the server and assembles utterances with timestamps.
subtasks.details:
STTClient:
- WS message types: stt-partial, stt-final, stt-error; include seq, speakerId, startTs, endTs, text, confidence.
- Maintain per-speaker utterance buffer: update partial text in place; finalize on stt-final.
- Emit events: onPartial(utterance), onFinal(utterance), onError.
- Track timings for latency: first-partial latency, final latency.
- Handle out-of-order messages via seq; merge corrections.
- Configurable provider hints (languageCode, punctuation, interimResults=true).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests (TC001-U3): merging logic, corrections, and event emission. Integration: with mock STT server producing partials/finals; record latency for TC001-I2.

subtasks.title: Client-side diarization tagging by connection/session
subtasks.description: Assign a stable speakerId per client connection and attach it to audio and caption events; prepare hook for future server-side diarization bridge.
subtasks.details:
Implement SpeakerTagger:
- Derive speakerId from WS connection id or assigned session user id from gateway.
- Provide map of speakerId→displayName/color; persist locally.
- Attach speakerId to outgoing audio chunks and consume on incoming captions.
- Define interface for optional server diarization (pyannote) later: accept speaker change events and remap segments post-hoc.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: verify stable speakerId across reconnects using reconnect token; ensure mapping applied to messages. Integration (TC001-I1): two clients produce distinct speaker tags.

subtasks.title: Captions rendering component with accessibility semantics
subtasks.description: Render streaming captions per speaker with timestamps, interim updates, and ARIA-compliant semantics and controls for rate/volume.
subtasks.details:
Implement CaptionsPanel:
- Regions per speaker with color tokens; show partial text updating in place; finalize into scrollback with start–end timestamps.
- Keyboard navigable; ARIA live region='polite' for partials; role='log' for history.
- Controls: caption visibility toggle, adjustable TTS speech rate/volume sliders tied to settings; WCAG AA contrast tokens.
- Virtualized list for performance; time formatting; copy/export transcript.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests: verify live updates, finalization, keyboard focus order, ARIA roles. Integration (TC001-I1): captions visible in multi-client session and per-speaker segregation.

subtasks.title: Latency optimization and measurement hooks
subtasks.description: Implement measurement probes and tune frame sizes, buffering, and encoder settings to achieve <800 ms median STT partial latency locally.
subtasks.details: Add high-resolution timers around pipeline stages: capture→chunk→send→server→partial→render. Expose metrics to console/overlay. Tune defaults: 20–40 ms frame size, immediate send on frame, Nagle disabled, Opus lookahead minimized, interimResults enabled. Provide config to trade efficiency vs latency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC001-I2: feed synthetic audio, record latencies, assert median under 800 ms. Regression test to fail if exceeded.

subtasks.title: Packet loss tolerance and reconnection handling
subtasks.description: Ensure graceful behavior under dropped audio or STT messages with retries/backoff and UI resilience.
subtasks.details:
Implement loss handling:
- Audio chunks include seq; gaps are tolerated and flagged.
- Partial timeout fallback: if partials stall, finalize best-effort segment.
- Reconnect WS with exponential backoff; resubscribe to channels; restore speaker mapping.
- UI shows subtle loss indicator but continues rendering.
- Backpressure policy: drop oldest non-sent frames when buffer high.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute TC001-I3 with 5–10% drop; verify no crashes, reconnect works, captions continue. Unit tests for backoff schedule and timeout finalization.

subtasks.title: Server gateway interop and schema validation
subtasks.description: Validate integration with Realtime WebSocket Gateway schemas and message types, using shared zod schemas for strict validation.
subtasks.details: Import shared schema package; validate outbound audio-chunk and inbound stt-* messages. Ensure channel scoping (room/team/etc.) obeys membership. Include rate limiting hints and heartbeat compatibility. Map to Task 3 message types: voice-meta, caption, action as needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests with gateway test harness (from Task 3): multi-client join/leave, audio routing metadata distribution per TC002 mapping, and schema conformance.

subtasks.title: Settings persistence and controls (rate/volume, caption toggle)
subtasks.description: Persist user preferences for captions visibility, speech rate, and volume locally and apply on load.
subtasks.details: Implement SettingsStore (localStorage/indexedDB): keys for captionsEnabled, speechRate, speechVolume, PTT/VAD mode. Provide hooks/context to read/write. Ensure defaults sane and synced to UI controls.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit/UI tests: change settings, reload app, confirm persistence and application. Axe checks for controls accessibility.

subtasks.title: Security, privacy, and consent prompts for recording
subtasks.description: Add explicit user consent UI for recording and transmitting audio; ensure no PII in telemetry and secure handling of media streams.
subtasks.details: Consent modal/banner before first capture with clear language; store consent flag. Redact PII in logs; avoid storing raw audio locally. Use secure WS (wss) and session tokens. Provide quick mic mute control and indicator.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests: consent required before capture begins; verify logs contain no audio payloads or PII. Negative tests: decline consent prevents capture.

subtasks.title: Optional server-side diarization bridge hook (pyannote-ready)
subtasks.description: Prepare client to accept server diarization segments and remap displayed speakers post-hoc without breaking UX.
subtasks.details: Define WS message type 'diarization-update' with segments [{start,end,speakerLabel,confidence}]. Implement reconciler to reassign captions in time ranges; maintain mapping and update colors/labels smoothly. Conflict resolution: client tag vs server diarization preference toggle.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration test: feed diarization updates after initial captions; verify UI remaps segments and preserves ordering without flicker.

subtasks.title: End-to-end scenario tests and documentation
subtasks.description: Finalize E2E tests covering common flows and document setup, configs, and troubleshooting for the pipeline.
subtasks.details: Add Playwright E2E covering: VAD-only session, PTT session, multi-client captions, reconnect scenario, settings persistence, and diarization updates. Write README with architecture diagram, configuration options (frame size, encoding), and performance tuning tips.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run full suite including TC001, latency goal, and packet loss. Ensure green before marking task complete.

tasks.title: TTS Synthesis per NPC with Controls
tasks.description: Add TTS playback per speaker/NPC with adjustable rate/volume and caption sync.
tasks.details:
- TTS adapter streaming; audioWorklet playback; queue per channel
- Voice identity map per NPC; cache synthesized clips by text+voice hash in cache
- Controls: rate, volume, mute per channel; caption sync from TTS timestamps if available
tasks.testStrategy:
- Unit: caching key correctness; fallbacks when timestamps unavailable
- UX test: adjust rate/volume; ensure captions track
- Performance: TTS <1.2s for ~150 chars median using local model settings

subtasks.title: Write tests for per-NPC TTS playback, controls, caching, and caption sync (TC001, TC002, TC005)
subtasks.description: Author unit and integration/UI tests that define acceptance criteria for TTS playback per NPC channel with adjustable rate/volume/mute, queueing, caching by text+voice hash, and caption synchronization using timestamps or graceful fallback.
subtasks.details:
Implement test suites before any production code:
- Unit tests:
  - TC001: Cache key stability and correctness. Given same text and voice identity, expect cache hit; different text or voice → miss. Include Unicode and punctuation normalization cases.
  - TC002: Channel queue behavior. Enqueue multiple utterances per NPC; ensure FIFO playback order and non-blocking behavior across different NPC channels.
  - TC005: Caption mapping. Given TTS word/phoneme timestamps, verify caption segments align to ranges and produce correct text highlighting indices; when timestamps absent, verify fallback to timed chunks proportional to text length.
  - Control application: Verify rate/volume/mute conversions map from UI model to adapter parameters; ensure mute overrides volume.
  - Voice identity map: Ensure NPC->voice mapping persists and is read for synthesis; missing mapping falls back to default.
  - Performance harness stub: Measure mocked adapter end-to-end promise resolution under 1.2s median for ~150 chars with local mock.
- Integration/UI tests (Playwright):
  - Render multi-NPC chat; trigger TTS for two NPCs concurrently; verify independent channel state and no cross-audio bleed; UI sliders for rate/volume update live; mute toggles silence while captions continue.
  - Caption sync: During playback, verify active caption word/segment highlights track synthesized timestamps.
  - Offline/latency tolerance: With adapter providing no timestamps, verify fallback captions progress smoothly.
- Mocks/fakes:
  - TTSAdapterFake supports: streaming chunks, optional timestamps, controllable latency, and emits per-chunk events.
  - AudioWorkletMock/AudioContextMock to assert parameter changes and buffer scheduling.
- Tag tests with TC labels and map to requirements. Establish coverage thresholds ≥80% for TTS module.
- Define fixtures: sample texts (ASCII, Unicode/emoji, punctuation), voices, NPC IDs, campaign IDs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests in Jest with fake timers for playback scheduling; use Playwright for UI scenarios with WebAudio and Worklet mocks. Add performance assertions with soft thresholds and artifacts on failure.

subtasks.title: Design TTS channel architecture and interfaces
subtasks.description: Define core interfaces and data models for TTS channels per NPC, adapter abstraction, queue items, controls state, and caption events.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate interface types compile; add minimal smoke unit tests for hash builder and model invariants. Run tests from 7.1 and ensure compile passes.

subtasks.title: Implement voice identity map per NPC
subtasks.description: Create a persistent mapping from NPC IDs to voice identities with defaults and overrides, including loading/saving.
subtasks.details:
Build VoiceRegistry module:
- API: getVoice(npcId): voiceId; setVoice(npcId, voiceId); getDefault(): voiceId; setDefault(voiceId).
- Persistence: store in project settings or per-campaign config; namespace by campaign_id if available; provide migration-safe schema.
- Validation: ensure voiceId exists in supported voices list from adapter; fallback to default on invalid.
- Events: emit 'voiceChanged' for UI to refresh.
- Tie into TTSService so enqueue uses VoiceRegistry.getVoice(npcId) unless explicit override provided.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: set/get, default fallback, invalid voiceId handling, campaign scoping. Run existing tests; ensure no regressions.

subtasks.title: Implement text+voice hash-based clip cache
subtasks.description: Add an in-memory + on-disk cache keyed by stable hash of text and voice identity to reuse synthesized audio and timestamps.
subtasks.details:
Cache module:
- Key builder: hash = SHA-256(JSON.stringify({text: normalize(text), voiceId})) returning hex; ensure deterministic order.
- Store: LRU in-memory (e.g., 128 entries) and persistent file cache per-campaign subdir; index mapping key→metadata (durationMs, hasTimestamps, createdAt, version).
- Values: PCM data (Float32Array) or encoded (Opus/PCM WAV) plus optional timestamps.
- API: get(key)→{audio, timestamps}?; put(key, value); has(key).
- Serialization: use chunked file format or simple JSON+binary split; checksum for corruption.
- Invalidate on version bump or voice change.
- Thread-safety: guard concurrent puts; de-dupe concurrent inflight requests via promise memoization.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests from TC001 validate key stability and hit/miss. Add tests for persistence roundtrip and invalidation. Run full suite; fix failing cases.

subtasks.title: Build per-NPC channel queue and dispatcher
subtasks.description: Create TTSService to manage independent queues per NPC, ensuring FIFO playback within a channel and concurrency across channels.
subtasks.details:
Implement TTSService:
- Data: Map<npcId, NPCChannel> with queue array and state.
- API: enqueue(npcId, text, options?): returns utteranceId; clear(npcId); skipCurrent(npcId); pause/resume.
- Dispatcher: one async loop per channel processes queue items; resolves from cache or synthesizes via adapter; emits events; ensures errors do not break loop.
- Concurrency: channels run independently via separate tasks.
- Backpressure: cap queue length per channel; drop or merge policy configurable.
- Cancellation: abort controller per utterance; skip should stop current synthesis and playback gracefully.
- Telemetry: timings for synthesis, cache hit ratio, latency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests from TC002 cover FIFO and independence; add tests for skip/pause/resume. Run tests; ensure deterministic with fake timers.

subtasks.title: Integrate streaming TTS adapter and fallback
subtasks.description: Wire a streaming TTSAdapter that yields audio chunks and optional timestamps; include a no-timestamps fallback adapter for offline/local model.
subtasks.details:
Adapter layer:
- Define StreamingAdapter implementation using existing provider integration (or local model). It should respect rate and volume parameters where supported, else adjust in AudioEngine.
- Provide feature flag for timestamps availability (supportsTimestamps).
- Normalize timestamps to WordTimestamp[] aligned to original text; map phoneme/viseme if provider returns them.
- Error handling: retries with jitter; surface structured errors to TTSService.
- FallbackAdapter: returns audio without timestamps; set supportsTimestamps=false.
- Ensure adapters are swappable via DI to support tests/mocks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend adapter unit tests with mocked provider responses. Ensure TC005 caption tests pass with both adapters. Run full suite.

subtasks.title: Implement AudioWorklet-based playback engine per channel
subtasks.description: Create AudioEngine with an AudioContext and an AudioWorkletNode per NPC channel, supporting buffer scheduling, rate, volume, and mute.
subtasks.details:
AudioEngine design:
- One shared AudioContext; per-channel WorkletNode instance with parameters: gain (volume), playbackRate, mute flag.
- Buffer queue: accept PCM Float32 buffers from TTSService; schedule via ring buffer in Worklet; low-latency streaming.
- Controls: setRate(npcId, rate), setVolume(npcId, volume), setMute(npcId, boolean); clamp ranges and smooth changes (ramps) to avoid clicks.
- End-of-stream and underflow handling; pause/resume map to context suspend/resume or per-channel gating.
- Clock: expose currentTime mapping to ms for caption alignment.
- Platform fallback: if Worklet unsupported, use ScriptProcessor as fallback with a feature flag.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests with AudioWorkletMock verify parameter changes propagate and buffers consumed. UI tests adjust sliders and observe audible changes via analyser-node metrics or mock assertions. Run all tests.

subtasks.title: Caption synchronization and highlighting
subtasks.description: Translate TTS timestamps into caption events and provide fallback time-based segmentation when timestamps are unavailable.
subtasks.details:
CaptionSync module:
- If timestamps present: build segments/word-level map; emit CaptionEvent updates on audio clock progression; support per-word highlight.
- If absent: estimate duration from audio buffer length; segment text into words/phrases; assign proportional timings; update on clock.
- Handle punctuation and Unicode graphemes with Intl.Segmenter; keep char indices consistent with normalized text used in cache key.
- Provide API: subscribe(utteranceId, listener), unsubscribe; and getCurrent(utteranceId).
- Edge cases: fast/slow rate changes in-flight adjust mapping; seeking unsupported; pause/resume maintain indices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Leverage TC005 tests to verify alignment under both modes. Add unit tests for segmentation with emojis/RTL scripts. Run suite.

subtasks.title: User controls UI and state management for per-channel rate/volume/mute
subtasks.description: Add UI controls per NPC channel to adjust rate, volume, and mute in real time, reflecting state from the TTSService and AudioEngine.
subtasks.details:
UI implementation:
- For each NPC panel, render sliders: rate (0.5x–2.0x), volume (0–1), and a mute toggle.
- Bind to TTSService control APIs; debounce updates and apply smooth ramps.
- Display current voice name; allow change via dropdown to update VoiceRegistry.
- Show live caption highlight under the current utterance.
- Accessibility: keyboard operable, ARIA labels, focus order.
- Persist last-used controls per NPC in state store; reset on campaign switch.
subtasks.testStrategy: Playwright tests: adjust controls and verify AudioEngine parameter changes and audible output (via mock metrics). Verify captions follow. Ensure multi-NPC independence. Run all tests and fix failures.

subtasks.title: Performance optimization and latency budget enforcement
subtasks.description: Ensure median time-to-first-audio under 1.2s for ~150 chars using local settings; optimize buffering, caching, and concurrency.
subtasks.details:
Optimizations:
- Start playback on first buffered chunk threshold (e.g., 100–200ms) while continuing to stream.
- Decode/convert audio off main thread (Worklet/Worker).
- Pre-warm adapter connections; memoize inflight synthesis by identical key.
- Measure TTFB and total synthesis durations; log to telemetry.
- Cache fast-path: on hit, schedule immediately.
- Rate/volume applied in Worklet avoids re-synthesis.
- Configurable chunk size to balance latency vs. stability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Add performance tests using mock adapter timing and real AudioContext in headless mode where possible. Assert median <1.2s across 20 runs. Keep artifacts on failures. Run full suite.

subtasks.title: Error handling, fallbacks, and resilience
subtasks.description: Harden the system to handle synthesis errors, audio underflow, unsupported features, and cancellation without crashing channels.
subtasks.details:
Implement:
- Retry with exponential backoff for transient adapter failures; circuit-breaker to avoid thrashing.
- Graceful underflow handling: insert short silence buffers; keep captions paused.
- Provider capability detection to switch to fallback adapter.
- Timeouts for synthesis; propagate user-visible error to UI toast and event bus.
- Ensure skip/pause/resume/cancel consistently clean resources; avoid memory leaks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests simulate adapter failures and timeouts; verify retries and UI error surfacing. Integration tests skip/cancel mid-utterance. Run whole suite.

subtasks.title: Wire campaign isolation for TTS assets and channels
subtasks.description: Scope caches, voice mappings, and realtime events by campaign_id to avoid cross-campaign leakage.
subtasks.details:
Integrate with campaign context:
- Namespaced cache directories per campaign.
- VoiceRegistry keyed by campaign_id; default can be campaign-specific.
- Event bus namespaces so captions/audio events do not cross campaigns.
- Validate channel IDs encode campaign_id.
subtasks.testStrategy: Add isolation unit tests mirroring TC017 patterns for TTS context: two campaigns active, ensure no cache or event leakage. Run suite.

tasks.testStrategy:
