subtasks.title: Write tests for image lifecycle, caching, and style profiles (TC003, Unit + Integration + UI)
subtasks.description: Before implementation, define unit, integration, and UI tests covering core acceptance criteria: prompt rendering correctness, prompt+style hash stability, lifecycle placeholder→final, cache reuse with SLA (<6s median for cached hits), provider error fallback placeholder, and campaign isolation defaults with opt-in dedup.
subtasks.details:
• Create test plan mapping: TC003 covers lifecycle, cache reuse, latency; Unit tests for prompt template rendering and hash stability; Integration tests for API lifecycle and cache hits; UI test for placeholder-to-final swap.
• Define fixtures: sample prompt templates for scene/portrait/item with variables {scene, character, item}; sample campaign style profiles (seed, artists/tags, aspect); campaign A and campaign B contexts.
• Unit tests:
  - PromptTemplateRenderer renders variables correctly; missing variables error; deterministic output for same inputs.
  - StyleProfile normalization (seed, tags ordering, aspect normalization) and hash stability across processes.
  - Hash function includes prompt, style profile, and campaign scoping flag; identical inputs produce identical hashes; different campaign IDs do not collide unless dedup allowed.
• Integration tests (API):
  - POST /images returns 202 with placeholder id, placeholder status, and polling endpoint; subsequent poll transitions to final with URL and metadata.
  - Cached request (same prompt+style, same campaign) returns final within SLA when cache is warm; record latency and assert median <6s for cached runs.
  - Provider error simulation -> placeholder remains with error state and retry guidelines; fallback placeholder asset returned.
  - Dedup across campaigns only when allow_cross_campaign_dedup=true; otherwise separate cache keys.
• UI/e2e tests:
  - Render component shows placeholder asset immediately, then swaps to final URL when status=final.
  - Local asset storage path correctness; image tag updates without layout shift.
• Performance test harness: warm the cache, then issue N=50 cached requests and compute median latency; assert <6s.
• Tag tests with IDs: TC003-LIFECYCLE, TC003-CACHE, TC003-SLA, TC003-ERROR, TC003-ISOLATION, TC003-UI.
• Define mocks for ImageGenAdapter and clock controls for deterministic timing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests first; then integration tests with in-memory DB and file store; UI tests via headless browser. Add a perf test stage gated for TC003-SLA. All subsequent subtasks must run and keep these tests passing.

subtasks.title: Design data model and migrations for images, cache indices, and campaign scoping
subtasks.description: Define the schema for images table and related indices to support lifecycle states, hashing, and campaign isolation with optional cross-campaign dedup.
subtasks.details:
• Table images: id (uuid), campaign_id (uuid), request_hash (string, indexed), prompt (text), style_profile (jsonb), type (enum: scene|portrait|item), status (enum: placeholder|processing|final|error), placeholder_url (string), final_url (string), provider (string), provider_job_id (string), error_code (string), error_message (text), allow_cross_campaign_dedup (bool, default false), created_at, updated_at.
• Unique constraint for (campaign_id, request_hash) when allow_cross_campaign_dedup=false; alternative global unique index on (request_hash) for dedup=true entries; implement via partial indices.
• Secondary table image_cache_index (optional) mapping request_hash -> images.id for fast lookups; consider materialized view or rely on images index.
• Add latency metrics table image_metrics: id, image_id, is_cached (bool), duration_ms, measured_at to support SLA validation.
• Local asset storage registry table (optional) or embed in images as asset_paths jsonb for variants and thumbnails.
• Migrations written idempotently; rollbacks provided.
• Update ORM models and repository interfaces.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run migration tests in a fresh DB; ensure indices exist; verify unique/partial index behavior for dedup and isolation. Re-run TC003-ISOLATION integration tests to ensure DB errors do not occur.

subtasks.title: Implement PromptTemplateRenderer and StyleProfile normalization + hashing
subtasks.description: Create renderer for prompt templates and canonicalization for style profiles; implement stable request hash that powers caching and dedup behavior.
subtasks.details:
• PromptTemplateRenderer: supports variables {scene, character, item, extras}; strict mode requiring all variables present; escape rules; deterministic whitespace normalization.
• StyleProfile: schema {seed:number, artists: string[], tags: string[], aspect: string | {w,h}}; normalization steps: sort artists/tags, lowercase trimmed tokens, normalize aspect to {w,h} canonical form (e.g., 16:9-> {w:16,h:9}).
• RequestHash: H = SHA256(canonical_json({prompt: rendered, style: normalized, type, model_version?, guidance?, steps?, seed, allow_cross_campaign_dedup, campaign_scope: allow_cross_campaign_dedup? 'global':'campaign:'+campaign_id}))
• Ensure stable JSON stringify: sorted keys; numeric normalization; remove non-deterministic fields.
• Expose: renderAndHash(input, style, type, campaign_id, flags) -> {renderedPrompt, hash}.
• Add unit tests from 8.1 to verify correctness and stability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests for rendering, normalization, and hashing from 8.1. Add fuzz tests for key order variations leading to same hash.

subtasks.title: Define ImageGenAdapter interface and provider error contracts
subtasks.description: Specify adapter interface and common error model to abstract providers; include retry and fallback semantics compatible with future hardening.
subtasks.details:
• Interface generateImage(request): input includes renderedPrompt, styleProfile, type, seed, aspect, size; returns {provider_job_id, eta_ms?, placeholder_url?} and a poll(job_id) -> {status: processing|final|error, final_url?, error_code?, error_message?}.
• Standardize error codes: TIMEOUT, RATE_LIMIT, PROVIDER_DOWN, INVALID_PROMPT, CONTENT_BLOCKED.
• Include ability to stream partial updates in future; for now polling.
• Provide a mock adapter for tests; wire fault injection hooks.
• Document retry hints but leave implementation for Task 23.
subtasks.testStrategy: Adapter unit tests with mocks; simulate errors and verify mapping to unified error codes used by API and lifecycle tests (TC003-ERROR).

subtasks.title: Implement /images POST API: create placeholder and enqueue generation job
subtasks.description: Build API to accept image generation requests, render prompt, compute hash, check cache, and return placeholder resource with polling link.
subtasks.details:
• Request body: {campaign_id, type, template_id or inline_template, variables, style_profile, allow_cross_campaign_dedup?:bool}.
• Steps:
  - Validate campaign context and isolation (default isolate per campaign; only allow dedup if flag true).
  - Render prompt and compute request_hash via 8.3.
  - Cache lookup: if existing final image for scope found, return existing image resource (status final) and mark as cached in metrics.
  - If miss: create images row with status=placeholder, placeholder_url (local placeholder asset by type), return 202 + {id, status: placeholder} and enqueue async worker job with request_hash.
• Response includes poll URL GET /images/{id} and optional SSE endpoint for future streaming.
• Store initial latency start time for metrics.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: POST returns placeholder when cache miss; returns final when cache hit; respects allow_cross_campaign_dedup; records metrics. Run TC003-LIFECYCLE and TC003-CACHE partials.

subtasks.title: Background worker: generation lifecycle and persistence
subtasks.description: Implement worker that consumes generation jobs, invokes ImageGenAdapter, handles polling to final, updates DB, stores assets locally, and records metrics.
subtasks.details:
• Worker flow:
  - Idempotency: lock by request_hash to prevent duplicate provider calls; coalesce concurrent requests.
  - On start, update images row to processing.
  - Call adapter.generateImage(); poll until final or error; configurable max timeouts.
  - On success: download/store final asset to local storage (per-campaign subdir), write final_url, status=final, provider metadata.
  - On error: status=error; keep placeholder_url; error codes/messages saved.
  - Metrics: record elapsed duration; mark is_cached=false for first final; subsequent cache hits bypass worker.
• Local storage layout: /assets/{campaign_id}/images/{yyyy}/{mm}/{dd}/{image_id}.png; ensure atomic writes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests simulate provider success and failure; verify DB state transitions and asset files exist; TC003-ERROR passes.

subtasks.title: GET /images/{id} API and optional polling stream
subtasks.description: Expose retrieval endpoint to poll image status and metadata; include cache headers and minimal payload for UI updates.
subtasks.details:
• GET returns: {id, status, placeholder_url, final_url, type, campaign_id, created_at, updated_at, error?} with 200; 404 if not in campaign scope.
• Add ETag/Last-Modified for client caching.
• Optionally provide SSE at /images/{id}/events for status updates (queued, processing, final, error).
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: poll transitions to final; 404 on cross-campaign access; UI tests use this endpoint for swap.

subtasks.title: UI component: ImagePlaceholderSwap with local asset storage
subtasks.description: Implement front-end component that shows placeholder immediately and swaps to final when available; ensure smooth UX and correct local asset usage.
subtasks.details:
• Props: imageId. On mount, fetch GET /images/{id}; display placeholder_url; start polling every 1s or use SSE; when status=final, swap img src to final_url.
• Avoid layout shift: reserve aspect ratio box from style_profile.aspect or metadata.
• Handle error state by keeping placeholder and showing tooltip.
• Ensure URLs point to local asset server paths.
• Accessibility: alt text from prompt summary.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI test: renders placeholder then swaps to final; verifies no layout shift and correct src changes; covers TC003-UI.

subtasks.title: Cache reuse logic with SLA measurement and optimization
subtasks.description: Finalize cache hit path to meet <6s median for cached results; ensure fast DB and file access and precomputed metadata.
subtasks.details:
• On cache hit in POST /images: immediately return existing final image without spawning worker; mark metric is_cached=true and capture end-to-end latency.
• Optimize indices for request_hash lookup; add read-through in-memory cache (LRU) keyed by request_hash -> {image_id, final_url} with TTL.
• Warm-path benchmarks and micro-optimizations (avoid JSON parsing in hot path; select only needed columns).
• Store pre-generated thumbnails if needed to speed UI.
• Add API fast path testing hooks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run performance test harness from 8.1 with warmed cache; verify median latency <6s (target much lower). Capture flamegraphs if regressions.

subtasks.title: Cross-campaign dedup controls and isolation enforcement
subtasks.description: Implement strict default isolation with optional explicit dedup across campaigns, including cache key scoping and access controls.
subtasks.details:
• Enforce campaign scoping on all queries via middleware; GET /images/{id} must verify campaign_id.
• In POST, if allow_cross_campaign_dedup=true, use global cache index for request_hash; otherwise use campaign-scoped index.
• Ensure returned assets always reference correct campaign directories even if dedup is global (store final once, reference many via soft links or metadata pointers).
• Add audit logs when cross-campaign dedup is used.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: two campaigns issuing same request; verify no reuse by default; with flag true, reuse occurs; GET access blocked across campaigns.

subtasks.title: Failure handling and fallback placeholder policy
subtasks.description: Define and implement robust error mapping, retry hints (without retries), and consistent fallback behavior on provider errors.
subtasks.details:
• Map provider errors to standardized codes (from 8.4). On error, keep status=error, placeholder visible, and include user-safe message.
• Provide next-step guidance: retry_after_s suggestion or manual retry endpoint.
• Ensure no partial assets leak; clean temp files.
• Log correlation IDs across API and worker for observability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC003-ERROR and additional unit tests verifying error payloads; simulate each standardized error and verify consistent responses.

subtasks.title: Security, validation, and content safety gates
subtasks.description: Add input validation, rate limits, and content safety checks to prevent invalid prompts and unsafe outputs.
subtasks.details:

• Rate limiting per campaign and per IP.

subtasks.title: Design relational schema and migrations for alliances, membership, and scores
subtasks.description: Create normalized tables with constraints, indexes, and audit columns for alliances, alliance_members, and scores; add supportive tables for invites and deduplication of scoring events.
subtasks.details:
• Tables:
  - alliances(id UUID PK, campaign_id UUID FK campaigns(id) ON DELETE CASCADE, name TEXT NOT NULL, slug TEXT UNIQUE per campaign, created_by, created_at, updated_at, UNIQUE(campaign_id, name))
  - alliance_members(id UUID PK, alliance_id FK alliances(id) ON DELETE CASCADE, user_id UUID FK users(id), role ENUM('owner','admin','member'), team_line JSONB nullable (or columns team, line), joined_at, UNIQUE(alliance_id, user_id))
  - alliance_invites(id UUID PK, alliance_id FK, invited_user_email TEXT or user_id, token TEXT UNIQUE, expires_at, invited_by, status ENUM('pending','accepted','declined','expired'), UNIQUE(alliance_id, invited_user_email or user_id, status='pending'))
  - scores(id UUID PK, campaign_id FK, team_id UUID FK alliances(id), metric TEXT, value BIGINT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0, updated_at, UNIQUE(campaign_id, team_id, metric))
  - score_events(id UUID PK, campaign_id FK, team_id FK alliances(id), metric TEXT, delta INT, source TEXT, event_idempotency_key TEXT UNIQUE, occurred_at, processed_at, status ENUM('pending','applied','rejected'), metadata JSONB)

subtasks.details:
Set up a tests package in the monorepo (e.g., packages/mission/__tests__) using Jest + ts-jest or Vitest. Define fixtures for minimal mission graphs in JSON with nodes: objective, twist, soft_fail; edges with conditions; and seeded event streams. Write tests:
- TC006-Unit: Given events, executor advances objective nodes in order; twist nodes activate when their predicate becomes true; soft_fail transitions occur without ending the mission.
- TC006-Integration: Load a mission from a mock content pack and drive executor with a sequence of events, assert mission_progress updates and prompts queued for GM LLM.

subtasks.title: Design Mission Graph JSON Schema (nodes, edges, metadata)
subtasks.description: Specify the DSL as a JSON Schema defining mission graphs with node types (objective, twist, soft_fail), edges with conditions/predicates, metadata, and terminal states. Include versioning and compatibility fields.
subtasks.details:
In shared package, add schema v1: mission.schema.json with types: Mission, Node, Edge, Condition. Fields:
- Mission: id, version, title, description, start_node_id, nodes[], edges[], variables (initial), metadata.
- Node: id, type ('objective' | 'twist' | 'soft_fail'), title, description, payload (objective-specific fields like success_predicate, failure_predicate, completion_mode), prompts (for GM LLM), on_enter/on_exit actions, soft_fail_recovery (for soft_fail nodes), tags.
- Edge: id, from, to, guard (predicate expression or predicate config), priority, kind ('normal' | 'soft_fail' | 'twist'), side_effects (declarative action ids), reentrant (bool).
- Condition/Predicate: allow two forms: (a) declarative operator tree (left/op/right) referencing events and variables, (b) named predicate id with parameters.
- Terminal designation: objective nodes may have terminal=true.
Include $defs for predicates, actions, and expressions. Provide examples section and $schema, $id. Add semver in mission.version.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run schema validation tests from TC006-U1 against fixtures; ensure invalid graphs (missing nodes, cycles without exit, invalid edge references) fail with descriptive errors.

subtasks.details:
In shared/mission-dsl: 
- Define zod types: ZMission, ZNode, ZObjectiveNode, ZTwistNode, ZSoftFailNode, ZEdge, ZPredicate, ZExpression.
- Generate TypeScript types from Zod. Configure AJV with allErrors, strict, formats. Add ajv instance and precompiled validate function from mission.schema.json.
- Export: parseMission(zod), validateMissionAjv(json): { ok, errors }, and assertMission(json): Mission.
- Add custom validators: ensure start_node_id exists; all edges from/to exist; no duplicate ids; edge kind matches node types (e.g., soft_fail edges allowed from objectives); terminal reachability check optional at load time.
subtasks.testStrategy: Wire TC006-U1 invalid schema tests to ensure both Zod parsing and AJV validation produce consistent failures. Add unit tests for custom validations.

subtasks.title: Define predicate and condition evaluation engine
subtasks.description: Implement a pure, deterministic evaluator for declarative predicates over events and variables to drive edge guards and node success/failure conditions.
subtasks.details:
Create a module evaluator.ts with:
- Expression AST: literals, variable refs (vars.morale, event.type), comparison ops, logical ops, temporal operators (within_ms, count_of, since), and event pattern matching (match {type, actor, target}).
- Context: { variables, recentEvents (deque with timestamps), now, seed }.
- Evaluate functions: evalPredicate(predicate, context), evalExpression(expr, context) with no dynamic code eval. Support named predicate registry with pluggable functions (e.g., 'player_action_equals', 'inventory_contains', 'roll_ge').
- Determinism: ensure stable ordering, no Date.now direct calls—use provided now.
- Performance: pre-compile predicates to executable closures when loading the mission.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: truth tables for logical ops; temporal windows with seeded event streams; named predicate registry resolution; snapshot of compiled predicates for equality; TC006-U2 twist activation using predicate evaluation.

subtasks.title: Executor state machine core (advance loop and transitions)
subtasks.description: Build a deterministic executor that maintains mission state, ingests events, evaluates node conditions, and advances along edges with priorities while handling twists and soft-fail states.
subtasks.details:
Create executor.ts with:
- Types: ExecutorState { currentNodeIds[], variables, history, activeTwists[], softFailActive?, rngSeed, now }, Event, Output { mission_progress, prompts }.
- APIs: start(mission, seed, now) -> ExecutorState; step(state, events[]) -> { state, outputs }; end(state) -> summary.
- Logic: For each step, update context with events, evaluate node-level success/failure predicates, choose edges whose guards are true, select by highest priority and deterministic tie-break (edge id sort). Allow parallel objectives if mission allows (flag). Twists: if guard true and not active, activate and push to activeTwists; may modify variables or inject prompts. Soft-fail: if triggered (node failure or soft_fail edge), transition to soft_fail node while mission remains ongoing; support recovery via soft_fail_recovery and edges back to objectives.
- Determinism: order evaluations by stable id sort; avoid non-deterministic iteration; RNG via seeded PRNG injected.
- Snapshotting: produce a compact state snapshot after each step for tests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use TC006-D1 determinism snapshot with fixed seed and event sequence; TC006-U1 advancement cases; add edge-priority tie tests; soft-fail entry and recovery tests.

subtasks.details:

subtasks.title: Write acceptance tests for d20 rules, progression, and loot (TC006–TC010)
subtasks.description: Before implementation, author unit and integration tests that codify the core acceptance criteria for the d20 rules engine, including seeded dice behavior and advantage/disadvantage, DC comparisons, conditions effects, XP and level progression curves, loot distribution with deterministic seeding, and alliance/team modifier hooks. Include golden tests for XP curves and loot tables, fuzz tests for invariants (no negative XP, bounded probabilities), and at least one integration test simulating a full check-to-reward flow.
subtasks.details:
Create a new test suite in shared module (pure TS, deterministic). Use Jest/Vitest with seedable RNG stub. Tests:
- TC006: Dice roller determinism with seed; uniform distribution sanity; advantage/disadvantage selects max/min correctly; tie handling defined.
- TC007: DC compare: success/critical success/critical failure rules; modifiers stacking order; bounded final results.
- TC008: Conditions: apply/remove; stacking policy; turn-based tick; effects on checks (e.g., disadvantage from Blinded), immunity handling; serialization round-trip.
- TC009: XP/Levels: define XP curve; level-up thresholds; gained XP cannot be negative; level computation pure/idempotent; golden snapshot for levels 1–20.
- TC010: Loot: seeded drop tables; rarity weights; pity/guarantees if applicable; quantity ranges; team/alliance modifiers hook applied; golden snapshot for representative seeds.
- Integration: Given character with conditions + modifiers, perform check vs DC, award XP and loot deterministically for a given seed; verify outputs stable.
- Fuzz: Randomized seeds across 10k trials validate invariants (no negative XP, loot weights sum, probabilities within tolerance).
Include coverage thresholds >80% lines for this module. Tag tests with TC IDs and map into Task 26 harness.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit + integration tests locally and in CI. Use golden files for XP/loot outcomes. Statistical assertions use confidence bounds; seed fixed for reproducibility. Ensure at least one integration test exercises full pipeline.

subtasks.title: Implement deterministic seedable RNG and dice roller with advantage/disadvantage
subtasks.description: Create a pure, side-effect-free dice module supporting d20 rolls with seedable RNG, advantage/disadvantage, and roll metadata for auditing.
subtasks.details:
Implement RNG: xoshiro128** or Mulberry32 with explicit seed input and next() returning [0,1). Interfaces:
- RNG { next(): number, fork(label:string): RNG } to derive independent streams deterministically via hash(seed,label).
Dice API:
- rollD20(rng, options:{adv?:boolean, dis?:boolean}) -> {value:number, detail:{rolls:number[], mode:'normal'|'adv'|'dis', seedTrace:string[]}}
- roll(n,sides,rng, sum|keepHighest/keepLowest k) for reuse.
Rules: advantage = max of two d20; disadvantage = min of two; if both provided, resolve precedence as config (default: they cancel to normal). Ensure no global state; all functions pure.
Include distribution helpers for tests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC006. Verify deterministic outputs for fixed seeds; validate advantage/disadvantage semantics and tie handling; basic chi-square sanity within tolerance over many trials.

subtasks.title: Implement DC comparison and result grading
subtasks.description: Provide pure functions to compute final check result given a d20 roll, modifiers, and DC, returning success tiers and critical rules.

subtasks.title: Implement XP curve and level computation
subtasks.description: Provide deterministic, pure functions to compute XP required per level, accumulate XP, and derive level from total XP with golden curve support.
subtasks.details:
API:
- xpForLevel(level:number, scheme:'linear'|'quadratic'|'custom', custom?:number[]) -> number
- levelForXp(xp:number, scheme, custom?) -> number
- grantXp(currentXp:number, gained:number)->number ensuring gained>=0 by clamping and guarding overflow.
Include default curve for levels 1–20 (configurable). Provide table generation utility for golden snapshot testing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC009. Verify monotonic xpForLevel, levelForXp inverses on table points, no negative XP, golden snapshot for default 1–20.

subtasks.title: Implement loot tables and deterministic distribution
subtasks.description: Create loot table structures with weighted choices, quantity ranges, rarity categories, and seeded deterministic sampling, plus team/alliance modifier hooks.
subtasks.details:
Data:
- LootTable { id, entries: LootEntry[], pity?:{counterKey:string, threshold:number, reward:LootEntry} }
- LootEntry { id, itemId, weight:number, qty:{min:number,max:number}, tags:string[], modifiers?:{teamBonus?:number, allianceBonus?:number} }
API:
- rollLoot(table:LootTable, rng, context:{teamId?:string, allianceId?:string, hooks?:HookFns}) -> LootResult
- weightedPick deterministic via cumulative weights; quantity via RNG; apply hooks from alliances module via provided hook functions (no import dependency): e.g., hooks.getTeamModifier(teamId) returns multiplier.
- Support multi-drop and pity: maintain counters via caller-provided state object; engine remains pure by returning updated counters as part of result.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC010. Golden tests for specific seeds; verify weights respected over many trials; verify team/alliance modifiers applied; pity triggers at threshold deterministically.

subtasks.title: Compose check pipeline: state -> roll -> compare -> rewards
subtasks.description: Provide a high-level pure function that, given character state, DC, and RNG, produces a full check outcome including applied conditions, d20 roll with (dis)advantage, DC result, and reward hooks (XP and loot) without side effects.
subtasks.details:
API:
- performCheck(input:{state:CharacterState, baseModifiers:number[], dc:number, rng:RNG, xpReward:number, lootTable?:LootTable, lootContext?:{}, options?:{critMargin?:number}}) -> {roll:{value, detail}, result:{total, degree}, rewards:{xp:number, loot?:LootResult}, stateUpdates:{conditions?:AppliedCondition[]}, audit:{seedTrace, breakdown}}
Flow:
1) resolveCheckContext -> merge base modifiers with condition-derived modifiers; compute dice mode.
2) rollD20 with mode.
3) computeCheck to determine degree.
4) award XP: grantXp(currentXp, xpReward adjusted by degree if rules specify multipliers).
5) optional rollLoot with provided table and context hooks.
No external state written; return all data and any updated counters via result.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend integration test to call performCheck and assert deterministic full pipeline outputs for fixed seeds; verify invariants (no negative XP, loot deterministic).

subtasks.title: Define alliance/team modifier hook interfaces
subtasks.description: Publish minimal hook interfaces in shared module that the alliances/teams feature can implement to adjust modifiers, XP, or loot without creating a hard dependency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests verify that when hooks are provided, outputs are scaled accordingly and order-of-operations is respected. Extend integration test to include mock hooks and validate results.

subtasks.title: Golden data generators and snapshot fixtures
subtasks.description: Implement utilities to generate golden fixtures for XP curves and loot outcomes, and wire snapshot testing helpers to prevent regressions.
subtasks.details:
Create generator functions:
- generateXpTable(levels:number, scheme) -> number[]
- generateLootOutcomes(table, seeds:string[], context) -> LootResult[]
Store snapshots under tests/__golden__/ with stable JSON serialization (sorted keys). Provide compare helper that pretty-diffs deviations and suggests update via explicit flag.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run golden tests in TC009/TC010 to verify snapshots. Manual review required on intended changes.

subtasks.title: Fuzz and property-based tests for invariants
subtasks.description: Add property-based tests across dice, DC grading, conditions, XP, and loot to ensure invariants hold and detect edge cases.
subtasks.details:
Use fast-check (or similar) to generate random seeds, modifiers, DCs, and condition sets. Properties:
- Dice: values in [1,20], advantage >= normal, disadvantage <= normal.
- DC grading: monotonic w.r.t increasing modifiers; crit-success implies success; crit-fail implies fail.
- Conditions: serialization round-trip; stacking never exceeds max; dice-mode resolution deterministic.
- XP: non-negative, non-decreasing with gains; levelForXp(xpForLevel(n)) == n.
- Loot: weights normalized; probabilities approximate weights over large N; pity triggers within threshold.
Keep tests deterministic with seeded generators.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute property tests in CI as part of this module’s suite with time budget controls. Fail on counterexamples with minimized cases saved.

subtasks.title: Documentation and examples for the rules engine APIs
subtasks.description: Provide concise API docs and example usage covering common flows: rolling checks with conditions, computing levels, and generating loot, emphasizing purity and determinism.
subtasks.details: Add TSDoc comments to all public types/functions. Write examples in a docs/examples folder demonstrating: seeded roll with advantage; applying a condition; performing a check with hooks; generating XP table; rolling loot with team modifier. Include guidance on seeding, forking RNGs, and integrating hooks from alliances. Note no side effects and no global state.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run examples in a small doc-test harness to ensure they compile and produce expected outputs with fixed seeds.

tasks.details:
- Namespaces: campaign:<id>, player:<id>
- Hybrid retrieval: BM25 (sqlite fts5) + vector; rerank with small local model or LLM if available
- Summarization pipeline promotes memories to campaign memory per policy
- Redaction of PII before storage; policies configurable
- API: write_memory, retrieve(query, scope), promote
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC007: enforce per-player isolation in queries
- TC008: recall relevance tests with seeded corpus and summarization correctness checks
- Bench: retrieval latency under target

subtasks.title: Define Acceptance Tests for Vector Memory, Privacy, and Promotion (TC007, TC008, Perf)
subtasks.description: Write unit and integration tests that capture the core acceptance criteria before implementation. Cover per-player isolation (TC007), hybrid retrieval relevance and summarization/promotion correctness (TC008), namespace scoping, PII redaction policies, and performance benchmarks for retrieval latency. Stub/mock embeddings and reranker to make tests deterministic.
subtasks.details: Implement tests in two layers: (a) unit tests for API surface and policy logic, (b) integration tests over SQLite+FTS5 and a pluggable vector index with in-memory dataset. Seed a small corpus with memories across namespaces campaign:42, player:101, player:202, with types episodic/semantic/declarative/procedural and metadata. Add a seeded query set with expected relevant IDs. Provide a mock EmbeddingsProvider returning fixed vectors; provide a stub Reranker that returns input order unless score margins enforce swaps. Include PII samples (email, phone, address) to verify redaction pre-storage and retrieval. Define tests: - TC007: retrieve(scope="player", playerId=101) never returns data from player:202 or other campaigns; retrieve(scope="campaign", campaignId=42) may return campaign namespace but not any other campaign or players from other campaigns. - TC008a: Hybrid retrieval returns top-k containing at least N of expected relevant items given seeded BM25+vector mix; assert reranker improves MRR@k over unreranked baseline on seeded set. - TC008b: Summarization pipeline produces concise summary and promotion to campaign memory obeys policy (e.g., if item meets threshold and not PII-blocked). - Policy Redaction: verify PII is removed or masked in stored memory content and summaries; raw input never stored. - API contract: write_memory, retrieve(query, scope), promote. - Latency bench: vector+BM25 end-to-end under target (e.g., p50 < 60 ms local, adjustable via env). - Determinism: snapshot tests for summary schema and metadata fields. Provide fixtures and helpers to reset DB between tests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use Jest/Vitest (Node) with sqlite3/better-sqlite3 in temp files. Seed DB in beforeAll, clean in afterEach. For performance, run 100 queries and compute p50/p95; mark as skipped in CI if no perf env. Add property-based tests for namespace isolation. Use data-driven table tests to cover types and scopes.

subtasks.title: Design Memory Schema, Namespaces, and Index Abstractions
subtasks.description: Define DB schema for memories and supporting tables, and the abstraction interfaces for vector index and reranking to support campaign:<id> and player:<id> namespaces.
subtasks.details: Add/extend tables: memories(id PK, namespace TEXT, campaign_id INTEGER, player_id INTEGER NULL, type TEXT CHECK IN('episodic','semantic','declarative','procedural'), content TEXT, content_redacted TEXT, metadata JSON, created_at, updated_at, embedding BLOB/VSS column if using sqlite-vss, bm25_doc TEXT for FTS). memory_summaries(id PK, source_memory_id FK, namespace TEXT, summary TEXT, metadata JSON, created_at). memory_promotions(id PK, source_memory_id, target_namespace TEXT, policy_id TEXT, reason TEXT, created_at). pii_redaction_logs(id, memory_id, fields JSON, policy_version). Create FTS5 virtual table memories_fts(content_redacted, metadata) with content='memories', content_rowid='id'. Define VectorIndex interface: upsert(vector, id, namespace, metadata), query(vector, namespace, k, filter), delete(id, namespace), flush. Provide namespace as exact match partition key. Define HybridRetriever composing: - BM25 via FTS5 MATCH query scoped by namespace - Vector via VectorIndex.query - Fusion mechanism (e.g., reciprocal rank fusion) before rerank. Define Reranker interface with rerank(query, docs) supporting local small model or no-op. Document scope: 'player' resolves to namespace=player:<id>, 'campaign' to campaign:<id>. Ensure columns to enforce campaign_id consistency with namespace.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run existing tests; verify schema migration runs and tables exist. Add unit tests for namespace parsing and validation.

subtasks.title: Implement PII Redaction Policy Engine and Transformers
subtasks.description: Create a configurable PII redaction pipeline applied before storage that supports masking/removal of emails, phones, addresses, and custom regexes; store redacted content separately and log redaction metadata.
subtasks.details: Implement RedactionPolicy with config: { strategies: ['mask','remove'], rules: [builtin.email, builtin.phone, builtin.ssn, builtin.address], customRules: [{name, regex, action}], preserveHints: boolean }. Build redact(text, policy) -> { redactedText, findings:[{type, start,end, original?, replacement}], policyVersion }. Ensure redact is idempotent. Integrate with write_memory transformer chain: normalize whitespace, truncate overly long inputs (configurable), redact according to policy, compute bm25_doc and embedding from redactedText only. Store content as original input? For privacy, do not store original PII: either discard original or store only redacted version; reflect in config to forbid keeping raw. Persist pii_redaction_logs. Provide utility to scrub metadata fields too.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests on diverse PII samples verifying matches and replacements; ensure no PII remnants remain by negative regex checks. Verify logs written. Run TC008 policy redaction tests.

subtasks.title: Implement Embeddings Provider and VectorIndex Adapter with Namespaces
subtasks.description: Provide an EmbeddingsProvider abstraction with a default local/small model or stub and implement a VectorIndex adapter for sqlite-vss with FAISS fallback, enforcing namespace partitioning.
subtasks.details: EmbeddingsProvider: interface embed(text|texts[], dim), deterministic mode for tests (hash-based vector) and real mode (pluggable). VectorIndexSqliteVSS: create vss0 table per memories or a single table with namespace column; ensure index supports cosine similarity. Implement upsert/query/delete using namespace WHERE clause and optional metadata filters (e.g., type). FAISS fallback behind same interface stored in files per namespace directory. Ensure migrations create vss indexes and FTS5 view. Implement health checks and graceful no-vector mode where hybrid falls back to BM25 only.
subtasks.testStrategy: Vector unit tests for insert/query cosine similarity, namespace isolation, and deletion. Run TC007 isolation with vector path active and inactive.

subtasks.title: Build Hybrid Retrieval (BM25 + Vector) with Fusion and Optional Reranking
subtasks.description: Compose BM25 via FTS5 and VectorIndex results into a unified ranked list using reciprocal rank fusion, then optionally rerank with a local model or pass-through fallback.
subtasks.details: Implement HybridRetriever.retrieve(query, scope, k, filters) -> results[]. Steps: - Resolve namespaces from scope. - Generate query embedding. - Query FTS5 with MATCH across content_redacted and metadata fields, constrained by namespace and filters; collect top N_bm25 with scores. - Query VectorIndex for top N_vec. - Normalize scores and apply Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF) with tunable k parameter; de-duplicate by id. - If Reranker available, rerank top M with query and snippets. - Fetch full records, include highlights from FTS5 offsets. Ensure deterministic behavior in tests. Provide configs for weights. Handle missing vector index or embeddings gracefully.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests from TC008a check recall and MRR improvement. Unit tests for fusion correctness on synthetic lists. Run latency bench to ensure under target for small corpora.

subtasks.title: Implement Memory Types, Write Path, and API: write_memory
subtasks.description: Create the write_memory API to accept memory entries with types, apply redaction, compute embeddings, and index into FTS and vector stores within namespaces.
subtasks.details: API write_memory(input): { campaignId, playerId?, type, content, metadata } -> returns memoryId, namespace, redactionSummary. Steps: - Validate type in allowed set; require campaignId; playerId optional; derive namespace. - Apply redaction policy; compute embedding on redacted text. - Insert into memories with content_redacted as stored content; bm25_doc mirrors content_redacted. - Upsert into VectorIndex with namespace and metadata filters. - Index into FTS5. - Return identifiers and redaction findings. Ensure transactional integrity across DB and vector index; rollback on failure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests verifying insert success, redaction applied, correct namespace, and index calls. Integration tests that subsequent retrieval finds the item in correct scope. Run existing tests.

subtasks.title: Implement Retrieval API: retrieve(query, scope)
subtasks.description: Expose retrieve API that accepts query and scope (player or campaign), resolves namespaces, executes hybrid retrieval, and returns ranked results with snippets and metadata.
subtasks.details: API retrieve({query, scope: {type:'player'|'campaign', campaignId, playerId?}, k, filters, rerank:boolean}). Validate scope; map to one or more namespaces (player maps to a single player:<id>, campaign maps to campaign:<id>). Use HybridRetriever to fetch results. Return: [{id, type, namespace, score, snippet, metadata}]. Enforce per-player isolation by never including other players' namespaces when scope=player. Ensure campaign scope includes only campaign:<id> namespace, not players' private memories unless policy allows (default: exclude).
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests for TC007 and TC008 run through public API. Add negative tests ensuring cross-campaign leakage does not occur. Run tests.

subtasks.title: Summarization and Promotion Pipeline
subtasks.description: Implement a pipeline that summarizes selected memories and promotes them to campaign memory according to configurable policies.
subtasks.details: Define PromotionPolicy: thresholds (e.g., frequency, recency, access count, type whitelist), size limits, and PII gate (block if findings present). Implement summarize(memory|batch) using a pluggable Summarizer interface: default rule-based/LLM adapter; operate only on redacted content. Promotion flow: evaluate candidates (e.g., after N accesses or explicit promote call), generate summary, write to campaign:<campaignId> namespace via write_memory with type=semantic or declarative per policy, record in memory_promotions with policy_id and reason. Ensure deduplication (hash summaries), and link back with source_memory_id.
subtasks.testStrategy: TC008b: verify summary created, meets schema, and promotion stored only when policy passes; ensure blocked when PII present. Snapshot test for summary fields. Run tests.

subtasks.title: Implement promote API and Policy Enforcement
subtasks.description: Expose promote API to allow explicit promotion of player memories to campaign memory while enforcing policy and privacy gates.
subtasks.details: API promote({memoryId, campaignId, policyOverride?}). Steps: - Fetch memory; verify it belongs to the same campaign as target. - Check policy (type whitelist, PII gate, dedupe). - Summarize if required; write to campaign namespace via write_memory; record promotion entry. - Return promoted record reference. Log decision outcomes.

subtasks.title: Reranker Integration with Local Model or LLM Fallback
subtasks.description: Plug in an optional reranker component to reorder the fused results using a small local model when available, otherwise no-op or LLM API when configured.
subtasks.details: Implement Reranker interface adapters: LocalCrossEncoderReranker (if packaged) and LLMBasedReranker (budget-guarded). Add capability detection and configuration. Ensure deterministic behavior in tests by using a mock reranker. Provide timeouts and graceful degradation to baseline fusion if reranker unavailable.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for adapter selection and no-op fallback. Integration test showing improved ordering on synthetic dataset. Run tests.

subtasks.title: Access Control and Namespace Enforcement Middleware
subtasks.description: Add a guard layer ensuring APIs only access allowed namespaces derived from input scope and session context, preventing cross-player data access.
subtasks.details: Implement a middleware/utility that derives allowedNamespaces from {campaignId, playerId, scope.type}. Validate every request: - write_memory requires campaignId and optional playerId; verify caller has rights. - retrieve restricts namespace list strictly. - promote checks campaign match and policy gate. Provide audit logging on denials.

subtasks.title: Observability, Telemetry, and Latency Bench Hooks

Integrate simple tracing spans. Expose a diagnostics endpoint to dump recent metrics (redaction-safe). Wire benchmarks used by tests.

subtasks.title: Data Migration and Backfill Utilities
subtasks.description: Provide scripts to migrate existing memories to include redacted content, embeddings, and to populate vector/FTS indexes with namespaces.
subtasks.details: Write CLI: mem-migrate --reindex --redact --namespace-fix. Steps: scan memories, apply redaction if missing, compute embeddings, upsert into vector index, update FTS5. Support dry-run and progress logging. Handle large batches with pagination.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration test on a temp DB populated with legacy-like rows; after migration, retrieval works and PII absent. Run tests.

subtasks.title: Configuration, Policies, and Feature Flags
subtasks.description: Centralize configuration for redaction, retrieval fusion weights, reranker toggle, promotion policy, and fallback behaviors with safe defaults.
subtasks.details: Implement config loader supporting env and file-based overrides. Keys: MEMORY_REDACTION_POLICY, HYBRID_WEIGHTS, RERANKER_MODE, PROMOTION_POLICY, NAMESPACE_RULES, LATENCY_TARGETS. Add validation and config hot-reload if supported. Tie into A/B harness later.

subtasks.title: Security Review: No Raw PII Storage and Audit
subtasks.description: Ensure that raw PII is never persisted, secrets are not leaked in logs, and access paths are audited.
subtasks.details: Add safeguards: prohibit storing original content when policy forbids; scrub logs; add DB scan utility to assert no PII patterns exist. Implement audit events for cross-namespace access attempts and promotions. Document threat model and controls.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run DB scan test to confirm absence of PII patterns in stored fields. Unit tests for logger scrub. Negative tests triggering audit on denied access.

subtasks.title: Documentation and Developer Examples
subtasks.description: Provide developer docs and runnable examples demonstrating write, retrieve by scope, and promotion flow, including configuration of policies.
subtasks.details: Write README with API contracts, scope semantics, memory types, and examples. Include a sample script that seeds memories for two players in one campaign, runs queries, shows isolation, and promotes a memory to campaign. Document performance tips and limitations.

tasks.title: Event Sourcing and Snapshots with Resume/Branch
tasks.description: Persist event-sourced state with periodic snapshots; allow resume and branching timelines from any snapshot.
tasks.details:
- Event store: append-only events table (session_id, seq, type, payload, ts)
- Snapshot service: periodic every N events/time; store snapshot blob and hash
- Replay engine reconstructs state; branch creates new session from snapshot with pointer to parent
- UI: branch action in session history
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC009: snapshot+replay deterministic state vs live
- TC010: branch creation yields isolated new session; no leakage
- Corruption tests: invalid snapshot hash triggers fallback replay

subtasks.title: Write acceptance tests for snapshots, replay determinism, branching, and corruption handling
subtasks.description: Create unit and integration/UI tests that define the acceptance criteria for event sourcing with snapshots, resume, and branching. Include tests for deterministic replay from events vs snapshot+delta (TC009), branch creation isolation (TC010), and corruption handling where invalid snapshot hash triggers full replay fallback. Add UI test for branch action in session history. No implementation yet; tests should initially fail.
subtasks.details:
• Tech stack: TypeScript/Node, Jest (unit), Playwright (UI), and a lightweight in-memory SQLite or better-sqlite3 for integration tests.
• Define fixtures: sample event types (type, payload), sessions, and snapshot blobs. Use seeded timestamps and sequences.
• Unit tests:
  - TC009-UNIT: Given a session with N events and snapshots every k events, reconstruct state via: (a) full replay; (b) latest snapshot + replay of subsequent events; assert deep equality of states and version.
  - TC010-UNIT: Branch from snapshot S to new session B; append events to B; assert no changes in parent session events or state; ensure branch has parent pointer.
  - Corruption-UNIT: Tamper snapshot blob or stored hash; assert engine detects hash mismatch and falls back to full replay; log/metric is emitted.
  - Sequencing: Ensure seq strictly increases per session; inserting out-of-order should be rejected.
  - Idempotency: Re-applying same event seq should be no-op and duplicates with same seq rejected.
• Integration tests (Jest with real sqlite):
  - TC009-INT: Populate events table; run snapshot service policy (every N events); verify read path boots from snapshot and only queries deltas.
  - TC010-INT: Create branch from snapshot; write subsequent events to branch; query both sessions and verify isolation at DB-level.
  - Corruption-INT: Manually flip snapshot hash; ensure read falls back to full replay and records an audit entry.
• UI test (Playwright):
  - TC010-UI: In session history page, click Branch on a snapshot row; verify new session appears with parent pointer and timeline starts at branched state.
• Add verification ID tags in test names/comments: [TC009], [TC010].
subtasks.testStrategy: Run Jest unit/integration suites and Playwright UI tests in CI. Expect tests to fail until implementation exists.

subtasks.title: Design and migrate relational schema for events, snapshots, and branches
subtasks.description: Create or migrate the database schema to support append-only events, snapshots with integrity hashes, and session branching pointers. Ensure constraints enforce sequencing, immutability, and referential integrity.
subtasks.details:
• Tables:
  - sessions(id PK, parent_session_id NULL FK->sessions(id), created_at, metadata JSON)
  - events(id PK, session_id FK->sessions(id), seq INTEGER, type TEXT, payload JSON, ts INTEGER, UNIQUE(session_id, seq)) with CHECK(seq>0)
  - snapshots(id PK, session_id FK->sessions(id), upto_seq INTEGER, blob BLOB, hash TEXT, created_at, UNIQUE(session_id, upto_seq))
• Indexes: events(session_id, seq), snapshots(session_id, upto_seq DESC), sessions(parent_session_id).
• Triggers/constraints:
  - Prevent DELETE/UPDATE on events.type/payload/seq/ts after insert (soft enforcement via application + optional DB trigger).
  - Ensure snapshots.upto_seq corresponds to an existing event seq per session (FK-like via deferred trigger).
• Migration scripts: up/down SQL; seed dev data.
• Data size: ensure blob column uses efficient storage (e.g., SQLite BLOB; Postgres bytea if applicable).
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests from 13.1 run migrations in test DB and validate constraints by attempting invalid inserts (e.g., duplicate seq, missing parent) and expecting failures.

subtasks.title: Implement append-only EventStore with optimistic concurrency
subtasks.description: Build a repository/service to append and read ordered events per session with sequence guarantees, and to guard against duplicates and race conditions using expected sequence checks.
subtasks.details:
• API (TypeScript):
  - appendEvents(sessionId, expectedLastSeq, events: {type, payload, ts}[]): returns {lastSeq}
  - readEvents(sessionId, fromSeqInclusive): returns ordered array
  - createSession(parentSessionId?, metadata?): returns sessionId
• Implementation:
  - Use a transaction to compute next seq = COALESCE(MAX(seq),0)+1, compare against expectedLastSeq+1 for first event; assign increasing seq for batch.
  - Enforce immutability: no updates to stored events; only inserts allowed.
  - Validate payload JSON schema per event type (pluggable validators).
• Telemetry: counters for appends, rejects, latency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run tests: sequencing and idempotency tests from 13.1 should now pass for EventStore behaviors. Add race test using parallel appends expecting one to fail with concurrency error.

subtasks.title: Implement SnapshotStore with hash integrity and retention policy
subtasks.description: Create service to persist and fetch latest snapshot per session, compute and verify hashes, and enforce retention (keep last M or by age).
subtasks.details:
• API:
  - saveSnapshot(sessionId, uptoSeq, stateBlob: Uint8Array): returns {id, hash}
  - getLatestSnapshot(sessionId): returns {uptoSeq, blob, hash} | null
  - verifySnapshot({blob, hash}): boolean
• Hashing: SHA-256 over canonicalized blob bytes. Include sessionId and uptoSeq in the hash preimage to prevent cross-session substitution.
• Retention: configurable M and TTL; delete older snapshots beyond policy in a background job.
• Store blob as compressed (e.g., gzip) for size; record encoding in metadata if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: From 13.1 corruption tests: tamper hash to force verifySnapshot=false and assert the replay engine falls back. Add unit tests to ensure save and retrieval round-trip with matching hash.

subtasks.title: Build SnapshotPolicy scheduler (periodic every N events and/or time)
subtasks.description: Implement policy engine to decide when to snapshot a session based on thresholds: every K events, and/or every T minutes since last snapshot or since session start.
subtasks.details:
• Inputs: thresholds {eventsEveryK, timeEveryTms}. Track last snapshot seq and timestamp per session.
• On each appendEvents success, evaluate policy: if events since last snapshot >= K or time since last snapshot >= T, enqueue snapshot job for that session.
• Use job queue (in-memory or lightweight queue) to decouple from write path; batchable.
• Provide dry-run mode for testing to snapshot synchronously.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests seed sessions and append events crossing thresholds; assert snapshot jobs were produced and snapshots saved at expected uptoSeq values. Ensure no duplicate snapshots for same uptoSeq.

subtasks.title: Implement deterministic Reducer and ReplayEngine
subtasks.description: Create a pure, deterministic reducer to apply events to state and a replay engine that loads from latest snapshot when present, validates hash, and applies remaining events. On hash failure, fall back to full replay and flag snapshot as corrupted.
subtasks.details:
• Reducer signature: reduce(currentState, event) -> nextState, with serialization-stable state.
• ReplayEngine API:
  - loadState(sessionId): returns {state, uptoSeq}
  - rebuildFromSnapshot(snapshot): verify hash; if invalid, mark corrupted and rebuild from seq=0; else apply events from uptoSeq+1.
• Determinism:
  - No wall-clock usage during reduce; use event.ts exclusively.
  - Ensure stable ordering by seq; guard against gaps or duplicates.
• Corruption handling:
  - If hash mismatch, record incident row (snapshots_corrupted) and emit metric.
  - Optionally re-create a fresh snapshot after full replay.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC009 unit/integration tests. Add unit test where reducer is applied across two paths (full vs snapshot+delta) and yields identical state object structure and checksum.

subtasks.title: Implement Branching: create new session from snapshot
subtasks.description: Enable branching a session timeline from any snapshot. The branch starts with the state of the chosen snapshot and references the parent session.
subtasks.details:
• API:
  - createBranch(parentSessionId, snapshotSeq, metadata?): returns newSessionId
• Steps:
  - Load snapshot at or before snapshotSeq (exact preferred; else pick latest <= snapshotSeq), verify hash; if invalid, rebuild to snapshotSeq and produce a fresh branch base state.
  - Create new session row with parent_session_id=parentSessionId and metadata including branchOriginSeq.
  - Option A (no initial events in branch): Store an initial branch snapshot blob representing state at snapshotSeq with uptoSeq=0 for branch, or store origin metadata and compute state via parent snapshot when first read.
  - Ensure subsequent events appended to branch are isolated under new session_id and start seq at 1.
• Permissions/hooks: check access if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC010 unit/integration tests to validate isolation: appending to branch must not change parent state or events. Verify parent pointer and branch origin metadata are persisted.

subtasks.title: Expose Resume/Read API with snapshot-aware fast path
subtasks.description: Provide a high-level API for clients to resume a session by reconstructing current state using snapshot+delta and to read session timelines efficiently.
subtasks.details:
• API:
  - resume(sessionId): returns {state, lastSeq}
  - getTimeline(sessionId, {fromSeq, limit}): returns events page
• Implementation:
  - resume delegates to ReplayEngine.loadState.
  - getTimeline streams events with pagination sorted by seq.
• Caching: optional in-memory cache keyed by (sessionId, uptoSeq) to avoid repeated replays within a request scope.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests calling resume on sessions with/without snapshots, ensuring correctness and performance (fewer queries when snapshots exist).

subtasks.title: Add UI: session history with Branch action and branch visualization
subtasks.description: Implement UI elements to show session history with snapshots and provide a Branch action to create a new session from a selected snapshot. Visualize parent-child relationship.
subtasks.details:

  - For each snapshot row, a Branch button opens a dialog to confirm and enter metadata; on confirm, call createBranch.
  - After creation, navigate to new session view; display parent pointer and branch origin info.

subtasks.testStrategy: Playwright test (TC010-UI) clicks Branch and verifies new session appears with correct parent and isolated timeline.

subtasks.title: Implement snapshot compaction and housekeeping jobs
subtasks.description: Background jobs to prune old snapshots per retention, rehydrate and re-snapshot hot sessions, and mark corrupted snapshots for re-creation.
subtasks.details:
• Jobs:
  - RetentionPruner: enforce keep-last-M and TTL per session.
  - Rehasher: periodically verify hashes of latest snapshots.
  - Resnapshotter: for sessions with large deltas since last snapshot, generate a fresh snapshot.
• Scheduling: cron-like scheduler or reuse existing job framework.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests create multiple snapshots and verify pruning rules; simulate corruption and ensure re-snapshotting occurs.

subtasks.title: Observability: metrics, logging, and audit for snapshot/replay/branch
subtasks.description: Add structured logs, metrics, and audit trails for key operations: appends, snapshot saves, replay paths, branch creation, and corruption events.
subtasks.details:
• Metrics: counts and latencies for appendEvents, saveSnapshot, loadState (full vs snapshot path), createBranch; gauge for snapshots per session; corruption count.
• Logs: include session_id, upto_seq, hash, parent_session_id, outcome fields; redact payloads per security policy.
• Audit table: audits(id, ts, actor, action, session_id, details JSON).
subtasks.testStrategy: Add assertions in integration tests that specific metrics/log lines/audit rows are emitted for operations (use test logger/sink).

subtasks.title: Hardening: concurrency, integrity, and failure scenarios
subtasks.description: Handle edge cases like concurrent snapshot creation, out-of-order reads, partial writes, and ensure idempotency and retries.
subtasks.details:
• Concurrency control: use DB transactions at SERIALIZABLE or REPEATABLE READ; unique (session_id, upto_seq) prevents duplicate snapshots.
• Snapshot races: only one snapshot per uptoSeq; use INSERT ... ON CONFLICT DO NOTHING.
• Retry policy for transient DB errors; exponential backoff.
• Validation: detect gaps in seq during replay; if gaps, error and require maintenance.
• Large payloads: stream snapshot blob to DB to avoid memory spikes.
subtasks.testStrategy: Stress tests with parallel appends and snapshot jobs; assert no duplicate snapshots and no lost events. Fault injection to simulate transient failures and ensure retries succeed.

subtasks.title: Documentation and developer tooling
subtasks.description: Provide README and API docs for EventStore, SnapshotStore, ReplayEngine, and Branch API. Add CLI tooling to inspect sessions, list snapshots, verify hashes, and create branches.
subtasks.details:

• CLI commands: events:list, snapshots:list, snapshot:verify, branch:create.
• Examples: sample reducers and state schemas.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manual verification by running CLI against test DB; lint docs build.

tasks.title: A/B Harness for Model Comparison
tasks.description: Implement A/B evaluation harness across LLM/STT/TTS/Image adapters with metrics capture and toggle per campaign.
tasks.details:
- Experiment config: variant allocation, paired or split traffic
- Capture latency, token usage, quality tags; store in llm_messages/metrics
- UI: enable per-campaign; view basic charts
- Safe rollbacks; guardrails for budget limits
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC013: structural checks and metrics correctness under simulated runs
- Unit: allocation reproducibility with seed
- Load: run concurrent experiments without cross-talk

subtasks.title: Write tests for A/B harness acceptance criteria (TC013, unit, integration, UI, load)
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive automated test suite defining acceptance criteria for the A/B evaluation harness across LLM/STT/TTS/Image adapters. Cover configuration, allocation determinism, metrics capture, per-campaign toggles, charts visibility, budget guardrails, and safe rollback behavior. Include at least one unit test and one integration/UI test, plus a load test skeleton for concurrent experiments without cross-talk.
subtasks.details:
Implement tests first using your project's chosen stack (e.g., Jest + TS for unit/integration, Playwright for UI, k6 or node worker-based script for load). Scope:
- TC013 Structural/metrics correctness: simulate experiment runs and verify metrics persistence into llm_messages and metrics tables, including latency, token usage, and quality tags.
- Unit tests:
  - Allocation reproducibility with a seed: given an experiment id, user/session id, and seed, the same subject is assigned to the same variant for split traffic; for paired mode both variants are run and linked.
  - Budget guardrail: when spend or token budget threshold is reached per campaign, new traffic allocation halts or routes to control as configured.
  - Config validation: invalid variant allocation sums, missing adapters, or negative budgets are rejected.
- Integration tests:
  - Run harness across mock adapters implementing LLM/STT/TTS/Image interfaces; ensure per-adapter metrics captured and aggregated.
  - Concurrent experiments on different campaigns do not interfere (namespace isolation).
  - Safe rollback: toggling off experiment reverts to prior provider settings.
- UI tests (Playwright):
  - Enable A/B per campaign; configure variants, allocation, mode (paired/split), budgets; verify charts render basic metrics.
  - Verify guardrail banner/notice appears when budget hit and new allocations stop.
- Load test skeleton: spin N concurrent simulated sessions across two campaigns and two experiments; assert no cross-talk and acceptable latency aggregation.
Produce fixtures: mock adapters that return deterministic outputs with configurable latency and token usage. Seeded RNG helper for allocation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Map assertions to IDs: TC013 for structural and metrics checks; add TC014-UI for per-campaign toggle and charts; TC015-Load for concurrency isolation; TC016-Budget for guardrails; TC017-AllocationSeed for reproducibility. Tests must fail initially and be run in CI.

subtasks.title: Design experiment configuration schema and validation
subtasks.description: Define the A/B experiment domain model and validation rules to support variant allocation, paired vs split traffic, per-campaign enablement, budgets, and rollback strategy.
subtasks.details:
Add a versioned schema (Zod or io-ts) for ExperimentConfig with fields: id, campaignId, name, status (draft|running|paused|archived), mode (paired|split), allocation [{variantId, adapterKind (LLM|STT|TTS|Image), providerKey, model, weight 0..1}], seed (optional), trafficFilter (optional), startAt/stopAt (optional), guardrails {maxTokens, maxCost, maxRequests, actionOnExceed: halt|route_control|pause}, rollback {toProviderConfigSnapshotId}, metricsConfig {captureLatency: boolean, captureTokens: boolean, qualityTags: string[]}, createdBy, createdAt, updatedAt.
Validation rules:
- Sum of weights per adapterKind equals 1.0 for split mode.
- Paired mode requires exactly 2 variants per adapterKind or explicit pairing rules; allocation ignored.
- providerKey/model must exist in Provider Adapter Registry (Task 5 dependency).
- Budget values >= 0; at least one guardrail enabled or explicitly disabled.
- status transitions allowed: draft->running->paused/archived; paused->running.
Persist schema type in shared package. Implement validateExperimentConfig(config) that returns typed config or throws detailed errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run tests from 14.1; ensure invalid configs are rejected and valid pass. Add unit tests for edge cases: rounding of weights, missing variants, unknown providerKey.

subtasks.title: Extend database schema for experiments and metrics storage
subtasks.description: Add migrations and data access for experiments, allocations, runs, and metrics, integrating with existing llm_messages and a new metrics table.
subtasks.details:
Using existing DB stack (Task 2), add:
- Tables:
  - experiments: id, campaign_id, name, status, mode, seed, guardrails JSON, rollback_snapshot_id, created_at, updated_at.
  - experiment_variants: id, experiment_id, adapter_kind, provider_key, model, weight, metadata JSON.
  - experiment_runs: id, experiment_id, campaign_id, subject_key (user/session/message id), adapter_kind, mode, variant_a_id, variant_b_id (nullable), assigned_variant_id (nullable for paired), paired_group_id (for paired linking), started_at, completed_at, status, error.
  - metrics: id, experiment_run_id, adapter_kind, latency_ms, input_tokens, output_tokens, cost_micro, quality_tags TEXT[]/JSON, created_at.
- Augment existing llm_messages: add experiment_run_id nullable FK; ensure indices on campaign_id, created_at.
- Indices: experiments(campaign_id,status), experiment_runs(experiment_id,subject_key), metrics(experiment_run_id), and partial index for status='running'.
- Data access layer (repository functions) with transaction-safe inserts for run + metrics.
- Seed script updates for dev examples.
Handle SQLite compatibility (arrays via JSON). Ensure foreign keys and cascade deletes for archiving experiments.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute migration tests for up/down idempotency and CRUD. From 14.1 tests, verify metrics persist correctly and link to runs and llm_messages. Add performance smoke: insert >2k metrics/s on small batch locally if feasible.

subtasks.title: Implement allocation engine with seeded determinism and paired/split modes
subtasks.description: Create the runtime allocator that assigns variants per request/session with deterministic results under a given seed and subject key, supporting split and paired traffic.
subtasks.details:
Implement module allocateVariant({experiment, adapterKind, subjectKey}):
- For split mode: use a stable hash (e.g., murmurhash) seeded by experiment.seed to map subjectKey to [0,1) and select variant by cumulative weights. Ensure consistent across processes.
- For paired mode: return both variants (A and B) and generate a paired_group_id; executor will run both in sequence or parallel depending on adapter capability.
- Support traffic filtering and sticky assignment per subjectKey stored in experiment_runs to maintain consistency.
- Handle multiple adapter kinds by independent allocations per kind.
Add reproducibility options for test replays. Implement small PRNG utility to avoid platform differences.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use tests from 14.1 (TC017-AllocationSeed). Add unit tests verifying boundary conditions (exact weight edges), stability across process restarts, and paired linking.

subtasks.title: Execution harness integrating Provider Adapter Framework
subtasks.description: Build the execution layer that takes allocations and invokes the correct adapter variant(s), captures timings, tokens, costs, and stores messages and metrics atomically.
subtasks.details:
Create AbHarness.execute(request) where request includes campaignId, adapterKind, payload (prompt/audio/text/image spec), subjectKey, experimentId (optional). Steps:
- Resolve active experiment for campaign+adapterKind; if multiple, support single active per adapterKind or fail fast.
- Allocate variant(s) using allocation engine.
- For split: run selected adapter; for paired: run both variants; for LLM paired, optionally run A then B with same prompt and context; for STT/TTS/Image ensure same input.
- Capture timing via high-resolution timers; gather token usage/cost from adapter responses or estimate via tokenizer if needed.
- Begin transaction: insert experiment_run, store adapter outputs into llm_messages (link run id), write metrics row(s) with latency_ms, tokens, cost, quality_tags (initially empty).
- Return unified response with metadata {experimentRunId, variant info}.
- Provide hooks for post-run quality tagging and custom metrics enrichment.
Implement error handling: if variant call fails, record status=error, fallback to control variant if configured, and continue according to guardrails.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run integration tests from 14.1 for multi-adapter execution and metrics correctness. Add unit tests with mock adapters to simulate latency and token outputs and verify atomic writes.

subtasks.title: Budget guardrails and enforcement with safe rollback
subtasks.description: Implement budget tracking (tokens, cost, requests) per campaign/experiment with enforcement actions and automatic rollback to prior provider settings when configured.
subtasks.details:
Implement GuardrailService:
- Maintain counters aggregated from metrics table per experiment and campaign.
- On each new allocation/execution, check thresholds {maxTokens, maxCost, maxRequests}; if exceeded, apply actionOnExceed:
  - halt: reject new allocations for experiment and log event.
  - route_control: bypass experiment and use baseline provider config.
  - pause: set experiment.status=paused.
- Safe rollback: if rollback.toProviderConfigSnapshotId provided, restore provider settings atomically. Capture a pre-experiment snapshot when enabling experiment.
- Expose events for UI notifications and audit log entries.
Ensure concurrency-safety with DB transactions and last-write-wins guards.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use TC016-Budget and relevant integration tests from 14.1. Add unit tests for threshold boundary behavior and rollback idempotency. Simulate concurrent increments to ensure no double counting.

subtasks.title: Per-campaign experiment toggle and settings plumbing (backend API)
subtasks.description: Expose REST/IPC endpoints to create, validate, enable, pause, and archive experiments per campaign and snapshot provider settings for rollback.
subtasks.details:
Add API routes:
- POST /campaigns/:id/experiments (create+validate config)
- POST /campaigns/:id/experiments/:expId/enable (snapshot provider config, set running)
- POST /campaigns/:id/experiments/:expId/pause
- POST /campaigns/:id/experiments/:expId/archive
- GET /campaigns/:id/experiments (list with status and guardrail state)
- GET /experiments/:expId/metrics/summary (latency p50/p95, tokens, cost, by variant)
Auth/permissions per existing model. Wire to GuardrailService and Allocation/Execution layers. Emit events for UI. Ensure idempotency and proper status transitions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run integration tests to enable experiment and execute mock runs. Verify rollback snapshot existence. Add contract tests for each endpoint response shape and error codes.

subtasks.title: Metrics aggregation and basic charts backend
subtasks.description: Implement metrics aggregation queries and DTOs powering UI charts for latency, token usage, cost, and quality tags by variant over time.
subtasks.details:
Create aggregation service:

Within Campaign Settings, add an Experiments panel:

subtasks.title: React UI: basic charts and experiment status indicators

Add an Experiment Dashboard page:

subtasks.title: Safe rollback executor and provider snapshot manager

On rollback action: apply snapshot atomically, verify with post-apply read-back, and record audit event. Ensure idempotency and handle partial failures with retry and compensating actions.

subtasks.title: Concurrency isolation and cross-talk prevention
subtasks.description: Ensure experiments across campaigns and adapter kinds are isolated in allocation, execution, metrics, and guardrails under concurrent load.

Add advisory locks or compare-and-swap on run creation to avoid duplicate runs for the same subjectKey. Verify queue/executor isolation if present.
