tasks.title: Local-First Security and PII Redaction
tasks.description: Enforce local-only data, encrypted provider keys at rest, and PII redaction on logs and transcripts per policy.
tasks.details:
- Network guard: deny outbound except explicit provider hosts; config flag to fully offline
- Key storage via keytar; never write plaintext keys to DB or logs
- Redaction middleware for transcripts/logs using deterministic masking; consent flags for PvP interactions
- Structured logging with redacted fields
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC014: assert no unintended external writes via network interceptor tests
- Verify key encryption by attempting to read DB and finding no keys
- Redaction test corpus covering emails, names, locations

subtasks.title: Write tests for network guard, key storage, and PII redaction (TC014, TC015–TC017)
subtasks.description: Create unit, integration, and E2E tests capturing acceptance criteria for local-only networking, encrypted-at-rest provider keys, and deterministic PII redaction across logs/transcripts. Include offline mode behavior and consent flags for PvP interactions. No production code changes yet.
subtasks.details:
• Network guard tests (TC014):
  - Unit: mock HTTP client/interceptor; assert outbound requests are blocked by default and only allowed to explicit allowlist hosts; assert DNS/IP literal requests to non-allowed hosts are denied; assert protocol restrictions (http/https only) and port allow rules; assert environment variable proxy is ignored unless allowlisted.
  - Integration: spin a local test server and a disallowed remote host (use nock or msw). Verify attempts to call disallowed hosts fail with specific error code and are logged as security events without leaking request bodies. Verify offline flag denies even allowlisted hosts.
  - E2E: run a minimal app boot flow with offline flag true and ensure no outbound sockets are established (capture with a socket/sniffing helper) and that functionality relying on local cache works.
• Key storage tests (TC015):
  - Unit: mock key storage adapter; ensure plaintext keys are never returned from persistence layer; verify encryption/decryption boundaries; attempt to log keys and assert structured logger redacts.
  - Integration: write provider keys via API; inspect DB/files to verify no plaintext keys or decryptable material without OS keystore; simulate corrupted store; assert safe failures and no logs with secrets.
• PII redaction tests (TC016):
  - Unit: provide corpus with emails, names, phones, SSNs, addresses, coordinates, IPs, credit card numbers; assert deterministic masking (same token -> same mask), irreversible format; preserve structure for analytics fields; ensure Unicode and locale variations.
  - Snapshot: redact sample transcripts and logs; assert snapshots contain masked tokens and required structured fields remain.
• Consent flags for PvP tests (TC017):
  - Unit: when consent=false, redact or drop personally identifying speaker tags; when consent=true, allow pseudonymous identifiers; verify consent toggling mid-session re-redacts past messages where policy requires.
• Logging structure tests:
  - Unit: logger enforces redacted fields schema; disallows emitting objects with forbidden keys (e.g., apiKey, token) and auto-redacts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Map tests to TC IDs: TC014 (network egress policy), TC015 (keys never plaintext), TC016 (PII redaction determinism/coverage), TC017 (PvP consent). Include CI jobs running unit, integration, and an E2E smoke with offline flag. Use seeded randomness for deterministic masking and snapshots.

subtasks.title: Implement network guard with outbound deny-by-default and offline mode
subtasks.description: Add a process-wide network guard that intercepts all HTTP(S) egress and denies by default except explicit provider allowlist. Provide a config flag to force fully offline operation.
subtasks.details:
• Interception layer:
  - Node: wrap globalAgent/undici/axios/fetch with a policy interceptor; optionally use net.connect monkeypatch to enforce at socket level. In Electron, also register protocol interceptors.
  - Policy: default deny; allowlist of hostnames and pinned ports; support SNI/hostname verification; resolve DNS and verify final destination IP matches expected CIDR ranges if specified; block plain IP unless explicitly allowlisted; block non-TCP schemes.
  - Offline flag: config.local.offline=true short-circuits all outbound attempts with a typed error (ERR_OFFLINE_BLOCKED) and increments a metric.
  - Observability: structured security log event on block with: timestamp, dest_host (redacted if contains PII), reason, rule_id; no request body logged; include correlationId.
  - Configuration: load allowlist from signed config or environment; hot-reloadable; include explicit provider hosts (e.g., openai.com, anthropic.com) as examples in config only, not hardcoded.
  - Tests: run and fix failing tests from 15.1; add integration harness using nock/msw; validate no regressions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC014 tests. Add additional tests: proxy bypass attempts, IPv6 literals, redirect chains where initial host is allowed but redirect to disallowed host must be blocked.

subtasks.title: Add configuration management for allowlist and offline toggle
subtasks.description: Introduce secure configuration sources for network allowlist and an offline toggle with environment and file-based overrides, including validation and hot-reload.
subtasks.details:
• Config schema: define zod/ajv schema: { offline: boolean, allowlist: [{ host, ports, cidrs?, protocols? }] } with defaults to safest settings.
• Load order: env vars -> signed config file -> runtime admin API; validate and reject unsafe values.
• Hot-reload: watch config file; if changes, update the network guard rules atomically with versioning; emit audit log entry.
• Admin API (local-only): read-only endpoint to display current policy for UI; ensure not exposed over network in offline mode.
• Tests: re-run 15.1; add hot-reload tests ensuring in-flight connections are unaffected and new connections apply new policy.
subtasks.testStrategy: Property tests for schema validation; mutation tests for unsafe config (e.g., allowlist '*').

subtasks.title: Implement key storage using OS keychain via keytar
subtasks.description: Store provider API keys using OS keystore (keytar). Ensure keys are never written in plaintext to DB, files, or logs. Provide typed adapter APIs.
subtasks.details:
• Adapter design: KeyVault interface: setKey(provider, accountId, secret), getKey(provider, accountId), deleteKey, listEntries(). Implement KeytarKeyVault using keytar.
• Persistence: DB stores only references (provider, accountId, keyRefId), not secrets. Migrations to remove any legacy plaintext fields and replace with nullable references.
• Logging: redact on toString/inspect; structured logger sanitizer strips fields named apiKey/token/secret by path.
• Error handling: map keytar errors to domain errors; fallback behavior disabled by default (no plaintext fallback). Provide dev-only mock vault behind explicit ALLOW_INSECURE_DEV_VAULT.
• Tests: execute TC015; simulate DB reads to confirm absence of plaintext; attempt to log secrets and verify redaction.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests across supported OSs via CI matrix (macOS, Windows, Linux) with keytar. If unavailable in CI, use container images with libsecret/gnome-keyring for Linux.

subtasks.title: Add secure key ingestion and rotation APIs
subtasks.description: Expose local-only APIs/UI flows to add, rotate, and delete provider keys, enforcing validation and audit logging while keeping secrets only in keytar.
subtasks.details:
• API: POST /secrets/:provider (validate format via regex/luhn where applicable), POST /secrets/:provider/rotate, DELETE /secrets/:provider/:accountId.
• Transport: local IPC or localhost-only with mTLS disabled in offline mode; never send secrets over outbound network.
• Audit log: structured event with provider, accountId hash, action, initiator, result; no secret content.
• Rotation: dual-write window with old/new keyRefs, automatic cutover after validation ping (if offline, defer until connectivity resumes or manual confirm).
• UI: minimal modal that never echoes back full secret; show last4 and createdAt only.
• Tests: update TC015 integration; add negative tests for invalid formats and ensure no secret appears in any log.
subtasks.testStrategy: Contract tests for API; UI test for modal masking and copy-to-clipboard behavior without exposing full value.

subtasks.title: Build deterministic PII redaction engine and policy config
subtasks.description: Create a streaming-capable redaction engine with deterministic masking for PII types (emails, names, phones, SSNs, addresses, IPs, GPS, credit cards) and policy-driven controls.
subtasks.details:
• Engine: tokenization + pattern/rule-based detectors (regex + locale-aware libs) with optional ML hook later; map tokens to stable pseudonyms using HMAC(key, token) -> stable ID, format-preserving masks.
• Policy: config defines which entities to redact vs hash vs drop; include context-aware exceptions (e.g., system usernames). Seed key stored in keytar as RedactionSalt; rotate with versioning.
• Streaming: support incremental masking for transcripts/logs.
• Determinism: same input maps to same mask within a policy version; changing salt/version invalidates mapping.
• Performance: compile regexes; apply trie for known names list; limit backtracking; process UTF-8 safely.
• Tests: run TC016 corpus and snapshot tests; add property tests for determinism and irreversibility.
subtasks.testStrategy: Fuzz tests over random PII-like strings; performance benchmark to ensure under 5 ms/KB typical.

subtasks.title: Integrate redaction middleware into logging pipeline
subtasks.description: Introduce middleware that enforces redaction on all structured logs before emission with schema enforcement and forbidden fields auto-redaction.
subtasks.details:
• Logger wrapper: before write, pass message through redaction engine; drop or mask fields per policy; enforce schema shape (level, msg, eventId, fields).
• Field guards: recursively scan object keys for sensitive names (apiKey, token, secret, password, Authorization) and replace with [REDACTED].
• Metadata: attach redaction_version and policy_id; allow safe list of fields for observability.
• Sinks: console, file, and in-app viewer; ensure file sink uses append-only permissions.
• Tests: extend TC016 snapshots; ensure any attempt to log secret values gets masked; check performance overhead.
subtasks.testStrategy: Golden tests for representative log events; mutation tests ensuring no bypass when nested.

subtasks.title: Add transcript redaction middleware with consent-aware PvP handling
subtasks.description: Apply redaction to chat/transcript streams, honoring consent flags for player-vs-player interactions and pseudonymous identifiers.
subtasks.details:
• Middleware placement: before persistence and before any UI rendering/export.
• Consent: per-participant consent flag; if false, strip PII and replace speaker identifiers with pseudonyms; if true, allow pseudonymous ID but still redact sensitive PII; changes propagate historically if policy demands.
• Deterministic pseudonyms: use HMAC(seed, userId) to generate stable alias per campaign/session.
• Exports: ensure exported transcripts apply same policy; include redaction metadata.
• Tests: run TC017; regression tests for toggling consent mid-session; verify deterministic aliasing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests simulating multi-user chat with mixed consent; UI snapshot to verify masked display.

subtasks.title: Implement structured security and audit logging
subtasks.description: Standardize structured logging with redacted fields, security events taxonomy, and audit trail for key and policy operations.
subtasks.details:
• Event taxonomy: SECURITY_BLOCK, POLICY_CHANGE, SECRET_WRITE, SECRET_ROTATE, SECRET_DELETE, CONSENT_UPDATE.
• Schema: include actor (pseudonymous), action, objectRef, outcome, correlationId; ensure all payloads pass redaction middleware.
• Storage: append-only local file with rotation; protect with file permissions; optional local SQLite table with checksum.
• Query API: local-only read interface for UI.
• Tests: validate schema; verify no PII leakage; ensure events written for key ops and policy changes.
subtasks.testStrategy: E2E test where key rotation and policy change generate correct audit entries with no secrets.

subtasks.title: Add admin UI for security settings, keys, and redaction policy
subtasks.description: Provide a local-only admin UI to manage offline toggle, allowlist, keys, and redaction policy with safe UX that avoids exposing secrets.
subtasks.details:
• UI sections: Network (offline, allowlist), Keys (add/rotate/delete with masked display), Redaction Policy (entity toggles), Audit Log viewer.
• Security: ensure UI reads via local IPC; no external calls; copy-to-clipboard uses masked preview; confirm dialogs for destructive actions.
• Accessibility: clear labels and warnings when offline mode blocks providers.
• Tests: UI integration test to ensure no secret text nodes; snapshot for masked outputs; flow tests for key rotation and policy toggle updating runtime.
subtasks.testStrategy: Automated UI tests (Playwright) running locally; enforce no network requests during UI suite.

subtasks.title: Introduce policy versioning, rotation, and redaction salt management
subtasks.description: Manage redaction policy versions and rotation of the HMAC salt stored in keytar with safe reprocessing of stored logs/transcripts when required.
subtasks.details:
• Versioning: policy_id and salt_version; store in config and audit on change.
• Rotation: generate new salt, store in keytar; fromVersion -> toVersion migrator to re-redact stored artifacts or mark as legacy with compatibility view.
• Backfill job: batch reprocess transcripts/logs; track progress; throttle IO.
• Tests: simulate rotation; assert determinism changes; ensure old artifacts are either reprocessed or labeled; ensure audit entries created.
subtasks.testStrategy: Long-running integration test with dataset; verify no PII regression during rotation.

subtasks.title: Harden transports and dependency surfaces against leaks
subtasks.description: Ensure no unintended external writes via SDKs, telemetry, crash reporters, or dependency defaults. Disable or stub all third-party telemetry by default.
subtasks.details:
• Survey dependencies for telemetry; set env flags (e.g., ELECTRON_DISABLE_SECURITY_WARNINGS does not emit data; disable Sentry/Crashpad unless opt-in local-only).
• Replace global fetch/WS with guarded implementations; block WebSocket egress via the same network guard.
• Ensure DNS prefetching and auto-update are disabled.
• Tests: extend TC014 to include WebSocket and DNS prefetch attempts; verify blocks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Static analysis to search for known telemetry endpoints; runtime hooks to detect unexpected sockets.

subtasks.title: Implement data retention and secure deletion for redacted artifacts
subtasks.description: Define retention policies for logs/transcripts and implement secure deletion routines with index updates and audit logging.
subtasks.details:
• Retention config: max days/size; per-campaign overrides.
• Deletion: secure overwrite for files; for DB rows, wipe blob content and remove indexes; write AUDIT events.
• Compaction: rotate log files; prune old snapshots.
• Tests: ensure deletion removes PII even if policy rotates; verify audit entries and no dangling references.
subtasks.testStrategy: E2E retention expiry test with fake clock; validate disk usage before/after.

subtasks.title: Documentation and developer tooling for local-first security
subtasks.description: Provide clear docs, code owners, and pre-commit hooks that prevent accidental logging of secrets and enforce offline-safe patterns.
subtasks.details:
• Docs: threat model, network guard rules, redaction policy, key storage design, operational runbooks.
• Tooling: eslint rule to forbid logging certain keys; commit hook scanning for secrets; template examples for using redaction and key vault APIs.
• Onboarding: short guide for running in offline mode and testing flows.
• Tests: verify lint rules catch samples; ensure pre-commit hook blocks sample secrets.
subtasks.testStrategy: CI checks for docs presence; unit tests for custom ESLint rules.

tasks.title: Periodic Situation Updates (Ticker)
tasks.description: Broadcast periodic situation updates by time or event cadence to keep clients synchronized.
tasks.details:
- Ticker service: cron-like and event-driven triggers
- Compose updates from world state, mission progress, alliances status
- WebSocket broadcast on channels; throttle to avoid spam
- Configurable cadence per campaign
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC015: validate cadence and content fidelity vs true state
- Load test: ensure ticker doesn’t starve main loop
- Client receives without duplication

subtasks.title: Write tests for ticker cadence, content fidelity, throttling, and client delivery
subtasks.description: Author unit and integration tests that define the acceptance criteria for the Periodic Situation Updates (Ticker), covering time-based cadence, event-driven triggers, content composition from world/mission/alliance state, per-campaign configurable cadence, throttling to prevent spam, WebSocket broadcast on channels, no-duplication guarantees, and non-starvation under load.
subtasks.details: Create test skeletons and assertions before implementation. Map to verification IDs: TC015 (cadence and content fidelity), plus additional internal cases for load and deduplication. Define fixtures to simulate world state, mission progress, and alliance status. Include: 1) Unit tests for scheduler cadence: cron-like spec parsing, jitter, per-campaign overrides; 2) Unit tests for event-driven triggers firing on state changes; 3) Unit tests for composer correctness: assembling situation updates from supplied state snapshots; 4) Unit tests for throttler behavior and backoff; 5) Integration tests: WebSocket broadcast on named channels, multi-client receipt without duplicates, correct routing by campaign; 6) Load test stub to ensure ticker loop does not starve the main loop under configured QPS. Tag tests with TC015 where applicable.
subtasks.testStrategy: - Unit: schedule parsing, next-run computation, event trigger debounce, content composer correctness against fixtures (TC015). - Integration: WebSocket broadcast delivery to multiple clients with deduplication and channel routing; verify receipt order/time within tolerance. - Load: simulate N campaigns and M clients; assert main loop metrics remain within thresholds; ensure throttling engages. - Negative: invalid cadence config falls back to default with warning; malformed events don't crash.

subtasks.title: Define ticker domain model and configuration schema
subtasks.description: Create data models and configuration schema for ticker, including per-campaign cadence, event trigger specs, channel mapping, throttling parameters, and content template configuration.
subtasks.details: Implement types/interfaces: TickerConfig { campaignId, cadence: { cron?: string, intervalMs?: number, jitterPct?: number }, events: { enabled: boolean, topics: string[], debounceMs: number }, channels: { updates: string }, throttle: { minIntervalMs: number, burst: number, windowMs: number }, payload: { include: { world: boolean, mission: boolean, alliances: boolean }, redact?: string[] } }. Provide JSON Schema/Zod validation with descriptive errors and defaults (e.g., intervalMs default 30000, jitterPct 0.1, debounceMs 500, throttle.minIntervalMs 2000). Add config loader resolving campaign-level overrides and env defaults. Run tests from 16.1 and fix any schema-related test failures.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: schema validates good configs, rejects invalid; defaulting behavior; override precedence (global -> campaign).

subtasks.title: Implement cron-like and interval scheduler with jitter
subtasks.description: Create scheduling engine to compute next tick times from cron expressions or fixed intervals, including jitter support and pause/resume hooks.
subtasks.details: Implement Scheduler service with APIs: scheduleInterval(campaignId, intervalMs, jitterPct), scheduleCron(campaignId, cronExpr), cancel(campaignId), pause/resume. Use a priority timer wheel or min-heap of next-run timestamps. Ensure drift-correct scheduling (compute next based on previous scheduled time, not actual fire time). Add clock abstraction for testability. Integrate per-campaign instances via TickerConfig. Run the cadence unit tests; adjust to meet time tolerance (e.g., ±5%).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: next-run computation for various crons, jitter bounds, pause/resume, cancellation; fake timers for deterministic checks (TC015 cadence aspect).

subtasks.title: Implement event-driven trigger subsystem with debounce
subtasks.description: Build event listeners for world, mission, and alliance state topics that can trigger updates based on configured topics with debouncing and deduplication.
subtasks.details: Create EventTrigger service that subscribes to message bus topics (e.g., world.updated, mission.progressed, alliances.changed). Implement debounce per campaign/topic using timers keyed by campaignId+topic with debounceMs from config. Coalesce multiple events during debounce window into one trigger with merged context (e.g., union of changed entity IDs). Provide backpressure: cap pending triggers and drop oldest with metrics logging. Run tests for event trigger firing and debounce behavior.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: fires once per debounce window; multiple topics produce separate triggers; disabled events do not fire; malformed events handled safely.

subtasks.title: Implement situation update composer
subtasks.description: Create a deterministic composer that assembles an update payload from world state, mission progress, and alliance status, with optional redaction and templated summary text.
subtasks.details: Design Composer with interface compose(campaignId, snapshot): returns { campaignId, ts, seq, summary, world, mission, alliances, version }. Pull snapshot from provided state accessors. Apply payload.include flags and redact fields listed in config.redact. Implement summary templates with i18n-ready tokens and length guard (e.g., 140–280 chars). Increment a per-campaign monotonic sequence number for deduplication. Ensure stable field ordering for test assertions. Run content fidelity tests from 16.1.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: given seeded fixtures, composer matches expected payload (TC015 content fidelity); redaction removes configured paths; sequence increments correctly.

subtasks.title: Build throttling and rate control
subtasks.description: Implement per-campaign throttle to prevent spam from time and event bursts, enforcing minimum intervals and token-bucket style burst limits.
subtasks.details: Introduce Throttler with config throttle: { minIntervalMs, burst, windowMs }. Use a token bucket per campaign: tokens refill at burst/windowMs, capped at burst. Allow pass if lastSentAt older than minIntervalMs and tokens available; else queue last-update-only or drop with metric depending on policy. Integrate with Scheduler and EventTrigger so both routes pass through Throttler before publish. Run throttling unit tests and integration tests to confirm reduced spam without starving.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: respects minInterval and burst semantics; boundary conditions around window refill. Integration: burst of events results in <= allowed publishes; ensures last event eventually published.

subtasks.title: Implement WebSocket channel broadcasting with deduplication
subtasks.description: Broadcast updates on per-campaign channels over WebSocket, ensuring no duplicates and correct client routing.
subtasks.details: Create TickerPublisher using existing WebSocket gateway. Channel name from config.channels.updates (e.g., campaign:{id}:ticker). Include payload with seq and hash (e.g., SHA-256 of normalized payload) to support deduplication. Maintain per-campaign lastHash/lastSeq to avoid sending identical payloads twice. Set message type 'ticker.update'. Implement idempotent publish and retry on transient failures with exponential backoff. Run integration tests from 16.1 to verify multi-client receipt and no duplication.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: multiple clients subscribe and receive exactly one message per update; order preserved by seq. Negative: simulated network retries do not produce duplicates.

subtasks.title: Wire ticker orchestration loop
subtasks.description: Compose scheduler, event triggers, composer, throttler, and publisher into a cohesive ticker service managing multiple campaigns.
subtasks.details: Implement TickerService managing CampaignTicker instances. Each instance registers interval/cron schedules and event subscriptions. On trigger: fetch snapshot, build payload via Composer, pass through Throttler, then publish via Publisher. Ensure isolation per campaign. Add lifecycle methods start(campaignId), stop(campaignId), reloadConfig(campaignId). Provide metrics: ticks_scheduled, triggers_received, composed_ok, throttled, published, dropped_duplicate, errors. Run all existing tests; adjust orchestration to satisfy them.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: end-to-end trigger to client flow works for multiple campaigns concurrently; stop() halts emits; reloadConfig applies new cadence without restart.

subtasks.title: Add configurable cadence per campaign and admin controls
subtasks.description: Expose configuration entry points and admin APIs to set and update cadence and event settings per campaign at runtime.
subtasks.details: Implement Admin API endpoints or CLI: GET/PUT /campaigns/{id}/ticker-config. Validate via schema; persist to config store. On update, call TickerService.reloadConfig(campaignId). Add RBAC checks. Provide audit logs of changes. Update tests to exercise dynamic cadence change and confirm scheduler reconfigures without message loss.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: change cadence from 30s interval to cron spec and verify emission timing transitions cleanly; permissions enforced; invalid config rejected with clear errors.

subtasks.title: Ensure ticker does not starve main loop under load
subtasks.description: Introduce resource isolation and backpressure so ticker work cannot starve the main game loop under heavy load.
subtasks.details: Run ticker tasks on a bounded worker pool or queue with priority lower than the main loop. Use asynchronous snapshot retrieval with timeouts and cancellation. Set per-campaign in-flight cap. Add metrics and configurable limits. Execute load tests from 16.1 and tune parameters to meet CPU and latency budgets.
subtasks.testStrategy: Load: simulate high event rates across campaigns; assert main loop tick time and GC metrics remain within target; ticker publishes may be throttled but not block main loop.

subtasks.title: Implement persistence for sequence and last-hash state
subtasks.description: Persist per-campaign sequence counters and last-hash to survive restarts and avoid duplicates or regressions.
subtasks.details: Add lightweight storage (e.g., Redis or DB table) keyed by campaignId: { seq, lastHash, lastSentAt }. Initialize CampaignTicker from persisted state; flush updates atomically after publish. Handle migration defaults. Update tests to restart service and ensure continuity of seq and dedup behavior.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: after restart, next seq increments correctly; duplicate suppression still works; no replays unless explicitly requested.

subtasks.title: Observability: metrics, logs, and alerts
subtasks.description: Provide comprehensive instrumentation and alerting for ticker performance and correctness.
subtasks.details: Emit Prometheus metrics for scheduling, queue sizes, throttle events, publish counts, errors, and latencies (compose, publish). Structured logs include campaignId, triggerType, seq. Add SLOs and alerts (e.g., zero publishes over 5m during active hours, error rate >1%). Integrate tracing spans across components. Ensure tests assert presence of key metrics in integration runs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: verify metrics endpoints expose expected series after simulated activity; log lines include correlation IDs.

subtasks.title: Security and validation hardening
subtasks.description: Harden inputs and outputs: validate snapshots, sanitize payloads, enforce channel authorization, and prevent information leakage.
subtasks.details: Add strict schema validation for composed payloads; enforce max payload size; redact configured fields; verify only authorized clients can subscribe to campaign channels. Fuzz tests for snapshot anomalies. Ensure PII is not broadcast if marked for redaction. Run full test suite.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: unauthorized client cannot subscribe; payloads pass schema; redaction verified by golden tests.

subtasks.title: Client-side subscription and UI validation tests
subtasks.description: Add UI/integration tests ensuring clients subscribe to ticker channels, display updates without duplication, and handle throttled bursts gracefully.
subtasks.details: Using Playwright or equivalent, spin up two clients in the same campaign. Subscribe to ticker channel; trigger updates via test hooks. Assert both clients render exactly one card/toast per update, in order, with correct summary. Simulate burst and ensure UI shows latest state without flicker. Tag with TC015 client receipt aspect.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI/Integration: subscription success, render correctness, dedup on client, resilience to reconnects.

subtasks.title: Operational runbooks and configuration examples
subtasks.description: Document runbooks for configuring ticker cadence, troubleshooting, and capacity planning; provide sample configs per campaign archetype.
subtasks.details: Create docs covering: enabling ticker, cadence options, event topics, throttling tuning, metrics to watch, common errors, and rollback. Provide YAML/JSON examples for slow/medium/fast campaigns. Include procedures for safe config changes during live operations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Doc linting and example schema validation in CI; manual review checklist.

tasks.title: Content Packs: Import/Export with Signing and Validation
tasks.description: Support signed JSON content packs for worlds, missions, items with schema and signature validation.
tasks.details:
- Pack format: manifest.json, assets/, signatures
- Sign/verify with ed25519 local keys; store public keys whitelist
- Validate JSON schema; write to content/packs/
- Import UI flow; export existing campaign content
- Safe sandbox: no code execution
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC016: import/export flows; reject invalid signatures/schemas
- Unit: schema validation and asset linking
- Security: path traversal prevention tests

subtasks.title: Define acceptance tests for signed content pack import/export (TC016, security, schema, UI)
subtasks.description: Create comprehensive unit, integration, and UI tests that define the acceptance criteria for content pack import/export with schema and signature validation, asset handling, and sandbox safety. Include negative tests for signature and schema failures, and path traversal prevention.
subtasks.details: Implement tests first. Cover: 1) Unit tests: a) Schema validation for worlds, missions, items manifests/manifests.json using JSON Schema; b) Ed25519 signature verify success/failure with key whitelist; c) Asset linking rules and missing asset rejection; d) Safe extraction prevents path traversal and symlink escapes; e) No code execution within packs (e.g., .js/.sh ignored); f) Writing to content/packs/ only; g) Public key whitelist CRUD persistence. 2) Integration tests (TC016): a) End-to-end import of a valid signed .zip pack with manifest.json and assets/; b) Export existing campaign content to a pack, sign it, then import back and assert equivalence; c) Reject packs with invalid/unknown signatures; d) Reject invalid schema; e) Clean rollback on partial failures. 3) UI tests: a) Import flow prompts file selection and displays validation summary; b) Export flow allows selecting campaign scope and shows success; c) Error banners for invalid signature/schema. 4) Security tests: path traversal attempts in zip (../, absolute paths), zip bombs (huge zip central directory vs uncompressed), and signature replay with modified payload.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use Jest/Vitest for unit tests, Playwright/Cypress for UI, and a temporary filesystem sandbox for integration. Tag key cases as TC016-UT-001.., TC016-IT-001.., TC016-UI-001..; include Security: TC016-SEC-001.. for traversal/zip bomb. Use deterministic fixtures for ed25519 keys and sample packs.

subtasks.title: Design content pack specification and JSON Schemas
subtasks.description: Define the content pack structure and JSON Schemas for manifest and domain objects (worlds, missions, items). Document the format, required fields, and constraints.
subtasks.details: Specify pack layout: root contains manifest.json, assets/ directory with referenced files, signatures/ directory containing detached signatures. Manifest fields: packId (UUID), name, version (semver), type(s) [world|mission|item], createdAt, toolVersion, entries array with per-object metadata {id, kind, schemaVersion, path (JSON file path in pack), assets: [relative asset paths], integrity: SHA256 of object JSON}. Signatures: signatures/manifest.json.sig (ed25519 detached over canonicalized manifest.json), signatures/entries/<entry-id>.sig (optional per-entry). Define JSON Schemas (Draft 2020-12): a) manifest.json; b) world.json; c) mission.json; d) item.json. Include $id and schemaVersion. Add constraints: disallow absolute paths; paths must be normalized and under pack root; asset filenames whitelist (png,jpg,jpeg,webp,ogg,mp3,wav,json). Document signature canonicalization (UTF-8, JSON canonical serializer e.g., RFC8785 or deterministic stable stringify).
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate schemas against fixtures in tests from 17.1. Ensure examples pass and counterexamples fail. Version schemas and include backwards compatibility notes.

subtasks.title: Implement Ed25519 key management with whitelist persistence
subtasks.description: Create services to generate/import/export local ed25519 keys and maintain a whitelist of trusted public keys for verification.
subtasks.details: Implement KeyStore: a) Generate local ed25519 keypair using libsodium/tweetnacl; b) Store private key securely (OS keychain if available, else encrypted at rest); c) Persist public key whitelist with metadata (keyId, label, createdAt, fingerprint) in app config store; d) CRUD operations: add/remove/list; e) Provide sign(data) and verify(data, signature, pubkey) methods; f) Fingerprint: SHA256(pubkey) hex. Expose API for UI to manage whitelist.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: key generation determinism not required but verify key lengths, fingerprint formation, sign/verify roundtrip, whitelist add/remove/list persistence, and rejection when pubkey not in whitelist (TC016-UT-key-001..).

subtasks.title: Implement JSON canonicalization and signing/verification utilities
subtasks.description: Build utilities to canonicalize JSON and perform detached ed25519 signing and verification for manifest and entries.
subtasks.details: Implement canonicalizer using RFC8785 or stable stringify: sort object keys, normalize numbers/booleans/strings, UTF-8 encoding. Create functions: canonicalizeJson(obj) -> Uint8Array; signJson(obj, privateKey) -> signature; verifyJson(obj, signature, publicKey) -> boolean. For entries with integrity hash, ensure signing covers the canonicalized JSON exactly as stored. For manifest, sign the canonicalized manifest.json. Provide file helpers to read JSON, canonicalize, and compute SHA-256 integrity to compare with manifest entries.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: canonicalization stability across equivalent objects, signature ver/invalid with mutated fields, mismatch when whitespace differs but canonical content same passes, integrity hash changes upon mutation (TC016-UT-sig-001..).

subtasks.title: Safe ZIP reader and extractor with sandboxing
subtasks.description: Create a secure ZIP processing module that parses and extracts packs into a temp sandbox, preventing path traversal, symlink escapes, and zip bombs. No code execution.
subtasks.details: Implement zip reading using a streaming parser. Before extraction, scan entries: reject entries with absolute paths, .. segments, backslashes on non-Windows normalized outside root, or symlinks. Enforce size limits: total uncompressed bytes cap (configurable), per-file cap, entry count cap; detect zip bombs via compression ratio thresholds. Extract to a temporary directory under app cache. Disallow executing any files; ignore executable bits; filter only allowed filetypes. After validation & verification, move into content/packs/<packId-version>/ atomically.
subtasks.testStrategy: Security tests from 17.1 should pass: path traversal (../evil), absolute path (/etc/passwd), symlink entries, zip bomb heuristic. Add unit tests for normalization logic across OS path separators (TC016-SEC-001..).

subtasks.title: Schema validation engine and domain validators
subtasks.description: Implement JSON Schema validation for manifest and domain objects with helpful error reporting and version handling.
subtasks.details: Use Ajv (Draft 2020-12) with formats and strict mode. Precompile schemas for manifest, world, mission, item. Implement validateManifest(json) and validateEntry(kind, json). Include schemaVersion checks and migrations stub for future versions. Produce user-friendly error messages for UI. Integrate integrity check: compute SHA256 of entry JSON and compare to manifest.integrity.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: valid fixtures pass, invalid required fields/type mismatches fail with clear messages; integrity mismatch rejects; version bump behavior verified (TC016-UT-schema-001..).

subtasks.title: Content repository writer with atomic install to content/packs/
subtasks.description: Implement writing imported packs to the content repository with atomic moves and rollback on failure.
subtasks.details: Create ContentRepo service: a) Staging directory for validated packs; b) Atomic move to content/packs/<packId>/<version>/ with lockfile to prevent races; c) Index file updating a registry of installed packs (packId, version, keys used, install date); d) On failure, clean staging and do not leave partial state; e) Ensure file permissions safe and no executables marked.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: simulate mid-operation failure to assert rollback; verify final layout matches spec; concurrency test with two imports of same pack to ensure one wins and the other reports duplicate (TC016-IT-repo-001..).

subtasks.title: Import pipeline: verify, validate, and install
subtasks.description: Build the end-to-end import pipeline that consumes a .zip, performs all security and validity checks, and installs the pack.
subtasks.details: Pipeline steps: 1) Open zip in sandbox; 2) Locate required files (manifest.json, signatures/manifest.json.sig); 3) Parse manifest; 4) Verify signature against a public key present in whitelist; 5) For each entry, load JSON, validate schema by kind, verify integrity hash; optionally verify per-entry signatures if provided; 6) Validate asset files exist and are within assets/ and match referenced paths; 7) Enforce safe sandbox rules; 8) If all checks pass, install via ContentRepo; 9) Emit structured result with warnings and errors.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests (TC016): valid pack imports successfully; invalid signature/schema rejected with clear errors; missing asset rejection; ensure no writes outside content/packs/. UI tests will consume messages.

subtasks.title: Export pipeline: serialize, hash, and sign existing content
subtasks.description: Implement export of selected campaign/world/mission/item data into a signed content pack zip with correct layout.
subtasks.details: Steps: 1) Select objects to export via API filters; 2) Serialize domain objects to stable JSON; 3) Build manifest.json with entries and SHA-256 integrity for each JSON file; 4) Collect referenced assets from repository into assets/; 5) Canonicalize manifest and create detached ed25519 signature using local private key; 6) Optionally include per-entry signatures; 7) Package into .zip with safe paths; 8) Output file named <packId>-<version>.zip.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: export then import round-trip preserves data equivalence; signature verifies; tamper with zip and expect import failure (TC016-IT-export-001..).

subtasks.title: UI: Import flow with validation summary
subtasks.description: Build UI to select a pack file, run import pipeline, and present a clear validation summary, errors, and installed pack details.
subtasks.details: UI components: file picker; progress display (parsing, verifying, validating, installing); results panel listing entries, asset counts, signer fingerprint and label, and any warnings/errors. Provide actions: view manifest, view errors, open installed location. Handle large packs with streaming progress updates. Respect safe sandbox (disable execution).
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests (Playwright/Cypress): happy path shows success with details; invalid signature shows error banner and no installation occurs; schema errors surfaced per entry (TC016-UI-import-001..).

subtasks.title: UI: Export flow with scope selection and signer choice
subtasks.description: Build UI to export existing campaign content with selection of scope and signer key, then run export pipeline and offer download.
subtasks.details: UI allows: selecting campaign/worlds/missions/items; choose version and pack metadata; pick signer key from local key store; run export; show result including manifest preview, signature fingerprint, counts, and file size; provide Save As dialog. Persist last-used options.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests: select scope, export completes, file downloaded; invalid configuration (no key) blocks export with guidance; round-trip test pairs with 17.8 (TC016-UI-export-001..).

subtasks.title: Public key whitelist management UI
subtasks.description: Provide UI for managing trusted public keys used to verify content pack signatures.
subtasks.details: Implement list/add/remove UI: display key label, fingerprint, createdAt; import public key from file/paste; validate format; prevent duplicates; allow revoke/disable. Expose integration for import pipeline to display which key verified the pack.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI tests: add valid key, reject malformed, remove key, verify that import of a pack signed by removed key now fails (TC016-UI-keys-001..).

subtasks.title: Security hardening: filetype filtering, PII-safe logs, and no code execution
subtasks.description: Finalize security controls ensuring only allowed file types are processed, logs are redacted, and no code is executed from packs.
subtasks.details: Implement allowlist-based MIME detection (magic numbers) for assets; block scripts/binaries; ensure logs redact sensitive fields (file paths, key material) and avoid printing JSON secrets; enforce read-only handling of pack contents until installation; disable any dynamic code loading on import; integrate with existing redaction middleware from Task 15 if available.
subtasks.testStrategy: Security tests: attempt to include .js/.sh/.exe assets and ensure they are rejected; confirm logs contain redacted fields and no secrets; attempt to trigger code execution via crafted manifest and verify none occurs (TC016-SEC-filetype-001..).

subtasks.title: Repository indexing and query APIs
subtasks.description: Expose APIs to list installed packs, query by kind/version, and fetch entries/assets for use by other modules.
subtasks.details: Implement read APIs over the content repo registry: listPacks(), getPack(packId, version), listEntries(packId), getEntryJson(packId, entryId), getAssetStream(packId, path). Enforce read paths within repo root. Provide pagination for large collections.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit/integration tests: install sample pack and ensure query APIs return correct metadata and content; path traversal attempts on getters rejected (TC016-IT-repoapi-001..).

subtasks.title: Error handling, rollback, and user-facing messages
subtasks.description: Standardize error codes, rollback behavior, and user-visible messages for all import/export operations.
subtasks.details: Define error taxonomy: SIGNATURE_INVALID, SIGNER_UNTRUSTED, SCHEMA_INVALID, INTEGRITY_MISMATCH, ASSET_MISSING, ZIP_UNSAFE, REPO_CONFLICT, EXPORT_FAILED. Map internal exceptions to codes and localized messages. Ensure partial states are rolled back and temporary files cleaned. Surface actionable guidance in UI.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration/UI tests: simulate each error and verify correct code/message shown; inspect filesystem to confirm no partial installs remain (TC016-IT-errors-001..).

subtasks.title: Performance and scalability tuning
subtasks.description: Optimize import/export for large packs with many entries and assets.
subtasks.details: Add streaming hashing and verification; parallelize schema validation with a worker pool; throttle I/O to avoid UI stalls; progress events with percentage and ETA. Add config for size limits and timeouts. Ensure memory usage stays bounded.
subtasks.testStrategy: Bench tests: import 1–5 GB packs with thousands of assets in a controlled environment; ensure throughput targets and no timeouts; verify correctness not affected (TC016-PERF-001..).

subtasks.title: Documentation and developer guide
subtasks.description: Write developer and user documentation for content pack format, signing, verification, and UI flows.
subtasks.details: Provide spec docs for pack structure and schemas; CLI/API examples for signing and verifying; screenshots of UI flows; troubleshooting guide mapping errors to fixes; security notes on safe packaging and allowed file types. Include versioning policy and migration guidance.
subtasks.testStrategy: Docs linting and example validation: run schema examples through validators; run CLI examples as part of CI to ensure they work (TC016-DOC-001..).

tasks.title: Multi-Campaign Isolation Layer
tasks.description: Ensure full data, assets, vector memories, and schedules isolation for parallel campaigns.
tasks.details:
- Context object carries campaign_id; middleware enforces scoping on all queries
- File cache per-campaign subdirs
- Realtime namespace per campaign; no cross-broadcasts
- Clone/Archive flows implemented in APIs
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC017: run two concurrent campaigns and verify no leakage across DB queries, caches, WS channels

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and unit/integration tests for isolation (TC017, TC018, TC019)
subtasks.description: Author tests that codify multi-campaign isolation across data queries, file cache, realtime namespaces, vector memories, and schedules. Include: (a) unit tests for middleware scoping by campaign_id and guard rails blocking cross-campaign access; (b) integration/E2E tests that run two concurrent campaigns and verify no leakage across DB queries, caches, and WebSocket channels; (c) API tests for Clone and Archive flows to ensure isolation is preserved post-operation. Map cases to TC017 (parallel isolation), TC018 (clone/archive isolation), and TC019 (schedule/job isolation).
subtasks.details:
Create a top-level test plan and scaffolding:
- Test IDs: TC017: end-to-end isolation across DB, cache, WS; TC018: clone/archive isolation; TC019: schedule/job isolation.
- Unit tests (server):
  - Middleware: rejects/filters queries where request context campaign_id does not match resource campaign_id.
  - Repository layer: all queries require campaign scope; verify parameterized campaign_id use; fail without scope.
  - File cache helper: resolves paths under campaign-specific subdirs and forbids path traversal between campaigns.
  - Realtime broker: publishes to `realtime:<campaign_id>` namespace only; verify no cross-broadcasts when subscribed to different namespaces.
  - Vector memory store: namespaces `campaign:<id>` and `player:<id>` enforced; cross-campaign retrieval returns empty.
  - Scheduler: jobs tagged with campaign_id; dispatch filters by campaign; ensure no cross-trigger.
- Integration tests:
  - Spin up two campaigns A and B with seeded users, assets, vector memories, schedules.
  - Verify querying A cannot access B records, assets, vectors, or WS messages.
  - File cache writes in A are not visible in B and vice versa.
  - WebSocket: two clients subscribe to different namespaces; verify messages do not leak.
  - Clone A→A2: verify A2 receives only cloned artifacts under new IDs/namespaces; A remains unaffected; no reference pointers back to A.
  - Archive B: verify archived campaign becomes read-only; no broadcasts; schedules disabled; no effect on A.
- Data fixtures: factories for Campaign, Player, Memory, Asset, Schedule; utilities to create WS clients bound to campaign namespace.
- CI configuration: mark TC017/TC018/TC019; parallelize tests to simulate concurrent campaigns.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute unit tests first to lock guard behavior; then run integration tests bringing up minimal services (DB, cache, WS broker, scheduler). Use coverage thresholds on guard modules (>90%).

subtasks.title: Implement and enforce context propagation of campaign_id across request lifecycle
subtasks.description: Ensure campaign_id from the authenticated principal or request parameters is propagated deterministically through all layers (HTTP, jobs, WS, repositories, file cache, vector memory, and scheduler). Block processing if campaign_id is missing or ambiguous.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Context object: define `RequestContext { campaignId: string; userId?: string; roles?: string[]; }`.
- HTTP middleware: extract campaign_id from route param/header/token; validate against user entitlements; attach to RequestContext; reject requests without valid campaign scope (HTTP 400/403).
- WS connection handshake: require campaign_id param; bind connection to `realtime:<campaignId>` room; store on connection context.
- Job queue: include campaignId in job payload and in job metadata; worker bootstraps RequestContext per job.
- Repository base class: require campaignId argument; generic guard that throws if undefined; ensure every method includes scoped filters.
- Utilities (file cache, vector store, scheduler): accept RequestContext or explicit campaignId; remove unscoped overloads to prevent misuse.
- Add lint rule or TypeScript types that disallow calling repository methods without campaignId param.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests for context extraction and propagation. Ensure failing paths for missing campaignId. Re-run TC017 unit subset.

subtasks.title: Middleware guards for DB query scoping by campaign_id
subtasks.description: Implement DB-layer scoping: every read/write query must include campaign_id filter and writes must set campaign_id. Block cross-campaign access even if primary keys are known.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Query builder wrapper: augment with `withCampaignScope(campaignId)` that injects `WHERE campaign_id = ?` for SELECT/UPDATE/DELETE and sets `campaign_id` on INSERT.
- Row-level security (optional if supported): add DB RLS policy enforcing `current_setting('app.campaign_id')` match; set via per-connection session variable from middleware.
- Repository audit: refactor repositories to use the scoped builder; remove unsafe methods.
- Add guard tests for typical entities: Messages, Assets, Players, Schedules, Memories.
- Add migration checks: ensure tables have campaign_id column and composite indices `(campaign_id, key)` for performance.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute unit tests for middleware guards and repository scoping; run integration DB tests for campaigns A and B performing cross reads/writes expected to fail.

subtasks.title: Per-campaign file cache directories and access controls
subtasks.description: Ensure all cached assets are stored under per-campaign subdirectories and cannot be read across campaigns. Prevent path traversal and enforce read/write isolation.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Directory structure: `<CACHE_ROOT>/campaigns/<campaignId>/<assetType>/<hash or uuid>`.
- Helper API: `getCampaignCachePath(campaignId, ...segments)` validates segments (no `..`, no absolute paths) and ensures directory exists with strict permissions.
- File read/write wrappers require campaignId and enforce path within the campaign root.
- Garbage collection: clean only within campaign root.
- Add OS-level permissions if applicable (uid/gid separation in multi-tenant hosts).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests for path resolver/traversal prevention and cross-campaign access denial. Integration: write assets in A and verify they are absent/inaccessible in B.

subtasks.title: Realtime namespaces per campaign; prevent cross-broadcasts
subtasks.description: Create isolated realtime namespaces keyed by campaign_id and ensure events emitted in one namespace are never delivered to another.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Namespace schema: `realtime:<campaignId>` rooms/topics.
- On connect: validate campaignId; join only that room; store mapping connectionId→campaignId.
- Publish API: requires campaignId; automatically routes to the correct namespace; reject attempts to publish to mismatched campaign.
- Server-side filters: beforeEmit hook checks message.campaignId matches connection's campaignId.
- Monitoring: metrics per namespace to detect anomalies.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: verify publish/subscribe isolation rules. Integration: spawn two WS clients for A and B; publish in A; assert B receives nothing (TC017).

subtasks.title: Vector memory namespaces with campaign and player isolation
subtasks.description: Implement vector memory segregation using explicit namespaces for campaign and player data; enforce retrieval scoped to the caller’s campaign and optional player.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Namespace keys: `campaign:<campaignId>` for shared memory; `player:<playerId>` for per-player; both always tied to campaignId in metadata.
- Write API requires campaignId; for player memory, also require playerId that is validated within the same campaign.
- Retrieval API: `retrieve(query, scope)` requires scope ∈ {campaign, player}; when player, include both playerId and campaignId; ensure cross-campaign queries return empty.
- Storage backends: ensure embeddings index is partitioned or filtered by namespace; if single index, always include namespace token in vector metadata and filter pre/post search.
- Auditing: log namespace and campaignId for writes/reads.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: namespace enforcement and cross-campaign retrieval returns empty. Integration: seed A and B with distinct vectors; verify isolation holds; align with TC017.

subtasks.title: Scheduler isolation: per-campaign job tagging and dispatch filtering
subtasks.description: Ensure scheduled tasks and background jobs are isolated by campaign_id, including triggers, runners, and time-based schedules.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Job schema: include `campaignId` and optional `tenantKey` in job payload and indexing.
- Enqueue API requires campaignId; worker initializes RequestContext and validates job.campaignId.
- Dispatch filters: workers subscribe to streams filtered by campaignId; prevent a worker from handling jobs of a different campaign context unless explicitly multi-campaign safe.
- Cron/schedule store: persist schedules with campaignId; when firing, pass campaignId into job creation.
- Archive state handling: if campaign archived, skip/disable schedules.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: verify enqueuing without campaignId fails; worker refuses mismatched jobs. Integration: two campaigns with overlapping schedules fire independently (TC019).

subtasks.title: Clone flow: deep copy campaign data into new isolated campaign
subtasks.description: Implement clone API to deep copy campaign-scoped entities (data, assets, vector memories, schedules) into a new campaign with new identifiers and namespaces, ensuring no shared references or cross-links.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Clone plan: create new campaign record; map old→new IDs; copy DB records with campaign_id set to new; regenerate secrets/tokens.
- Assets: duplicate files from `<A>` to `<A2>` cache directory; re-hash if necessary; update references.
- Vector memories: reindex into `campaign:<A2>` namespace; do not share underlying vector IDs.
- Schedules: duplicate with new identifiers and ensure next-run timestamps preserved or offset per spec.
- Realtime: create namespace for new campaign; no clients auto-subscribed.
- Validation: ensure no foreign keys or URLs point to original campaign after clone.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: TC018 part 1. After clone, assert all artifacts exist under new campaign and none are referenced back to the source. Run WS isolation and cache isolation on cloned campaign.

subtasks.title: Archive flow: enforce read-only state and disable schedules/broadcasts
subtasks.description: Implement campaign archive operation that marks campaign as archived and enforces read-only access, disables schedules, and blocks realtime broadcasts for that campaign.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- DB: campaign status field `active|archived`.
- Middleware: if archived, reject mutating operations (POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE) with 409/423.
- Scheduler: on archive, cancel or pause schedules; workers drop jobs with archived campaignId.
- Realtime: publishing in archived campaign returns error/no-op.
- File cache: keep assets accessible read-only; block writes.
- Admin override: explicit maintenance token for unarchive if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: TC018 part 2. Archive a campaign; verify writes fail, schedules stop, and realtime publish is blocked; reads still scoped and allowed.

subtasks.title: API surface validation: enforce campaign_id requirement on all endpoints
subtasks.description: Audit and update all API endpoints to require campaign_id in path or header, validate authorization, and pass context downstream. Add contract tests.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- OpenAPI: declare campaignId parameter for relevant routes; mark required.
- Middleware binding: standardize extraction from path `/campaigns/{campaignId}/...` or `X-Campaign-Id` header.
- Reject endpoints lacking campaignId in definition unless explicitly global/admin.
- Contract tests: generate client from OpenAPI and assert required parameter presence.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run API contract tests and unit tests on middleware extraction; smoke E2E on a few endpoints to ensure context propagation.

subtasks.title: Security hardening: deny and log cross-campaign access attempts
subtasks.description: Add centralized denial and security logging for any cross-campaign access attempt across layers (HTTP, WS, jobs, DB), with deterministic messages and redacted sensitive data.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Central Guard: `assertCampaignScope(expected, actual, contextInfo)` throws `ScopeViolationError` with code and correlation ID.
- Logging: structured logs include campaignId, userId, endpoint, resourceType, action, correlationId; exclude PII.
- Metrics/alerts: counter for scope violations per endpoint; alert on spikes.
- Rate limit repeated violations.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: error type and message content. Integration: simulate cross-campaign requests and verify denial + logs emitted; ensure no data returned (TC017 negative cases).

subtasks.title: Performance and scalability validation under parallel campaigns
subtasks.description: Benchmark isolation mechanisms with multiple concurrent campaigns to ensure acceptable latency/throughput and no contention between namespaces.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Load scenarios: N=10 campaigns, M=50 concurrent users each; mixed DB reads/writes, WS messages, vector queries, file cache ops, scheduler triggers.
- Metrics: p50/p95 latencies per campaign; verify no cross-campaign degradation.
- Indexing and partitioning: validate composite indices; adjust cache directory structure and vector index sharding if needed.
- Tune WS rooms and backpressure per namespace.
subtasks.testStrategy: Automated load tests; assert latency SLOs and zero cross-campaign events. Keep TC017 as gating checks after load.

subtasks.title: Developer tooling and lint rules to prevent unscoped access
subtasks.description: Provide tooling that prevents introducing unscoped repository calls or APIs, including type-level enforcement and linters.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- TypeScript: define interfaces where `campaignId` is a required parameter; mark deprecated any unscoped overloads.
- ESLint custom rule: flag repository calls that lack campaignId argument; forbid `SELECT *` without campaign filter in SQL strings.
- CI step: run lints and fail on violations.
- Code templates: generators pre-wire campaignId in new modules.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run lint tests with fixtures containing intentional violations; ensure CI fails. Re-run unit tests to ensure no regressions.

subtasks.title: Documentation and runbooks for isolation layer
subtasks.description: Produce developer and ops documentation detailing isolation guarantees, required parameters, error codes, and operational procedures for clone/archive.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- Dev docs: context propagation patterns, repository usage, WS namespaces, scheduler tagging, vector namespaces.
- API docs: OpenAPI examples with campaignId.
- Ops runbooks: cloning steps, archiving, restoring from backups per campaign, troubleshooting scope violations.
- Security notes: logging, metrics, alerts, compliance posture.
subtasks.testStrategy: Docs linting, link checks; have an internal DRY-RUN using docs to perform clone/archive and verify TC018 steps.

subtasks.title: Final E2E isolation validation suite and CI gating
subtasks.description: Integrate TC017–TC019 into CI as required gates, running full E2E suite across two or more campaigns on every PR touching isolation-critical code.
subtasks.details:
Implementation guidance:
- CI workflow: spin ephemeral environment; seed campaigns A and B; execute E2E tests for DB/cache/WS/vector/scheduler isolation; run clone and archive scenarios.
- Artifacts: collect logs and metrics; fail build on any leakage or guard bypass.
- Flake control: retries with idempotent steps; timeouts tuned for stability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Ensure CI must pass TC017–TC019. Periodically chaos-test by running load + E2E concurrently.

tasks.title: Scheduling with RRULE, Reminders, and Warmups
tasks.description: Implement campaign schedules with CRUD, recurrence (RRULE), reminders, and pre-session warmups (keys validation, memory prefetch, image pregen).
tasks.details:
- Use rrule library for recurrence
- Schedules table and API /schedules CRUD; optional ICS export
- Reminder service: local notifications/email optional local SMTP off by default
- Warmups: validate provider keys, prefetch relevant memories, pre-generate key images; structured logs
- UI schedule editor integrated into campaign
tasks.testStrategy:
- TC018: CRUD+recurrence correctness; reminders fired; warmups executed and logged with success/failure stats
- Time travel tests using fake timers
- ICS export validated by parser

subtasks.title: Write tests for schedules CRUD, RRULE recurrence, reminders, warmups, and ICS export (TC018)
subtasks.description: Author unit, integration, and UI tests that define acceptance criteria for campaign scheduling: CRUD on /schedules, RRULE evaluation correctness including time zones and exceptions, reminder dispatch timing with fake timers, warmups execution and structured logging, and ICS export validity. Include at least one unit test and one integration/UI test. Tag all with TC018. Do NOT implement production code yet.
subtasks.details:
- Tech: Node/Jest or Vitest with ts-node, Supertest for API, Playwright for UI, Sinon/Jest fake timers, an ICS parser (e.g., ical.js), and rrule test vectors.
- Unit tests:
  - Model/validator tests for schedule payload shape (RRULE strings, DTSTART, EXDATE, timezone, reminders array, warmups flags).
  - RRULE expansion tests (daily/weekly/monthly, BYDAY, COUNT/UNTIL, EXDATE, DTSTART in different TZ) comparing expected occurrences.
  - Reminder scheduler tests: given upcoming occurrence times, ensure reminders fire at offsets (e.g., -15m, -1h) using fake timers; verify de-duplication and idempotency.
  - Warmups pipeline tests: simulate providers and verify steps (keys validation, memory prefetch, image pregen) are called and log structured entries with success/failure counts.
  - ICS export tests: parse generated ICS, assert VEVENT fields (UID, DTSTART/DTEND with TZID, RRULE/EXDATE), and round-trip RRULE.
- Integration tests (API):
  - CRUD flows on /schedules: create->get->update->list->delete; validate persisted fields and soft-delete if applicable.
  - Time-travel: create schedule with next occurrence in near future with reminders; advance timers and assert reminder events enqueued and dispatched.
- UI tests (Playwright):
  - Open campaign schedule editor, create a recurring schedule, set reminders and warmups, save; verify rendering of upcoming occurrences list.
  - Accessibility smoke with axe-core.
- Fixtures: seed campaign/session records; env with SMTP disabled by default and local notification sink.
- Test IDs: map to TC018 and sub-ids (e.g., TC018-CRUD, TC018-RRULE, TC018-REMINDERS, TC018-WARMUPS, TC018-ICS, TC018-UI).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run `pnpm test` for unit/integration with fake timers and `pnpm test:e2e` for Playwright. Tests should fail until implementation exists.

subtasks.title: Design schedules schema, domain model, and migrations
subtasks.description: Define DB schema for schedules with recurrence and reminders, including migrations and typed ORM models. Cover timezone, RRULE, EXDATE, reminders, warmups config, and audit fields.
subtasks.details:
- Table schedules:
  - id (uuid), campaign_id (fk), title, description
  - dtstart (datetime with tz), dtend (nullable), timezone (IANA string)
  - rrule (text), exdates (json array of ISO with tz), rdate (optional json)
  - reminders (json: [{offsetMs:number, channel:'local'|'email'}])
  - warmups (json: {validateKeys:boolean, prefetchMemories:boolean, pregenImages:boolean})
  - enabled (boolean), created_at, updated_at, deleted_at (nullable)
  - metadata (jsonb) for future
- Indexes: by campaign_id, enabled, next_run_at (if maintained), and GIN on reminders if needed.
- Consider a materialized next_occurrence cache table or computed view later; start with on-the-fly expansion.
- ORM models (Drizzle/Kysely) with zod schemas for API validation.
- Migration scripts up/down; seed example schedules for tests.
- Update ERD and data access layer interfaces: ScheduleRepo with CRUD and occurrence query.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-CRUD unit/integration tests; ensure schema validation tests pass.

subtasks.title: Implement RRULE parsing/expansion service with timezone and exceptions
subtasks.description: Create a service that expands occurrences from RRULE/RDATE/EXDATE with DTSTART and IANA timezone support using rrule library. Provide APIs to get next N occurrences and next occurrence after a timestamp.
subtasks.details:
- Use rrule library: construct RRuleSet combining RRULE, RDATEs, and EXDATEs.
- Timezones: store DTSTART as zoned; convert to UTC for storage but preserve timezone for expansion using luxon or date-fns-tz; ensure DTSTART with TZID is honored.
- API:
  - getNextOccurrences(schedule, {after: Date, limit: number}) => Date[]
  - getNextOccurrence(schedule, after) => Date | null
- Handle COUNT and UNTIL; validate invalid RRULE strings with descriptive errors.
- Performance: cap expansions (e.g., 1000) and guard against infinite rules.
- Deterministic tests using fake timers.
- Logging: debug-level inputs/outputs for TC018 diagnostics.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-RRULE unit tests to verify daily/weekly/monthly patterns, BYDAY, COUNT/UNTIL, EXDATE.

subtasks.title: Build /schedules REST API with validation and CRUD
subtasks.description: Expose schedules CRUD endpoints with payload validation, RBAC/ownership checks, and integration with RRULE service for preview of upcoming occurrences.
subtasks.details:
- Endpoints:
  - POST /schedules: create; validate with zod; verify RRULE parses; default warmups false; normalize timezone.
  - GET /schedules/:id: fetch by id; includes computed preview upcomingOccurrences (e.g., next 5) via RRULE service.
  - GET /campaigns/:id/schedules: list for campaign; pagination.
  - PATCH /schedules/:id: partial update; re-validate rule.
  - DELETE /schedules/:id: soft delete.
- Auth: ensure campaign-level access per user/session.
- Serialization: ISO 8601 with timezone; include reminders and warmups configs.
- Errors: standardized problem+json.
- Structured logs for create/update/delete with IDs and campaign context.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-CRUD API tests; verify 2xx/4xx flows, validation errors, and preview correctness.

subtasks.title: Implement ICS export endpoint
subtasks.description: Provide ICS generation for a schedule or campaign schedules, including RRULE/EXDATE, DTSTART/DTEND with TZID, and UID. Optionally authenticated tokenized URL.
subtasks.details:
- Endpoint: GET /schedules/:id.ics and GET /campaigns/:id/schedules.ics.
- Use ical-generator or node-ical builder to emit VCALENDAR with VEVENT per schedule.
- Map fields: SUMMARY=title, DESCRIPTION, DTSTART/DTEND with TZID, RRULE string, EXDATEs, UID=schedule.id@app-domain, SEQUENCE from updated_at.
- Content-Type: text/calendar; CRLF line endings.
- Option: signed token query for unauthenticated calendar clients; rotateable.
- Tests parse ICS with ical.js and verify fields and RRULE round-trip.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-ICS tests; ensure parser reads exported files and matches schedule data.

subtasks.title: Develop reminder scheduler and dispatcher
subtasks.description: Create a background scheduler that computes upcoming occurrences and schedules reminder jobs at specified offsets; implement dispatch to local notifications and optional email via SMTP (off by default).
subtasks.details:
- Components:
  - ReminderPlanner: periodically scans enabled schedules and computes reminder fire times using RRULE service; persists jobs in reminders_jobs table (id, schedule_id, occurrence_at, fire_at, channel, status, attempts, payload, dedupe_key).
  - ReminderWorker: processes due jobs, sends via channel adapters.
- Channel adapters:
  - local: writes to a notifications table/stream for UI consumption.
  - email: nodemailer with local SMTP transport disabled by default; config flag to enable.
- Idempotency: dedupe_key = schedule_id + occurrence_at + offset + channel; enforce unique index.
- Time: all comparisons in UTC; supports fake timers in tests.
- Backoff/retry policy with max attempts and DLQ logging.
- Structured logs for plan, enqueue, dispatch, success/failure counts.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-REMINDERS with fake timers: create schedule with T+10m occurrence and -5m reminder; advance time and assert a single reminder is dispatched with correct payload.

subtasks.title: Implement warmups pipeline (keys validation, memory prefetch, image pre-generation) with structured logging
subtasks.description: Build a pre-session warmups executor that runs before each occurrence: validates provider keys, prefetches relevant memories, and pre-generates key images, emitting structured logs and metrics.
subtasks.details:
- Trigger: when ReminderWorker dispatches a special 'warmup' job at a configurable lead time (e.g., -10m) or on-demand; alternatively, chain after reminder planning for occurrence.
- Steps:
  - Keys validation: use Provider Adapter Framework (Task 5) to check configured adapters are reachable; do not store raw keys; return capability snapshot.
  - Memory prefetch: query VectorIndex/DB (Task 2) for top-N memories by campaign/session context; warm cache layer.
  - Image pregen: call ImageGenAdapter to pre-generate commonly used images; store in images cache and index to campaign assets.
- Concurrency: run steps in parallel with bounded pool; collect per-step success/failure.
- Logging: structured event per step with schedule_id, occurrence_at, step, duration_ms, success, error.
- Config: warmups flags on schedule decide which steps to execute.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC018-WARMUPS: simulate providers and vector index with fakes; trigger warmups and assert each step executed conditionally with logs and success/failure stats.

subtasks.title: Integrate reminder and warmup events with UI notifications stream
subtasks.description: Expose a notifications feed for the UI to consume local reminders and warmup results for campaigns, enabling surface in the schedule editor and lobby.
subtasks.details:
- Server: SSE or WebSocket endpoint /notifications subscribing to campaign_id topics.
- Message schema: {type:'reminder'|'warmup', scheduleId, occurrenceAt, title, severity, details}.
- Persistence: notifications table for replay; cursor-based pagination.
- UI: lightweight badge/ toast hooks to display incoming reminders and warmup statuses; integrate into existing UI shell (Task 4) surfaces.
- Security: authorize by campaign membership.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend TC018-REMINDERS integration/UI to assert a reminder appears in UI via notifications; verify warmup result message received.

subtasks.title: Build Schedule Editor UI integrated into campaign view
subtasks.description: Implement a React-based schedule editor to create, update, and delete schedules with RRULE builder, timezone picker, reminders, warmups toggles, and preview of upcoming occurrences.
subtasks.details:
- Components:
  - ScheduleList: list schedules per campaign with enable/disable, next occurrence, and actions.
  - ScheduleForm: fields for title, description, DTSTART/DTEND pickers, timezone, RRULE builder (frequency, interval, BYDAY, COUNT/UNTIL), EXDATE editor, reminders editor, warmups toggles.
  - Preview panel showing next 5 occurrences using API preview.
- Accessibility: keyboard navigation, labels, contrast tokens; validation errors inline.
- State: use existing store (Zustand/RTK); optimistic updates with rollback on error.
- ICS export buttons linking to .ics endpoints.
- Structured analytics events on save/delete.
subtasks.testStrategy: Playwright UI test (TC018-UI): create a weekly schedule with a -15m reminder and warmups enabled; verify list shows next occurrence, notifications appear on time with fake timers, and form validation works.

subtasks.title: Add admin observability: logs, metrics, and dashboards for schedules/reminders/warmups
subtasks.description: Expose structured logs and counters for schedule planning, reminder dispatch, warmup steps, and failures. Provide a simple dashboard view or API for monitoring.
subtasks.details:
- Metrics: counters (reminders_planned, reminders_sent, warmups_started/succeeded/failed), gauges (pending_jobs), histograms (dispatch_latency_ms, warmup_step_duration_ms).
- Export to existing logging/metrics sinks (pino + Prometheus if available) and expose /metrics endpoint.
- Admin UI panel: table of recent events with filters by campaign/schedule and status.
- Alerts: optional threshold-based warnings surfaced in admin panel.
- Correlation IDs: propagate schedule_id and occurrence_at across logs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests assert metrics increment; integration test queries /metrics to contain expected counters after simulated runs.

subtasks.title: Hardening: idempotency, race conditions, and backfill handling
subtasks.description: Ensure scheduler handles restarts, avoids duplicate reminders, and can backfill missed reminders after downtime with safe deduplication.
subtasks.details:
- Enforce unique index on reminders_jobs.dedupe_key; worker uses SELECT ... FOR UPDATE / transactional update to mark in-progress.
- On startup, scan for jobs with fire_at <= now and status=pending; process with rate limits.
- Graceful shutdown: drain worker.
- Race tests: simulate concurrent workers; ensure only one dispatch occurs.
- Backfill policy: time window cap (e.g., last 24h) to avoid storm.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests create overlapping jobs and run two workers; assert single dispatch. Advance time over downtime window and verify capped backfill.

subtasks.title: Documentation and examples
subtasks.description: Write developer and user docs: API contracts, payload examples, RRULE guidance, ICS subscriptions, reminder channels config, warmups behavior, and troubleshooting.
subtasks.details:
