subtasks.testStrategy: Docs linting; sample commands executed in CI to ensure examples remain valid.

tasks.title: CRDT Realtime for Shared Notes/Map/Inventory
tasks.description: Add CRDT-based collaboration for shared notes/map/inventory with convergence over WebSockets.
tasks.details:
- Choose Yjs or Automerge; define documents per campaign/session
- Sync protocol over existing WS; persistence snapshots in DB
- Permissions: role-based access to docs
- Conflict resolution tested via CRDT invariants
tasks.testStrategy:
- Convergence tests under random edits
- Disconnect/reconnect merges without data loss
- Performance with 10+ concurrent editors locally

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and unit/integration tests for CRDT realtime (TC001–TC006)
subtasks.description: Before implementation, codify the core acceptance criteria and create failing tests covering convergence, conflict resolution, permission enforcement, persistence, and WS sync for notes/map/inventory documents.
subtasks.details:
Create a test plan mapping to verification IDs:
- TC001 Convergence: Random concurrent edits across 3 replicas converge to identical state for notes, map annotations, and inventory.
- TC002 Reconnection: Disconnect/reconnect with buffered ops results in convergence without data loss.
- TC003 Permissions: Role-based access enforced (viewer: read-only, editor: mutate allowed docs, GM: full access). Unauthorized ops are rejected and do not apply.
- TC004 Persistence: Snapshot and incremental updates persisted and restored produce identical document state hashes.
- TC005 Performance: Local 10+ simulated editors maintain <150ms average latency for visible updates and complete convergence within 2s after burst.
- TC006 Protocol Validations: WS crdt-sync schema validation and backpressure handling; duplicate/out-of-order messages handled idempotently.
Implement tests:
- Unit tests (Jest/Vitest) for CRDT object composition (notes text, map layers/markers, inventory items), merge semantics, and invariants.
- Property-based tests for convergence under random operation interleavings (fast-check).
- Integration tests using ws/superwstest to spin up WS gateway (Task 3 dependency mocked if needed) with 3–5 clients performing edits and network partitions.
- Persistence roundtrip tests using SQLite (Task 2) with snapshot+incremental log.
- Permission tests via mocked auth contexts and role matrices.
Define helper utilities: Replica harness, op generators for each document type, deterministic seed for reproducibility, state hash function (stable JSON + hash).
subtasks.testStrategy: Start with red tests. Use seed-based fuzzing (N=200 sequences). Add metrics assertions for latency using fake timers where applicable.

subtasks.title: Select CRDT library and document model (Yjs vs Automerge) and scaffold types
subtasks.description: Evaluate Yjs vs Automerge for text, map structures, and inventory; decide and scaffold TypeScript types and document schemas per campaign/session.
subtasks.details:
Decision criteria: performance with 10+ editors, text CRDT maturity, binary encoding, GC/tombstone handling, conflict semantics, ecosystem.
Recommendation: Choose Yjs for production-grade text and map/list structures with awareness of optimized sets and composition techniques; model complex docs via CRDT object composition and CRDT-valued maps.[2][3] Adopt techniques to avoid tombstones where possible.[1]
Define document types:
- NotesDoc: Y.Text for rich/plain text per note; metadata registers (title LWW-style), map of notes within session.
- MapDoc: map layers (Y.Map), list of markers (Y.Array of objects with id, pos, label), per-marker metadata as nested maps; treat as list/set of CRDTs.[3]
- InventoryDoc: Y.Map of itemId -> object (qty counter, props LWW registers), collection modeled as CRDT map.[4][5]
Namespaces: campaign:<id>/session:<id>/<doc-kind>/<doc-id>.
Create TypeScript interfaces for DocManager, DocHandles, and serialization boundaries.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC001 unit tests focused on type-level constraints and basic merge semantics using Yjs in-memory providers until tests pass.

subtasks.title: Design CRDT message schema and zod validators for crdt-sync
subtasks.description: Specify and implement the wire protocol messages for CRDT sync over existing WebSockets, including schemas and versioning.
subtasks.details:
Define message types (all include protocolVersion, campaignId, sessionId, docKind, docId):
- crdt-sync-init: client->server subscribe with auth token and role.
- crdt-sync-update: server<->client binary update payload (Yjs update Uint8Array base64-encoded), seq, timestamp, replicaId.
- crdt-sync-snapshot-req/resp: request snapshot and receive compressed snapshot blob + clock/vector info.
- crdt-sync-ack: acknowledge receipt with seq; supports backpressure.
- crdt-sync-error: validation or permission errors.
Implement zod schemas shared between client/server; integrate with existing message routing from Task 3. Include idempotency keys and causal metadata fields informed by CRDT composition guidance.[2][3]
Add schema versioning and feature flags per doc kind.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute TC006 protocol validation tests: invalid messages rejected, duplicates ignored, out-of-order updates applied via Yjs merge to same state.

subtasks.title: Implement CRDT DocManager and in-memory replica harness
subtasks.description: Create a DocManager that opens/creates Yjs documents per namespace, applies updates, emits deltas, and integrates with the replica test harness.
subtasks.details:
Components:
- DocRegistry keyed by namespace -> Y.Doc, with per-doc awareness of substructures (notes/map/inventory) using composition patterns.[2]
- ApplyUpdate(doc, update, origin) and EncodeUpdate events for outgoing changes.
- State hashing function for test equality (deterministic stable stringify + hash).
- ReplicaHarness: create N replicas, simulate random ops for notes/map/inventory, collect updates, and apply across replicas to verify convergence (inspired by composition and collection patterns).[2][3]
- GC/awareness: disable heavy GC during tests; expose ability to encode state vector and diff updates.
Ensure no tombstone leaks by relying on Yjs internal optimizations and documented techniques to avoid unbounded metadata.[1]
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC001 property tests using harness; ensure all replicas converge after randomized operation sequences across structures.

subtasks.title: Integrate with WebSocket Gateway channels and presence
subtasks.description: Wire DocManager updates to WS gateway (Task 3) using crdt-sync topics; manage joins/leaves, subscriptions, and presence for editors.
subtasks.details:
Server:
- On crdt-sync-init: validate auth, role, campaign/session membership; subscribe connection to doc topic; send snapshot+state vector; backfill missed updates.
- On crdt-sync-update: validate schema, permissions, apply to DocManager, broadcast diff to subscribers except origin.
- Presence: maintain editor list per doc; heartbeat using existing ping; publish presence changes.
Client SDK:
- Connect, subscribe, apply incoming updates to local Y.Doc, encode local changes and send updates with backpressure-aware batching.
- Reconnect tokens to resume missed seq range (Task 3 capability).
Use schemas from 20.3 and channels defined in Task 3.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run integration tests: multiple clients join/leave, perform concurrent edits; verify TC002 reconnect merges and TC006 backpressure/acks via simulated packet loss.

subtasks.title: Persistence: snapshotting and incremental update log in SQLite
subtasks.description: Persist Y.Doc snapshots and incremental updates to local SQLite with compaction and restore paths.
subtasks.details:
Schema:
- crdt_documents(docKey, kind, campaignId, sessionId, version, snapshotBlob, stateVector, updatedAt)
- crdt_updates(id, docKey, seq, updateBlob, createdAt)
Implement:
- On interval or size threshold, snapshot current doc (encodeStateAsUpdate from empty) and store state vector; truncate updates older than latest snapshot seq.
- On startup or client subscribe, load latest snapshot + subsequent updates to hydrate DocManager.
- Ensure atomic writes using transactions; compress blobs (gzip/brotli).
- Provide compaction job.
Map composition of nested CRDTs into single Y.Doc snapshot consistent with object composition guidance.[2]
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute TC004 persistence tests: write/read roundtrip yields identical state hash; restart server and verify hydration; simulate crash between update and snapshot and ensure recovery.

subtasks.title: Role-based permissions and access control for CRDT operations
subtasks.description: Enforce role-based permissions at message ingress and document mutation boundaries; implement doc-level ACLs.
subtasks.details:
Define roles: viewer, editor, GM/admin. Policy matrix:
- viewer: subscribe read-only; cannot send crdt-sync-update.
- editor: can update allowed docs within campaign/session.
- GM: can create/delete docs, manage map layers, force overwrite metadata.
Implement middleware: validate on crdt-sync-init and crdt-sync-update using campaign/session membership and doc ACLs. For inventory, enforce item-specific constraints (qty >= 0) via pre-apply checks; reject invalid ops.
Emit crdt-sync-error with codes (PERMISSION_DENIED, INVALID_OP).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC003 tests: attempt unauthorized updates, ensure no state change and error returned; validate role transitions at runtime.

subtasks.title: Map document structures and operations
subtasks.description: Implement high-level operations for collaborative map: layers, markers, shapes with IDs; ensure list/set semantics and stable IDs.
subtasks.details:
Within MapDoc (Y.Doc):
- layers: Y.Map<string, Layer>, where Layer has Y.Map props and Y.Array markerIds.
- markers: Y.Map<string, Marker>, Marker: { id, position {x,y}, label (Y.Text), props } using object composition of CRDTs.[2][3]
- shapes: optional Y.Array of shape objects with control points.
Provide API: addLayer, renameLayer (LWW), addMarker (generate id), moveMarker, editLabel, deleteMarker (tombstone-free by removing entry), reorder layers using Y.Array.
Ensure independent operations act on independent state to preserve intention.[3]
Wire UI events to these APIs in client SDK.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: concurrent moves and label edits converge; deleting a marker concurrently with label edit results in delete-wins behavior as specified. Integration test: 3 clients rapidly move the same marker and edit labels; verify TC001/TC002 convergence.

subtasks.title: Notes document structures and operations
subtasks.description: Implement collaborative notes with Y.Text, titles, and note collections per session.
subtasks.details:
Within NotesDoc:
- notes: Y.Map<noteId, { title: Y.Text or LWW string, body: Y.Text, tags: Y.Array<string> }>. Prefer Y.Text for title if collaborative inline editing; otherwise LWW register semantics for last-writer-wins using logical time.[4]
APIs: createNote, editTitle, editBody (apply Y.Text deltas), addTag/removeTag, deleteNote.
Use CRDT object composition to keep title/body independent.[2]
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: concurrent title/body edits; delete concurrent with edit; collection add/remove races yield intended behavior. Integration: 3 clients edit same note; verify convergence and low latency (TC001/TC005).

subtasks.title: Inventory document structures and operations
subtasks.description: Implement collaborative inventory with quantities, item properties, and move operations between containers.
subtasks.details:
Within InventoryDoc:
- items: Y.Map<itemId, { name (LWW), qty (integer counter via composed register with invariants), props (Y.Map), containerId (LWW) }>. Use object composition; avoid physical timestamps pitfalls by using logical clocks/Lamport semantics via CRDT library rather than wall clocks.[5]
APIs: addItem, updateQty(delta), moveItem(containerId), updateProps, deleteItem. Ensure qty never negative; reject at ingress (permission layer) and clamp in client UI.
Optionally model qty using add-wins counter if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: concurrent qty updates merge associatively; move and rename conflicts resolved per LWW policy; deletion wins vs prop edits. Integration: 3 clients adjust quantities and move items; verify TC001/TC003.

subtasks.title: Client SDK: CRDT binding and offline queue
subtasks.description: Create client-side bindings to UI models, manage local Y.Doc, offline queueing, and reconnection with state vector diffs.
subtasks.details:
Implement a ClientDocBinding with:
- Local Y.Doc per namespace, awareness API for cursors/presence (optional), and event listeners mapping to app state.
- Outbox queue for updates when offline; on reconnect, compute diff using state vector and send minimal updates.
- Batch and debounce local changes; apply server acks for backpressure.
- Expose hooks (useNotesDoc, useMapDoc, useInventoryDoc) for UI.
- Handle snapshot hydration and late-join using snapshot + incremental updates.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI/integration tests: simulate offline edits, then reconnect; verify TC002 convergence and no data loss. Measure latency to satisfy TC005 locally.

subtasks.title: Conflict resolution invariant tests and fuzzing harness
subtasks.description: Extend property-based tests to cover edge-case invariants and long sequences with deletes, renames, and counter updates.
subtasks.details:
Add fuzz suites per doc kind:
- Notes: interleaved title/body edits, deletes, recreates.
- Map: concurrent move+delete+rename, layer reorder conflicts.
- Inventory: qty increments/decrements with deletes/moves.
Use fast-check to generate sequences; verify invariants: convergence, no negative qty, referential integrity (markerId in layer list implies marker exists), and independence of unrelated operations per composition principles.[2][3]
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 1k random sequences per suite with deterministic seeds; capture minimal counterexamples on failure. Maps to TC001 and conflict-invariant coverage.

subtasks.title: Performance tuning and load tests with 10+ editors
subtasks.description: Profile server/client under simulated load, tune message batching, compression, and apply rate limits.
subtasks.details:
Create a load test script spinning 12 clients per doc, performing paced edits. Measure:
- Update apply latency, CPU, memory, bandwidth.
Tune:
- Batch updates per 50–100ms, coalesce Yjs updates, enable compression on WS frames, snapshot compaction cadence, and rate limit per connection.
Ensure backpressure and retries interact correctly with crdt-sync-ack.
subtasks.testStrategy: Satisfy TC005 thresholds. Record traces and ensure no dropped updates; convergence after bursts within 2s.

subtasks.title: Admin/GM tools for document ACLs and lifecycle
subtasks.description: Implement APIs/UI hooks to create/delete docs, manage ACLs, and inspect state for debugging.
subtasks.details: Server endpoints or WS messages: createDoc, deleteDoc, setAcl(role matrix), listDocs. Persist ACLs tied to campaign/session. Provide doc inspection (state vector, snapshot size) for debugging.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests: GM can create/delete and set ACLs; viewers cannot. Verify persistence restores ACLs correctly (TC003/TC004).

subtasks.title: Observability and metrics for CRDT subsystem
subtasks.description: Add logging and metrics for sync events, errors, snapshot sizes, and convergence timing.
subtasks.details: Emit metrics: updates/sec, bytes sent, snapshot size, compaction frequency, apply latency, reject counts by reason. Structured logs for crdt-sync-error. Dashboards or console summaries for dev.
subtasks.testStrategy: Assert metrics counters change as expected during integration/load tests; budgets not exceeded under TC005.

subtasks.title: Security hardening: validation, quotas, and sandboxing
subtasks.description: Ensure binary payload limits, schema version gating, and defensive handling against malformed or abusive clients.
subtasks.details: Implement per-connection quotas (messages/sec, bytes/min), max doc size, max update size, and snapshot rate limiting. Schema version checks; reject unknown docKind/docId formats. Sanitize labels/text limits. Kill-switch feature flag to disable CRDT per campaign.
subtasks.testStrategy: Negative integration tests: send oversized payloads, invalid schema versions, rapid-fire updates; verify rejections and no server instability (extends TC006).

subtasks.title: Documentation and developer guide
subtasks.description: Produce developer docs detailing document schemas, sync protocol, ACLs, persistence, and testing procedures.
subtasks.details: Write docs: rationale for Yjs selection with references to composition and collection patterns, message schemas, example flows, persistence compaction, ACL configuration, and troubleshooting. Include runbooks for tests and load harness.
subtasks.testStrategy: Docs linting and example snippets compiled; follow a walkthrough to run TC001–TC006 tests successfully.

tasks.title: GM Orchestration Loop and Narration Beats
tasks.description: Implement GM loop delivering 2–4 sentence beats with high agency, integrating rules, missions, memory, and adapters.
tasks.details:
- Prompt templates with tools: rules.check, mission.advance, memory.query, image.request, tts.speak
- Streaming LLM responses; latency target <3s median via prompt compaction and warmups
- Tool schema validation with zod; retries on invalid
- Periodic insert of situation updates
tasks.testStrategy:
- Latency benchmarks; synthetic sessions verify median <3s locally
- Tool invocation unit tests with strict schema validation
- E2E: players make actions; loop produces beats and advances mission

subtasks.title: Write acceptance tests for GM loop, beats, tools, and latency (TC011–TC015)
subtasks.description: Create a comprehensive test suite that encodes the core acceptance criteria for the GM orchestration loop: produces 2–4 sentence narration beats with high agency; integrates rules.check, mission.advance, memory.query, image.request, tts.speak; streams responses; validates tool schemas with zod and retries on invalid; periodically inserts situation updates; and meets a local median latency target <3s under synthetic sessions.
subtasks.details:
Implement unit tests and integration tests before any implementation. Include:
- Unit tests:
  - TC011: Beat length and agency detection. Assert output is 2–4 sentences, imperative/decisive tone tokens present, and no meandering qualifiers.
  - TC012: Tool invocation schema validation. Mock adapters; validate zod schemas; assert retries on invalid payload; assert backoff policy and max retry cap.
  - TC013: Prompt compaction logic. Given long memory/missions/rules, assert compactor trims to token budget while preserving priority content.
  - TC014: Situation updater cadence. Assert periodic inserts occur every N beats or T ms, configurable.
- Integration/E2E tests:
  - TC015: Synthetic player actions drive loop; verify mission advances, rules checked, memory queried, optional image.request queued, tts.speak called with produced beat; stream tokens to client; measure local median time-to-first-token and time-to-final <3s across 30 runs.
- Performance tests:
  - Harness to simulate LLM with controllable latency distribution and token rate to measure orchestration overhead. Report median and p95.
- Testing infrastructure:
  - Jest/Vitest for unit, Playwright for E2E stream verification, a fake WebSocket/feed recorder for streaming assertions, and a mock clock for periodic inserts.
- Include fixtures: sample rules, missions, memory snapshots, adapter schemas, and long-context samples for compaction tests.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run CI job stage `21-tests-acceptance` gating implementation. Fail build if TC011–TC015 do not pass. Collect latency metrics artifacts and assert thresholds.

subtasks.title: Define tool adapter interfaces and zod schemas with strict validation
subtasks.description: Create typed interfaces and zod schemas for rules.check, mission.advance, memory.query, image.request, tts.speak, plus a common ToolInvocation envelope and result shape with error codes for retries.
subtasks.details:
Implement a tools module:
- Common types: ToolName, ToolInvocation {id, name, input, correlationId}, ToolResult {ok, output|error}
- zod schemas per tool with explicit min/max constraints and enums.
- Validation helpers: validateOrThrow(name, payload) returning typed input.
- Map tool -> adapter function signature and schema.
- Add unit tests extending TC012 to check invalid payloads produce schema errors; ensure error messages include jsonPath.
- Provide a mock-adapters package for tests with controllable success/failure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run all tests; ensure TC012 passes and coverage includes both success and invalid cases.

subtasks.title: Implement retry policy with bounded backoff for invalid/failed tool calls
subtasks.description: Add a generic retry wrapper with exponential backoff and jitter specifically for schema-invalid and adapter failure cases, with limits to avoid latency inflation.
subtasks.details:
Create retryToolCall(toolFn, options) with:
- Policies: maxRetries (default 2), baseDelay 60–120ms jitter, stop on non-retriable errors (e.g., rules violation definitive).
- On schema invalid: attempt one prompt-side repair (LLM self-correction hint) then retry.
- Instrumentation: counters for attempts, lastError, totalDelay; expose to metrics.
- Plug into adapters execution layer used by GM loop.
- Extend TC012: assert retries occur and stop at cap; measure added overhead <300ms median.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for retry logic, backoff sequence, jitter bounds, and non-retriable passthrough.

subtasks.title: Design prompt templates and compaction strategy with tool affordances
subtasks.description: Create modular prompt templates guiding high-agency 2–4 sentence beats and enabling tool use affordances; implement prompt compaction and warmup strategies to hit <3s median.
subtasks.details:
Deliver:
- System and developer templates encoding: role (GM), constraints (2–4 sentences, decisive verbs), safety/rules integration, mission context, memory cues, adapters instruction with function calling/tool use, and situation update slots.
- Compaction pipeline: priority tiers (rules>current mission>recent memory>player last actions>older memory); token budget function; summarizer for older memory; truncation with ellipsis markers.
- Warmup: pre-load model with priming conversation or cached compiled prompt skeletons; pre-request embeddings/summaries.
- Unit tests (extends TC011, TC013): ensure compactor reduces tokens while keeping priority content; beats remain 2–4 sentences under heavy context.
subtasks.testStrategy: Snapshot tests for prompts under different contexts; token counts asserted against model max and target latency budgets.

subtasks.title: Implement GM orchestration state machine
subtasks.description: Create the core loop as a finite-state machine handling input ingestion, context assembly, LLM call, tool execution, beat streaming, and cooldown/periodic updates.
subtasks.details:
States: Idle -> AssembleContext -> InvokeLLM -> ExecuteTools (may interleave) -> StreamBeat -> PostBeat (update memory/mission logs, schedule situation updates) -> Idle.
- Context assembly pulls rules, mission status, recent memory, player actions; passes through compactor.
- Supports tool function-calling mode: parse tool calls, validate via zod, execute via retry wrapper, feed results back to LLM until final beat.
- Periodic situation update injection: every K beats or T seconds, insert a lightweight scene delta before or within the beat per config.
- Configurable knobs: sentence range 2–4, cadence, tool timeouts, max tool chain length.
- Events and metrics emitted at each transition.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration tests driving the FSM with synthetic actions; assert order of states, correct emissions, and that TC014 and TC015 pass.

subtasks.title: Streaming response pipeline with time-to-first-token optimization
subtasks.description: Implement streaming from the LLM to clients and to TTS adapter, minimizing orchestration overhead and ensuring backpressure handling.
subtasks.details:
Add:
- Stream multiplexer: LLM SSE/WebSocket tokens -> client stream and TTS pre-buffer.
- Backpressure: bounded queues; drop/collapse slow consumer strategy with notices.
- Early flush: send header/meta immediately, start tokens as they arrive; compute TTFB.
- Cancellation: user interrupts cancel current generation and tool chain safely.
- Metrics: TTFB, tokens/sec, end-to-end time.
- Ensure beat boundary detection for 2–4 sentences; finalize on sentence end or token cap.
subtasks.testStrategy: E2E streaming tests using Playwright: assert tokens arrive incrementally, captions/TTF sync hook invoked; verify median TTFB contributes to <3s total (TC015).

subtasks.title: Integrate tool adapters into loop with strict schema validation
subtasks.description: Wire rules.check, mission.advance, memory.query, image.request, and tts.speak into the ExecuteTools stage with validation and retries.
subtasks.details:
Implement execution router:
- On tool call message, validate input via zod; on success, call adapter through retryToolCall; on result, append to tool context and continue LLM function-calling until final content.
- Enforce max tool depth/chain length to avoid loops; timeouts per tool.
- For tts.speak, start after first sentence boundary to minimize perceived latency; ensure payload matches TTS task expectations (voice id, text chunking).
- For image.request, queue async and return placeholder reference for later rendering.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit/integration tests using mocks: ensure invalid schemas are retried; verify tool outputs are surfaced to the LLM and reflected in the final beat; ensure TC012 and TC015 continue to pass.

subtasks.title: High-agency beat generator with sentence control
subtasks.description: Enforce 2–4 sentence outputs with decisive tone and content validation; implement post-processor to trim/merge sentences and reject low-agency phrasing.
subtasks.details:
Add a BeatPostprocessor:
- Sentence segmentation; enforce limits; if >4, truncate at boundary; if <2, request LLM continuation or synthesize concise closer.
- Agency heuristics: forbid weak hedges list; require imperative verbs or strong assertions; soft-penalize passive voice; fallback correction prompt if needed.
- Ensure compatibility with streaming: hold a rolling window to validate and decide early tts.speak triggers.
- Configuration per campaign for tone/dialect.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend TC011 with adversarial prompts; assert beats remain 2–4 sentences and pass agency checks. Add unit tests for sentence segmentation edge cases.

subtasks.title: Situation update scheduler and insertion logic
subtasks.description: Implement periodic situation updates injected into the narration flow without breaking pacing.
subtasks.details: Develop a scheduler tracking beats count and time; when threshold met, prepend or append a concise scene delta (1 sentence) via a lightweight LLM call or templated update using world state deltas. Provide debouncing so updates do not cluster after pauses.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate TC014 with fake clock; ensure updates fire on cadence and are integrated as separate sentences without exceeding 4-sentence cap.

subtasks.title: Latency budgeter, warmups, and prompt token budgeting
subtasks.description: Introduce a latency budget manager orchestrating warmup calls, cache hits for prompts, and token budgets to meet <3s median locally.
subtasks.details:
Components:
- Warmup manager: issue tiny priming calls at session start/idle intervals; keep adapter connections warm.
- Prompt cache: hash of compacted prompt skeleton + context keys; reuse where safe.
- Token budget calculator: model throughput tokens/sec; aim for output <= 80 tokens for 2–4 sentences; adjust stop sequences.
- Abort long generations at cap and request concise restatement if needed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Performance tests: simulate 30 sessions; assert median end-to-end <3s, track improvements when warmups enabled. Ensures TC015 passes consistently.

subtasks.title: Metrics, tracing, and observability for the GM loop
subtasks.description: Add structured logging, traces, and counters to measure tool attempts, retries, latency breakdowns, and success rates.
subtasks.details: Emit spans for states and tool calls; counters for retries, invalid schemas, tool chain depth; histograms for TTFB, total time; gauges for queue sizes. Provide a debug dashboard or CLI report summarizing last N sessions.
subtasks.testStrategy: Add assertions in tests to check metrics are emitted; run perf suite and export a trace to verify spans and timing breakdowns.

subtasks.title: E2E integration with TTS and image adapters
subtasks.description: Ensure beats are chunked to TTS with voice context and captions, and image requests are queued and resolved into UI placeholders.
subtasks.details: For TTS: split beat into sentence chunks; send first sentence as soon as stable; include speaker/NPC voice id and captions timestamps hooks. For image: enqueue generation, return handle; when ready, emit event to append visual to scene.
subtasks.testStrategy: E2E test: player action -> beat spoken with correct voice and captions; image placeholder appears and resolves. Complements Task 7 tests.

subtasks.title: Error handling, recovery, and user-facing fallbacks
subtasks.description: Implement graceful degradation: if tools or LLM fail, produce a concise beat explaining a brief delay and continue; persist minimal state to resume.
subtasks.details: Add categorized errors and fallbacks: switch to minimal-context template on repeated failures; skip optional tools (image) under pressure; revert to cached summaries if memory.query fails; ensure loop does not deadlock.
subtasks.testStrategy: Fault injection in integration tests: drop adapter responses, force schema errors; assert a beat still emits within 3s with a fallback message; metrics record the incident.

subtasks.title: Configuration, feature flags, and admin controls
subtasks.description: Expose knobs for sentence limits, cadence, max tool depth, timeouts, warmup intervals, and situation update policies with runtime flags.
subtasks.details: Provide config schema and hot-reload; validate with zod; bind to environment and per-campaign overrides; log effective config per session.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit tests ensure invalid configs are rejected; E2E toggles verify behavior changes (e.g., sentence cap from 4 to 3).

subtasks.title: Documentation and developer guide with examples
subtasks.description: Author developer docs showing state machine diagrams, prompt examples, tool schemas, and troubleshooting playbooks.
subtasks.details: Include: sequence diagrams for a typical turn; code samples for adding a new tool; latency optimization checklist; FAQ for schema errors and retries; guidance for writing high-agency styles.
subtasks.testStrategy: Doc lints build; examples compiled in CI; runnable snippets as part of tests where feasible.

tasks.title: Accessibility and Captioning Compliance
tasks.description: Ensure captions everywhere, adjustable speech rate/volume, color contrast, and keyboard navigation fallback.
tasks.details:
- Global caption track toggle; per-channel captions; ARIA roles and landmarks
- Contrast tokens meet WCAG AA; focus management
- Keyboard-only flows for critical actions
- Settings persist per player locally
tasks.testStrategy:
- Automated axe tests; manual keyboard nav checklist
- Contrast checker CI step
- Verify captions available for all audio sources

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and write failing tests for accessibility and captioning (TC001–TC006)
subtasks.description: Capture concrete acceptance criteria and implement initial failing tests covering captions availability, caption toggles, per-channel captions, adjustable speech rate/volume controls, color contrast tokens (WCAG AA), keyboard-only navigation for critical flows, ARIA roles/landmarks, focus management, and per-player local persistence.
subtasks.details:
• Define acceptance criteria mapped to verification IDs:
  - TC001: Captions available for all audio sources and channels; default off unless globally toggled.
  - TC002: Global caption track toggle affects all players; per-channel caption toggles override global.
  - TC003: Adjustable speech rate and volume per channel with defined ranges (rate 0.5–2.0x in 0.1 steps; volume 0–1.0 in 0.05 steps) and persistence per player in local storage/indexedDB.
  - TC004: Color contrast tokens meet WCAG 2.1 AA (text ≥ 4.5:1; large text ≥ 3:1; UI components ≥ 3:1) and are enforced via design tokens.
  - TC005: Keyboard-only flows for critical actions (play/pause, toggle captions, adjust rate/volume, open/close settings, save) with visible focus and logical tab order.
  - TC006: ARIA roles/landmarks present; focus management returns to invoking control; live regions for captions.
• Unit tests: token contrast calculations, persistence adapter R/W, reducer/state for toggles and controls, ARIA attributes presence, focus trap utilities.
• Integration/UI tests (e.g., Playwright/Cypress + Axe): keyboard-only paths for critical flows, axe automated checks, captions displayed and synced during playback, global vs per-channel precedence, contrast checker step on theme tokens.
• Provide test fixtures: mock audio sources, mock TTS timestamps, seeded theme tokens.
• Ensure tests fail initially to drive implementation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Implement Jest/Vitest unit tests and Playwright/Cypress E2E with axe-core. Add CI job: contrast check over tokens and axe run on key pages. Record TC001–TC006 mappings in test names.

subtasks.title: Implement caption data model and rendering with ARIA live region
subtasks.description: Introduce data structures and UI components to render captions for all audio sources and channels with a live region for assistive tech.
subtasks.details:
• Add CaptionTrack model: {id, channelId, cues: [{start,end,text}], source: 'tts'|'file'|'manual'}.
• Implement CaptionService: APIs to register tracks per channel, subscribe to playback time, and emit active cues.
• UI: <CaptionsOverlay channelId> reads active cues and renders text with high-contrast styling, role='region' aria-live='polite' aria-atomic='true'.
• Ensure overlay is toggleable and does not trap focus; it should be screen-reader friendly but not interfere with keyboard nav.

tasks.title: Performance and Reliability Hardening
tasks.description: Implement retries/backoff for provider calls, WebSocket stability, and caching to meet performance targets.
tasks.details:
- Exponential backoff with jitter for adapters
- Connection monitor and auto-reconnect; offline queueing
- Image cache hit optimization; token usage tracking and prompt compaction
- Profiling and flamegraphs; GC tuning hints
tasks.testStrategy:
- Load tests simulate burst traffic; verify targets: STT<800ms, GM<3s, TTS<1.2s medians locally
- Fault injection tests for adapter failures
- Cache hit rate monitoring >60% for repeated requests

subtasks.title: Define acceptance criteria and write unit/integration tests for performance and reliability hardening
subtasks.description: Before implementation, codify acceptance criteria and create tests covering retries/backoff with jitter for provider adapters, WebSocket stability (monitoring, auto-reconnect, offline queue), caching effectiveness, and profiling hooks. Include at least one unit test and one integration test. Tag tests with verification IDs: TC016 (retry/backoff), TC017 (WebSocket stability), TC018 (caching hit rate), TC019 (latency targets).
subtasks.details:
• Draft acceptance criteria: 
- Retries: adapter calls use exponential backoff with full jitter; cap max delay; idempotent-safe retries; circuit breaker opens after threshold.
- WebSocket: connection monitored; auto-reconnect with backoff; offline queue buffers outbound events until connected; no message duplication or reordering beyond at-least-once semantics.
- Caching: image cache achieves >=60% hit rate on repeated requests; cache keying and eviction strategy defined; token usage tracked; prompt compaction reduces tokens by >=20% on repeated dialog context.
- Performance targets locally: STT median <800ms, Generation/GM median <3s, TTS median <1.2s under burst traffic.
• Tests to add:
- Unit: backoff schedule correctness with jitter bounds; retry stops on non-retryable errors; circuit breaker transitions; cache key/hash determinism; LRU eviction; token accounting; prompt compaction length reduction.
- Integration: fault injection for adapter failures verifying retries and final behavior; simulated WebSocket server that drops/halts to verify reconnect and offline queue flush; load test harness generating burst traffic and measuring latencies; repeated image requests to measure cache hit rate.
- Include metrics assertions and export hooks used by tests.
• Testing scaffolding: add test helpers for fake time (advance timers), flaky provider stubs (error rates), WS test server, and metrics registry. 
• Mark tests with TC016–TC019 and wire into CI job `perf-reliability-suite`.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run new test suites to see them fail initially: unit (retry/backoff, caching) and integration (WS stability, load/caching). Establish baseline reports for TC016–TC019.

subtasks.title: Implement exponential backoff with full jitter utility and integrate into provider adapters
subtasks.description: Create a reusable backoff module implementing exponential backoff with full jitter, max attempts, max delay, and per-error retry policies. Integrate into all provider adapters (LLM, STT, TTS, Image). Ensure idempotency and timeouts.
subtasks.details:
• Backoff utility: function signature like `retry(fn, {base=100ms, factor=2, jitter='full', maxDelay=5s, maxAttempts=6, timeoutPerAttempt, isRetryable(err), onAttempt, signal})`.
• Full jitter: nextDelay = random(0, min(maxDelay, base * factor^n)).
• Respect cancellation and deadlines via AbortSignal.
• Define retryable categories: 429/5xx, network errors, timeouts. Non-retryable: 4xx (except 408/409/429), validation errors.
• Add per-adapter policies (e.g., image generation longer timeouts). 
• Instrument attempts, delays, outcomes via metrics (counters and histograms) and logs with structured fields.
• Update adapters to wrap outbound calls with `retry`. Ensure idempotent request keys for safe retries when provider supports it; otherwise guard side-effecting endpoints (no retry on partial success signals).
• Add configuration: env/flags for backoff parameters and max attempts; sane defaults.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run unit tests for backoff schedule, jitter bounds, and retry policies (TC016). Run integration fault injection tests to ensure retries occur and stop appropriately.

subtasks.title: Add circuit breaker around provider adapters
subtasks.description: Introduce a circuit breaker to prevent cascading failures on persistent errors, with states Closed/Half-Open/Open and rolling error rate calculation.
subtasks.details:
• Implement breaker with configurable failure threshold (e.g., >50% over last N requests or consecutive failures), open duration, half-open probe count.
• Expose metrics for state transitions and short-circuits. 
• Wrap provider adapter calls: on Open, immediately fail fast with specific error; half-open allows limited trial calls.
• Ensure interoperability with retry: retries operate within Closed/Half-Open; Open should not schedule retries.
• Add config toggles and per-adapter overrides.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: simulate failure bursts to trigger Open; verify Half-Open probes; ensure reset on success (TC016). Integration: inject provider outage; verify fail-fast after threshold and recovery when provider returns.

subtasks.title: WebSocket connection monitor with auto-reconnect and exponential backoff
subtasks.description: Implement a connection monitor for client/server WebSockets that detects disconnects, schedules reconnects with backoff+jitter, and surfaces connection state.
subtasks.details:
• Monitor responsibilities: heartbeat/ping-pong, idle timeout, detect close/error codes, and reconnect strategy using the backoff utility with jitter and caps.
• Preserve authentication/session context on reconnect; refresh tokens if needed.
• Provide observable state machine: CONNECTING, OPEN, CLOSING, CLOSED, RECONNECTING. Emit events for UI/logic.
• Metrics: connection uptime %, reconnect attempts, time-to-reconnect.
• Configurable policies: max attempts, initial delay, ping interval, idle timeout.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: WS test server that closes connections randomly; assert reconnect within bounded window and state transitions (TC017). Unit: heartbeat timeout detection logic.

subtasks.title: Offline outbound queue with exactly-once de-duplication on reconnect
subtasks.description: Add an offline queue buffering outbound messages/events when WS is disconnected, flushing on reconnect with idempotency keys to prevent duplicates.
subtasks.details:
• Queue design: durable (in-memory with optional persistence), ordering preserved; backpressure via size/time caps and drop policies for non-critical messages.
• Each message carries idempotency key and monotonic sequence; server acknowledges processed keys, enabling client to skip duplicates on resend.
• Flush strategy: upon OPEN event, drain queue respecting rate limits; retry with backoff on transient send failures.
• Ensure at-least-once delivery semantics without duplication on server via dedupe cache.
• Metrics: queue length, dropped messages, flush duration.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration: simulate offline period; enqueue messages; reconnect and verify no duplicates and preserved order (TC017). Unit: queue eviction and dedupe logic.

subtasks.title: Image cache with key normalization, LRU eviction, and prewarming
subtasks.description: Implement an image cache layer with deterministic keying and LRU eviction to improve hit rate for repeated image generation/fetches; include optional prewarm hooks.
subtasks.details:
• Cache key: normalize prompts, parameters, model version, seed, size, and post-processing options; hash into stable key.
• Storage: in-memory LRU with size limits (count/bytes) plus optional disk-backed store; respect TTLs.
• Prewarm: allow seeding cache for common assets.
• Expose metrics: hit/miss, evictions, byte hit rate.
• Thread-safety and concurrency: lock per key to prevent thundering herd (single-flight).
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: key normalization determinism; LRU eviction correctness; single-flight prevents duplicate work (TC018). Integration: repeated requests under load achieve >=60% hit rate.

subtasks.title: Token usage tracking and prompt compaction middleware
subtasks.description: Add middleware to track token usage across requests and implement prompt compaction to reduce context length while preserving fidelity.
subtasks.details:
• Token accounting: intercept adapter requests; compute prompt and completion tokens using tokenizer; record per-request metrics and cumulative usage.
• Prompt compaction: rules such as deduplicating repeated instructions, trimming stale turns beyond window, summarizing long histories, and compressing system prompts; target >=20% reduction where applicable.
• Configurable policies per campaign/session. 
• Emit metrics and attach compaction summaries for auditing.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: verify token counts align with tokenizer; compaction reduces tokens >=20% on synthetic long history; idempotency of compaction for repeated runs. Integration: end-to-end run shows reduced token usage without changing required outputs (spot-check).

subtasks.title: Profiling hooks, flamegraph capture, and GC tuning hints
subtasks.description: Integrate profiling instrumentation to capture CPU profiles/flamegraphs and expose memory/GC metrics. Provide guidance knobs for GC tuning.
subtasks.details:
• Add start/stop profiling endpoints or CLI flags to capture CPU/heap profiles during load tests; export in standard formats (pprof or similar).
• Emit metrics: GC pauses, heap in use, allocation rate, object churn.
• Configurable GC parameters via env flags (e.g., heap growth target, concurrent GC toggles) with safe defaults and documentation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manual/integration: run load test and collect profiles; verify artifacts generated and metrics exposed. Unit: basic sanity on metrics exporters.

subtasks.title: Latency load tests for STT, GM, and TTS with burst traffic
subtasks.description: Build a load testing harness to generate burst traffic across STT, generation/GM, and TTS paths, recording latency distributions and asserting medians meet targets.
subtasks.details:
• Implement scenarios: concurrent requests with spikes; representative payloads.
• Collect p50/p95 latencies and throughput; export JUnit-like assertions for CI.
• Targets: STT <800ms p50, GM <3s p50, TTS <1.2s p50 on local profile. Gate CI if violated (TC019).
• Integrate with profiling hooks to capture flamegraphs during runs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute harness repeatedly to stabilize results; verify CI gating and profile artifacts (TC019).

subtasks.title: Cache effectiveness tests and tuning
subtasks.description: Measure and tune cache hit rates under realistic workloads; adjust keying, TTLs, and prewarming to achieve >=60% hit rate for repeated requests.
subtasks.details:

• Iterate on TTLs, LRU capacity, and prewarm sets.
• Add dashboard or logs summarizing hit/miss and byte hit rate; assert TC018 threshold.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run workload and confirm hit rate >=60% and stable under bursts (TC018).

subtasks.title: Fault injection scenarios for adapter reliability
subtasks.description: Expand fault injection to simulate timeouts, 429s, intermittent 5xx, malformed responses, and slow responses; verify retries/backoff and circuit breaker behavior end-to-end.
subtasks.details:

• Scenarios check: retry counts, exponential delays with jitter, breaker open on sustained failures, recovery after cooldown.
• Collect metrics snapshots to confirm behavior matches design (TC016).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run each scenario multiple times to cover edge probabilities; assert no request storms and bounded latencies.

subtasks.title: WebSocket soak and chaos tests with offline queue validation
subtasks.description: Subject WebSocket layer to long-running and chaotic conditions to validate reconnection, backoff, and offline queue correctness.
subtasks.details:
• Chaos patterns: random disconnects, network partitions, high latency, packet loss.
• Assertions: reconnect within bounded windows, no message loss, no duplicates (idempotency keys), bounded queue growth.
• Collect uptime %, reconnect counts, and flush times (TC017).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run soak for several hours in CI nightly; quick chaos smoke in PRs. Use deterministic seeds where possible.

subtasks.title: Documentation and configuration templates for performance and reliability features
subtasks.description: Document configuration parameters, operational runbooks, and provide defaults for backoff, breaker, WS, caching, and profiling/GC settings.
subtasks.details:

• Add dashboards/alerts suggestions for key metrics.
subtasks.testStrategy: Docs lint/build passes; operator walkthrough validated against a staging environment.

tasks.title: AI-Generated Video Upgrade (Feature Flag)

subtasks.title: Define acceptance tests for video lifecycle, caching, identity consistency, and flag off behavior
subtasks.description: Create failing unit and integration/UI tests that capture the core acceptance criteria for AI-generated video under feature flag r13VideoEnabled, including lifecycle parity with images, cache reuse by storyboard hash, identity consistency with images/storyboards, ambient loop handling, and no external calls when the flag is off.
subtasks.details:
Implement tests before any production code. Cover:

Add middleware/guard in /videos routes and VideoService that short-circuits with 501 Not Implemented and telemetry event video.flag_disabled. Ensure adapters are not resolved when disabled. Store artifact URL, checksum, duration, resolution, loop flag, and identity fingerprint. Implement TTL/pinning policy and invalidation hooks when input changes. subtasks.title: Identity consistency: character embedding reuse from images

On failure with existing cache, return last-known-good artifact with warning meta. If primary adapter unavailable and secondary enabled, route to fallback. Run tests.

subtasks.title: Write tests for local metrics capture and dashboards (TC001–TC006)
subtasks.description: Author unit and integration/UI tests that define the acceptance criteria for local metrics and telemetry. Cover: (1) latency and token usage per provider recorded to SQLite metrics_* tables; (2) cache hit/miss metrics for image/content cache; (3) campaign retention metrics (DAU/WAU/MAU-style session retention, campaign return rate); (4) fairness metrics across providers (latency distribution, error rate, allocation share); (5) hooks in adapters and GM loop emit structured events; (6) opt-in CSV export respects privacy redaction. Include at least one unit test per metrics domain and one end-to-end test that runs a mock session and verifies metrics populate and render basic charts in the UI. Define verification IDs TC001–TC006 mapped to these domains.
subtasks.details:
Create test scaffolding:
- DB: Spin up an isolated SQLite database file in tmp with schema migrations applied.
- Seed: Use seeded time provider to simulate timestamps; use deterministic random.
- Unit tests:
  - TC001: Insert/emit provider call start/stop; assert metrics_latency records provider, model, duration p50/p95 aggregate, count.
  - TC002: Emit token usage events; assert metrics_tokens aggregates by provider and by session; verify total and per-message breakdown.
  - TC003: Emit cache hits/misses; assert metrics_cache has hit_rate and SLA check (cached <6s median).
  - TC004: Simulate multi-session campaign re-entries across days; assert metrics_retention with D1/D7 and campaign return rate.
  - TC005: Simulate multi-provider routing; assert fairness metrics: proportion of calls per provider vs policy target, latency parity (gaps), error rate parity.
  - TC006: CSV export on with privacy flag: assert PII fields are redacted in export rows.
- Integration/UI:
  - Spin up minimal UI with charts fed by metrics endpoints; simulate session; assert charts render non-empty series (smoke test) and correct labels.
- Mocks: Adapter hooks and GM loop event emitters mocked to generate events into the metrics pipeline.
- Tooling: Jest/Vitest + Playwright/Cypress; tag tests by TC IDs.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: validate schema writes and aggregation queries via in-memory/temporary SQLite. Integration: run a short session using mocked providers; verify metrics endpoints and UI charts. Privacy: inject PII in events and assert redaction in logs/exports.

subtasks.title: Define SQLite schema for metrics_* tables and indices
subtasks.description: Design and migrate SQLite schema for all local structured metrics tables with necessary indices and foreign keys. Tables: metrics_events (raw), metrics_latency, metrics_tokens, metrics_cache, metrics_retention, metrics_fairness, metrics_exports, and a pii_redaction_audit table. Include views for common aggregations.
subtasks.details:
Implement migration files:
- metrics_events: id, session_id, campaign_id, provider, model, type, payload_json, ts_ms, redaction_applied BOOLEAN.
- metrics_latency: id, provider, model, session_id, request_id, duration_ms, success BOOLEAN, ts_ms.
- metrics_tokens: id, provider, model, session_id, request_id, prompt_tokens, completion_tokens, total_tokens, ts_ms.
- metrics_cache: id, cache_key, domain (image, text), hit BOOLEAN, latency_ms, ts_ms, campaign_id.
- metrics_retention: daily aggregates: date_utc, active_campaigns, returning_campaigns_d1, d7, active_sessions.
- metrics_fairness: window_start, window_end, provider, calls, successes, errors, p50_ms, p95_ms, allocation_share, expected_share.
- metrics_exports: id, filename, rows, started_at, finished_at, pii_redaction_version, status.
- pii_redaction_audit: id, source, field, original_hash, mask, ts_ms.
Indices on ts_ms, provider, model, campaign_id, and composite (provider, ts_ms).
Views:
- v_provider_latency_agg (p50/p95/p99 per provider, per model, per day).
- v_cache_hit_rate (hit_rate per domain and campaign per day).
- v_tokens_by_provider (sum totals per day).
- v_fairness_window (allocation vs expected).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run migration against temp DB; verify tables and indices exist. Execute sample inserts from tests TC001–TC005 to ensure constraints and queries succeed.

subtasks.title: Implement event hooks in adapters and GM loop
subtasks.description: Add lightweight, synchronous-safe hooks that emit structured metric events from all providers/adapters and the GM loop. Ensure minimal overhead and no external I/O. Hooks write to metrics_events and specialized tables.
subtasks.details:
Create MetricsEmitter interface with methods: recordLatency, recordTokens, recordCacheEvent, recordGMEvent, recordError. Implementation writes to SQLite via a buffered queue with batch commits (e.g., every 100ms or max 100 records). Instrument:
- Provider adapters (LLM, image gen): on request start/finish capture ts, duration, success, tokens.
- Cache layer: record hit/miss and latency with domain and campaign.
- GM loop: record turn timings and counts as GM events (optional aggregate only).
- Ensure PII redaction middleware is invoked before write (use Task 15 redactor when available; inject placeholder deterministic masker until Task 15).
- Provide noop emitter for tests.
- Add configuration flag to enable/disable metrics.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC001–TC005 unit tests; they should pass by recording expected events. Validate that emitter batching flushes within test timeouts.

subtasks.title: Metrics aggregation workers and SQL views
subtasks.description: Build periodic aggregation jobs that transform raw events into queryable aggregates for dashboards and reports. Jobs compute percentile latencies, token sums, cache hit rates, retention metrics, and fairness windows.
subtasks.details:
Implement a background scheduler (node-cron or internal tick) to run aggregations every minute and daily rollups at UTC midnight:
- Latency: compute p50/p95 per provider/model/day using window functions or approximate percentile if needed.
- Tokens: sum prompt/completion/total per provider/model/day and per session.
- Cache: hit_rate = hits/(hits+misses) per campaign and global per domain; SLA check flag cached_median_lt_6s.
- Retention: compute D1/D7 returning campaigns from sessions_by_day derived table.
- Fairness: sliding windows (e.g., 1h/24h) compute allocation_share vs expected_share (config) and error/latency parity metrics.
Store outputs into metrics_* aggregate tables and refresh views.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend TC001–TC005 to advance fake clock and trigger workers; assert aggregate rows match expectations, including percentile calculations and hit_rate.

subtasks.title: Privacy redaction integration for metrics pipeline
subtasks.description: Integrate PII redaction so that any payloads or identifiers stored in metrics are masked per policy. Ensure opt-in export is redacted and add audit trail.
subtasks.details: Wire existing redaction middleware from Task 15 via an interface. For now, implement a redaction adapter that accepts text fields and returns masked strings plus a hash for audit. Apply to metrics_events.payload_json and any free-text fields. Set redaction_applied flag and write to pii_redaction_audit. Ensure performance by skipping redaction for known numeric/ID fields.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run TC006; assert that test PII strings are masked in metrics tables and CSV exports, and audit entries are created.

subtasks.title: Implement local metrics API endpoints
subtasks.description: Expose read-only endpoints to power dashboards: /metrics/latency, /metrics/tokens, /metrics/cache, /metrics/retention, /metrics/fairness. Support filters (date range, provider, model, campaign).
subtasks.details: Create HTTP handlers that query aggregate tables/views with parameterized SQL. Validate inputs; default to last 7 days. Return compact JSON series for charting. Add pagination where result sets can grow. Ensure endpoints do not expose raw PII fields.
subtasks.testStrategy: Integration test: call endpoints after seeding events (TC001–TC005) and verify JSON schema and values. Security test: ensure PII fields are absent.

subtasks.title: UI dashboards for basic charts
subtasks.description: Build simple dashboards to visualize key metrics: latency percentiles per provider/model, token usage trends, cache hit rates/SLA, campaign retention, and fairness indicators.
subtasks.details:
Implement frontend views:
- Latency: line/area charts with p50/p95 per provider; model filter.
- Tokens: stacked area for total tokens by provider.
- Cache: gauge or line for hit rate; badge for SLA cached <6s median.
- Retention: cohort/line chart for D1/D7 campaign retention.
- Fairness: bar charts for allocation share vs expected and error rate by provider.
Use existing chart library. Add basic empty-state and error handling.
subtasks.testStrategy: UI test (Playwright/Cypress): After seeding data, navigate dashboards and assert charts render with expected labels/series (extends initial UI part of TC001–TC006).

subtasks.title: Opt-in CSV export with privacy safeguards
subtasks.description: Implement CSV export for selected metrics with explicit opt-in flag. Respect redaction, include export metadata, and write metrics_exports record.
subtasks.details: Create endpoint /metrics/export?type=latency|tokens|cache|retention|fairness&filters=... requiring export_enabled=true config. Stream CSV rows from aggregate queries. Ensure field set excludes PII and applies masking if any free-text. Persist export job record in metrics_exports with status progression.
subtasks.testStrategy: Extend TC006 to request CSV export and verify content headers, row counts, and redaction. Negative test: export disabled returns 403.

subtasks.title: Fairness metrics computation and config
subtasks.description: Finalize fairness definitions and computation logic, including expected allocation shares per provider, parity thresholds, and alerts.
subtasks.details: Add configuration for expected provider shares (e.g., A:50%, B:30%, C:20%). Compute in sliding windows: allocation_share, error_rate, p95 latency. Calculate parity deltas and a fairness_score. Surface via /metrics/fairness and UI badges. Optionally add soft alerts (in-UI warnings) when thresholds exceeded.
subtasks.testStrategy: Unit: feed synthetic multi-provider data and assert allocation_share and parity calculations. Integration: endpoints return correct fairness metrics that match UI.

tasks.title: Implement Subscription/Depth Progression Preset (Default) with Achievements
tasks.description: Add a default campaign preset focused on long-term progression (levels, perks, artifacts, crew achievements, soft-fail credit) with private telemetry points, configurable visibility/leaderboard/fail-forward toggles, full achievements system (definitions, unlocks, rewards, notifications), DB schema, UI (achievements panel + banner, preset settings), tests, and isolation/perf hardening. Feature must be gated behind preset selection and applied to new campaigns.
tasks.details:
Scope and architecture
- Preset definition
  - Create a CampaignPreset registry keyed by enum: DEFAULT_SUBSCRIPTION_DEPTH.
  - Preset sets defaults: pointsVisibility=private, leaderboardScope=off, failForward=strict (configurable), progression model=levels+perks+artifacts, crewAchievements=enabled, softFailCredit=enabled.
  - Hook preset into campaign creation flow so new campaigns default to this preset unless user chooses another.

- Progression mechanics integration
  - Extend rules/progression module to expose: computeXP(missionOutcome, skillChecks, artifactsFound, allianceFeats), level thresholds, perk point allocation, artifact slots and gating.
  - Implement fail-forward accounting: on failed missions grant reduced XP and soft credit toward next mission gate. Add tunables in preset for fraction (e.g., 30–50%).
  - Record per-mission private points (telemetry only) separate from public scores table; do not emit leaderboard updates in this preset.

- Achievements system
  - Definitions: per-player and per-crew achievements with fields: id, scope (player|crew), name, description, rarity, category, unlockConditions (DSL or JSON: missionCompletions>=N, skillChecks[DC>=X] success count, collectArtifact[set], allianceFeat[raidX], time-bounded), rewards (xp, items, titles), icon, enabled, version.
  - Unlocks: per subject table to store unlocked achievements with timestamps, campaign_id, subject_id, version, reward_granted flag; include progress tracking for incremental achievements.
  - Evaluators: event-driven evaluators subscribing to rules and mission events; incremental progress updates and final unlock with idempotent reward grant.
  - Notifications: lightweight in-session banner/toast with accessibility labels; queue dedupe; batch multiple unlocks.

- Campaign-level toggles
  - Expose settings on campaign model: pointsVisibility (private|friends|public), leaderboardScope (off|friends), failForwardStrictness (off|lenient|strict). Enforce at API and UI. For this preset: default private/off/strict, but allow owner to adjust within allowed bounds (no public leaderboard in this preset).

- Privacy and isolation
  - Ensure no writes to leaderboard tables when leaderboardScope=off; guard in service layer. Enforce DB constraints or service checks to prevent cross-campaign leakage. Ensure vector memory namespaces remain campaign:<id> and player:<id> only.

- Telemetry
  - Event schema: achievement_progress, achievement_unlocked, mission_points_recorded, perk_allocated, artifact_acquired. Only stored locally; redact PII; ensure pointsVisibility=private prevents any external export.

- Database schema (migrations)
  - achievements_definitions(id PK, scope, key UNIQUE, name, description, rarity, category, conditions JSON, rewards JSON, icon, enabled, version, created_at).
  - achievements_unlocks(id PK, campaign_id, scope, subject_id, def_id FK, progress JSON, unlocked_at NULLABLE, reward_granted BOOL, UNIQUE(campaign_id, scope, subject_id, def_id)).
  - telemetry_points(id PK, campaign_id, player_id NULLABLE, mission_id, points INT, reason TEXT, created_at).
  - progression_state(id PK, campaign_id, player_id, level INT, xp INT, perk_points INT, artifacts JSONB).
  - campaign_settings add: preset enum, points_visibility, leaderboard_scope, fail_forward_strictness.

- API
  - POST /campaigns with preset selection (applies defaults). PATCH /campaigns/:id/settings for toggles with validation.
  - GET /achievements/definitions?scope=player|crew, GET /achievements/unlocks/:subject, POST /achievements/claim/:unlockId (idempotent claim if rewards require claim), POST /progression/perk-allocate.
  - POST /telemetry/mission-points (internal server call) stores private points when missions resolve.

- UI
  - Achievements panel: filter by All/Unlocked/Locked, categories; show progress bars; claim button when applicable. Respect scope switch between Player and Crew for current campaign.
  - Lightweight banner/toast for unlocks with small icon, title, reward summary; queue with max display rate; accessible and non-blocking.
  - Campaign Settings for this preset: radio/selectors for points visibility (private only with info tooltip), leaderboard scope (off or friends-only disabled state note), fail-forward strictness; preset badge and description.
  - Indicate that leaderboards are disabled in this preset in any leaderboard UI, and suggest switching modes (without enabling here).

- Security & performance
  - Validate all preset toggle updates server-side; reject public leaderboard in this preset.
  - Idempotency keys for unlock/reward claims to prevent duplication on retries.
  - Ensure vector index namespace resolution uses campaign_id guard; add unit tests around it. No external writes for telemetry or achievements.

- Data seeding
  - Provide initial achievements set: examples — First Steps (first mission), Skillful (10 DC15+ successes), Relic Hunter (collect 3 artifacts), United We Stand (crew completes alliance feat), Unstoppable (complete mission after prior fail).
  - Provide XP curve defaults and sample perks.

- Feature flagging
  - Gate all UI and API behind preset feature and a server flag to allow staged rollout.
tasks.testStrategy:
Unit tests
- Progression math: XP calculation across success/fail-forward paths; level thresholds; perk allocation bounds; artifact slot gating.
- Achievements logic: incremental progress and unlock for each seeded achievement; idempotent reward grant; evaluator filtering by campaign preset.
- Privacy/isolation: when leaderboardScope=off, any score submit call is a no-op and logs warning; points written only to telemetry_points; vector namespace isolation enforced on all evaluators.
- Settings validation: API rejects attempts to set leaderboardScope=public for this preset; pointsVisibility cannot be set to public.
- Telemetry: events serialized without PII; schema conformance.

Integration/API tests
- Create campaign with default preset via /campaigns; verify settings default and preset recorded.
- Mission resolution posts private points and triggers achievement progress; GET unlocks reflects updates.
- Toggle failForwardStrictness and verify XP outcomes adjust; verify friends-only leaderboard option is disabled/unavailable in this preset.
- Idempotent reward claim: POST claim twice returns same state and no duplicate rewards.

UI/End-to-end (Playwright)
- Achievements panel: filtering, progress bars, unlocked state, claim flow; accessibility checks (axe) pass.
- Unlock banner displays with correct text/icon and queues when multiple unlocks occur; screen reader announcements present.
- Campaign settings UI shows preset badge and enforces disabled public leaderboard; changes persist and reflect in API.

Security/performance
- Fuzz tests: no negative XP, no level overflow; unlock spam throttled, banner queue bounded.
- Verify no external writes when pointsVisibility=private (network inspection/mocking).
- Vector memory isolation tests to ensure no cross-campaign reads/writes.

Acceptance mapping
- Ensure scenarios cover R-003/004/005/006/008/009/011 by linking to TC004/TC006/TC007/TC009/TC014/TC015/TC017 in the test harness tags and reports.

tasks.title: Implement Viral Scoring Preset (Seasonal Leaderboards & Sharing)
tasks.description: Add a selectable campaign preset that enables public mission scoring, seasonal leaderboards (campaign/global scopes), viral share flows, and weekly featured missions with privacy, anti-griefing, ELO/MMR, and season rewards. Provide full tests (unit/integration/UI/API), rate limiting, and campaign isolation; preset is disabled by default and can be toggled per campaign.
tasks.details:
Scope and architecture
- Preset definition and registry
  - Extend CampaignPreset registry with enum: VIRAL_SCORING. Preset flags: publicScores=opt-in, leaderboardScope=friends|campaign|global, seasons=enabled, featuredMissions=weekly, allowSharing=opt-in, redactPII=on, storageMode=local-only-compliant, antiGriefing=on, eloEnabled=per-arena, partialCredit=soft-fail enabled. Disabled by default; selectable per campaign in settings UI and during creation wizard.
  - Add campaign-level toggles: enablePublicScores, leaderboardScope, enableSeasons, shareDefaults (opt-in off), allianceScoreInclusion, seasonSchedule (start, end, grace), and rewardTiers.

- Data model (SQLite)
  - Tables (new): scores(id, campaign_id, session_id, mission_id, player_id, team_id, scope, metric, value, partial, fail_reason, created_at); seasons(id, campaign_id, name, scope, start_at, end_at, rollover_state, rewards_schema, version); season_entries(id, season_id, player_id, team_id, rank, mmr, division, elo_mu, elo_sigma, last_update); share_artifacts(id, campaign_id, score_id, artifact_type, url_or_blobref, pii_redacted JSON, created_at, consent_at); featured_missions(id, campaign_id, mission_id, week_of, curated_by).
  - Migrations: create indices on (campaign_id, scope, metric, created_at), (season_id, rank DESC), and composite unique keys to prevent duplicate submissions per mission attempt.

- Scoring formulas and soft-fail
  - Implement a scoring module keyed by missionType: time-attack, survival, puzzle, social-coop, arena. Each defines base points, bonuses, penalties, and clamps. Support partial credit on soft-fail: grant proportional points based on progress fraction, with anti-exploit caps.
  - Fair-play checks: validate mission completion evidence, server-side timestamps, min duration thresholds, attempt cooldowns, host consent for social missions, and client signature verification (reuse adapter auth if present). Rate limit score submissions per player and per campaign.

- Anti-griefing and security
  - Timeouts: enforce max attempt duration; auto-abort stale submissions. Consent gates: for team scores, require majority consent or GM approval. Cross-campaign isolation: all queries filtered by campaign_id and leaderboard scope; add row-level guards in access layer.
  - Validation: reject out-of-bounds values; detect suspicious streaks; quarantine flagged scores pending review.

- Seasonal leaderboards and rollover
  - Implement seasonal versioning: active season per campaign/scope; archived seasons are immutable snapshots with view filters. Provide monthly/quarterly schedules and manual admin rollover. Compute standings on event update and via periodic job; freeze during grace period. Support divisions and ranks for large populations; include alliance/crew aggregates.

- ELO/MMR for arenas
  - Arena matches update MMR per outcome with K-factor scaling by uncertainty; maintain elo_mu/sigma for Bayesian variants. Persist per season. Calibrate initial placement matches; decay on inactivity. Expose API to fetch matchmaking band.

- Rewards and featured missions
  - Cosmetic season rewards generation based on final rank/percentile and achievement thresholds. Weekly featured missions rotation: auto-select based on engagement signals with manual override.

- Sharing and privacy
  - Share flows: generate share_artifacts with opt-in consent; render redacted cards (hide PII, show campaign-safe names). Provide copy-link and image export; ensure local-only storage compliance (no external uploads unless configured). Include per-scope badges (friends/global/campaign) in the artifact.

- UI integration
  - Preset settings pane: toggles, schedule editor, reward tiers editor, privacy controls. Leaderboards views: current season, friends, global (if enabled), past seasons, alliance standings; entry detail with share action. Share dialog with preview and consent checkbox.

- APIs
  - POST /scores/submit; GET /leaderboards?scope&season; POST /seasons/rollover; GET /seasons/current; POST /share/create; GET /featured-missions; POST /featured-missions/override. Enforce rate limits and schema validation. Contract tests included.

- Performance
  - Incremental leaderboard updates with upsert + denormalized standings table; background recompute for heavy scopes. Bounded history retention for hot paths; archive to cold tables. Apply submission rate limits (per IP/player) and exponential backoff on abuse.

- Compatibility and toggles
  - Integrate with alliances/teams so alliance and crew achievements contribute to seasonal standings when enabled. Respect campaign preset defaults; no cross-talk with other presets. Disabled by default for all existing campaigns until explicitly selected.

References and rationale
- Implement seasonal versioning and resets modeled after established practices for seasonal leaderboards to keep competition fresh[3].
- Apply best practices for leaderboard scopes, reset cycles, and community health to mitigate toxicity and maintain engagement[2][1].
- Support divisions/ranks concepts akin to league systems to scale competition fairly across skill bands[5].
tasks.testStrategy:
Unit tests
- Scoring math per mission type: deterministic outputs for boundary cases; partial credit proportionality; clamp and cap behaviors. Fuzz against invalid inputs to ensure rejection and quarantine.
- ELO/MMR updates: verify K-factor scaling, placement matches, win/loss/draw updates, inactivity decay, and season scoping.
- Season schedule: compute active/archived state, grace period logic, and rollover versioning.

Integration tests
- Leaderboard updates: submit scores concurrently; verify standings update correctly, alliance aggregates reflect member contributions, and per-campaign isolation holds. Validate friends vs campaign vs global scopes.
- Season rollover: run end-of-season; freeze submissions; archive standings; create next season; rewards issuance; verify no mutations to archived season.
- Rate limiting and anti-griefing: exceed submission thresholds; ensure 429s and quarantine flow; validate consent gates for team submissions; timeouts on stale attempts.
- Featured missions: weekly rotation triggers; manual override persists; UI surfaces current featured set.

UI tests (Playwright)
- Preset selection: ensure VIRAL_SCORING appears, is disabled by default, and can be enabled per campaign.
- Leaderboards views: paginate, filter by scope, switch current/past seasons, view alliance standings, open share dialog, confirm PII redaction and consent requirement.
- Share flows: create artifact, copy link/image export, verify privacy banner and opt-in remembered per user.

API contract tests
- /scores/submit validation and idempotency; /leaderboards query combinations; /seasons/rollover permissions and effects; /share/create artifact schema; /featured-missions endpoints. Schema versioning and backward compatibility checks.

Performance and reliability tests
- Load: burst score submissions maintain SLOs; recompute latency under N concurrent updates; no cross-campaign leakage. Chaos: kill periodic job during rollover; system recovers idempotently.

Acceptance mapping
