tasks.title: Implement Ollama Provider Adapters (LLM + Embeddings) with Streaming, Tools, Safety, and A/B Harness Integration
tasks.description: Add Ollama adapters implementing LLMProvider and EmbeddingProvider with streaming, tool schema/function-calling, safety filters, config, metrics, and full tests; update provider UI and docs.
tasks.details:
Scope and architecture
- Create packages/modules: providers/ollama/llmAdapter.ts and providers/ollama/embeddingAdapter.ts implementing existing LLMProvider and EmbeddingProvider interfaces.
- Configuration
  - Env/config keys: OLLAMA_BASE_URL (default http://localhost:11434), OLLAMA_API_KEY (optional for gateway), provider.settings.modelAllowlist = ['llama3','mistral','phi3'] (configurable).
  - Validate base URL reachability at startup with lightweight /api/tags or /api/version probe and log model availability.
- LLM adapter
  - API shape: supports chat completion with messages[], model, temperature, maxTokens, seed (if supported), tools (JSON schema), tool_choice=auto/none, streaming.
  - Streaming: use server-sent stream from Ollama and emit tokens/chunks in our standard StreamDelta events; handle finish reasons and tool call events.
  - Tools: convert zod/JSON Schema tool definitions to Ollama’s function/tool schema; on tool call deltas, aggregate into a function_call struct {name, arguments} and surface via our ToolCall event; validate against schema; on invalid schema, retry with corrected schema once.
  - Params mapping: temperature->temperature, maxTokens->num_predict, top_p if present in request, seed->seed. Respect stop sequences. Provide fallback when parameter not supported by particular model.
  - Metrics: capture start/end timestamps, latency, prompt/completion token counts when exposed; if not available, estimate tokens via tokenizer fallback. Cost = 0 for local Ollama. Emit to A/B harness metrics sink.
  - Retries/backoff: integrate with global adapter retry policy (exponential with jitter); classify retryable errors (429 from gateways, ECONNRESET, timeouts) vs non-retryable (400 schema errors after one correction attempt).
  - Safety: apply content filters/redaction pipeline pre-send and post-receive. Redact PII/secrets in prompts and tool args; check outputs and mask as configured.
  - Determinism: if seed provided, pass through and document per-model determinism caveats.
- Embeddings adapter
  - Use Ollama embeddings endpoint for selected model; require embedding-capable model in allowlist.
  - Return Float32Array normalized vectors; include dimensionality discovery on first call and cache.
  - Batch inputs with size limits; streaming not required.
- A/B harness integration
  - Register Ollama as an LLM and Embedding provider in the model matrix; expose provider id, model list (from allowlist intersected with server-available models), and metrics mapping.
  - Ensure zero cost recorded for this provider.
- UI and docs
  - Update Settings > Providers UI to include Ollama provider card with fields: Base URL, API Key (optional), Model allowlist help, connectivity test.
  - Update providers.md with configuration, supported features, limits, and troubleshooting.
- Security/ops
  - Timeouts, circuit breaker guard, and connection pooling. Respect per-campaign isolation and safety settings.
- Examples
  - Provide sample code to invoke streaming with tools and embeddings with normalization in docs.
tasks.testStrategy:
Unit tests
- Adapter shape: construct OllamaLLMAdapter and OllamaEmbeddingAdapter; verify methods, parameter mapping, defaults, and allowlist enforcement.
- Streaming: mock Ollama stream; assert ordered StreamDelta emissions, final finish event, and backpressure handling.
- Tools: validate JSON schema conversion; simulate tool call chunks and ensure aggregated function_call matches schema; invalid schema triggers one retry then fails with tagged error.
- Retries/backoff: inject transient network errors and verify exponential backoff with jitter and max attempts; non-retryable errors do not retry.
- Safety: ensure pre-send redaction masks PII and post-receive filters apply; verify redaction does not leak originals to transport layer logs.
- Embeddings: return type is Float32Array; values normalized to unit length within epsilon; batch processing splits correctly.

Integration tests
- Minimal prompt roundtrip against local Ollama (skipped in CI if not available; flag to enable): verify successful completion, streaming order, and metrics capture (latency present, tokens if provided or estimated fallback recorded).
- Deterministic seed: with same prompt+seed verify identical text for models that support seed; if model lacks determinism, assert at least same first N tokens or mark as conditional skip.
- Tool-call structure: run prompt that elicits a function call; validate name and JSON arguments parse and zod-validate.
- Embeddings: compute embeddings for stable inputs; assert dimensionality stable and cosine similarity >0.99 for identical input across runs.

Verification/acceptance
- Tag tests with TC011 and TC013 where applicable and map in verification plan; ensure R-007 updated requirement satisfied for Ollama.
- Update providers.md and UI provider list; manual checklist includes connectivity test in UI and A/B harness registration.

tasks.title: Implement Group Chat: Global and Ad‑Hoc Voice+Text Channels with Invites
tasks.description: Build campaign‑scoped group chat supporting a global All‑Hands channel and ad‑hoc invite‑based voice+text channels with roles, moderation, audit logging, API/WS, DB schema, and UI; integrate with voice capture/captions and ensure isolation/security.
tasks.details:
Scope and architecture
- Channel model
  - Channel types: GLOBAL (one per campaign, All‑Hands) and AD_HOC.
  - Properties: id, campaign_id, type, name, description, is_invite_only, created_by, created_at, updated_at, archived_at, voice_room_id (nullable), text_retention_days, default_join_muted.
  - Memberships: id, channel_id, user_id, role (owner|mod|member), mute (self), volume (0–100), joined_at, left_at (nullable), is_present_in_voice (derived from voice engine presence).
  - Invites: id, channel_id, inviter_id, invitee_id, status (pending|accepted|declined|expired|revoked), expires_at, created_at, rate_limit_bucket.
  - Channel events (audit): id, channel_id, actor_id, event_type (create|update|delete|join|leave|invite_create|invite_accept|invite_decline|role_change|mute|kick), payload (JSON), created_at.
  - Text messages: reuse existing messages table if present; otherwise define messages(id, channel_id, author_id, content, kind=text|caption|system, ts, ref (optional)). Transcripts store STT captions as messages with kind=caption and diarization metadata.

- API design
  - REST
    - POST /channels (create ad‑hoc; enforce campaign scope; assign owner)
    - GET /channels (list by campaign with membership and unread counts)
    - GET /channels/:id (details, last N messages, membership summary)
    - PATCH /channels/:id (name, invite_only, description) – owner/mod only
    - DELETE /channels/:id (archive) – owner only for ad‑hoc; GLOBAL cannot be deleted
    - POST /channels/:id/members/join (join; default muted in voice)
    - POST /channels/:id/members/leave (leave; owner transfer/constraints)
    - POST /channels/:id/members/:userId/roles (role transition; auth checks)
    - POST /channels/:id/moderation/mute (self or mod‑enforced target)
    - POST /channels/:id/moderation/kick (remove from membership; mod/owner)
    - POST /channels/:id/invites (create; rate limited; invite_only respected)
    - POST /channels/:id/invites/:inviteId/accept
    - POST /channels/:id/invites/:inviteId/decline
  - WebSocket events (namespaced by campaign)
    - channel.created/updated/archived
    - channel.member.joined/left/role_changed
    - channel.invite.created/accepted/declined
    - channel.moderation.muted/kicked
    - channel.voice.presence (join/leave/talking/VAD)
    - channel.text.message (text and caption kinds)
    - channel.audit.appended

- Voice integration
  - On channel join, create/ensure voice room mapping (voice_room_id) and attach presence to membership; default join muted; push‑to‑talk and VAD states reflected in WS presence events.
  - Per‑channel mute/volume stored in membership; client applies volume locally; server tracks mute for moderation and signaling.
  - Captions/diarization: consume STT pipeline outputs and emit as channel.text.message with kind=caption, speaker tag (connection/user id), timestamps; store in transcripts/messages.

- Text integration
  - Message history per channel; pagination by ts+id; captions appear inline with badges; system messages for invites/joins/leaves.
  - Moderation deletes redact content and append audit event.

- Security and isolation
  - All endpoints authorize campaign membership; channels cannot cross campaigns; per‑action role checks; enforce invite_only: only invited users can join; global channel membership allowed to all campaign users but can be left/joined.
  - Rate limit invites per inviter+channel (e.g., 10/min, 100/day) with backoff and 429 responses.
  - Validate WS subscriptions to campaign and channel membership; no leakage across campaigns.

- Database schema (SQL sketch)
  - channels(id PK, campaign_id FK, type, name, description, is_invite_only, voice_room_id, default_join_muted, text_retention_days, created_by, created_at, updated_at, archived_at)
  - channel_memberships(id PK, channel_id FK, user_id FK, role, mute, volume, joined_at, left_at)
  - channel_invites(id PK, channel_id FK, inviter_id FK, invitee_id FK, status, expires_at, created_at, updated_at)
  - channel_events(id PK, channel_id FK, actor_id FK, event_type, payload JSONB, created_at)
  - channel_messages(id PK, channel_id FK, author_id FK NULL for system/captions, kind, content TEXT/JSON, ts, meta JSONB)
  - Indexes: by campaign_id, (channel_id, ts DESC), unique (channel_id, user_id) active membership, invite dedupe (channel_id, invitee_id, status='pending').

- UI/UX
  - Channel list/switcher scoped to campaign; global channel pinned/bannered; unread badges; voice presence dots.
  - Create channel dialog: name, invite_only, initial invites; role shown as owner for creator.
  - Invite notifications: toast + inbox; accept/decline; deep‑link to channel.
  - Per‑channel controls: join/leave, push‑to‑talk toggle, VAD toggle, mute/volume slider; captions pane; message composer.
  - Accessibility: keyboard PTT, ARIA live for captions, color contrast; localized strings; dark/light.

- Event sourcing and audit
  - Emit channel_events for all state mutations; include actor_id, reason/message; render minimal audit feed for mods.

- Migration and seeding
  - On campaign creation, auto‑create GLOBAL All‑Hands channel with default_join_muted=true and captions on.

- Performance
  - Backpressure on WS text/caption streams; coalesce presence updates; message send debouncing; pagination size defaults; apply existing WS reconnection policies.

- Error handling and edge cases
  - Owner leave requires transfer or archive; prevent removing last owner; invite accept auto‑joins channel; decline keeps audit.
  - Kicks remove from voice and membership; surface reason to target; prevent rejoin if invite_only and no invite.

Implementation notes
- Backend: TypeScript (Node) services; reuse existing WS hub; zod validation; transactional writes for membership/invite flows; outbox pattern to emit WS after commit.
- Client: React; state via existing store; optimistic UI for text; reconcile on WS acks; persistent per‑channel audio settings in local storage.
- Telemetry: log invite rate‑limit hits, moderation actions, errors; redact PII in events.
tasks.testStrategy:
Unit tests (server)
- Authorization and role enforcement: create/update/delete channel; role transitions with constraints; moderation mute/kick auth; prevent cross‑campaign access.
- Invite lifecycle: create (rate‑limited), accept (auto‑join), decline, revoke/expire; dedupe pending invites per user/channel; audit events emitted.
- Membership: join/leave; default join muted; owner transfer and last‑owner guard; unique active membership per user/channel.
- Text routing: messages stored and broadcast to channel members only; captions stored with kind=caption and diarization metadata.
- Audit logs: verify channel_events appended for all mutations with correct payloads.

Integration/API tests
- CRUD: create ad‑hoc channel, update props, archive; global channel existence per campaign and non‑deletable guard.
- Membership flows: join/leave endpoints; per‑channel mute/volume updates persisted; kick removes voice presence and membership.
- Invites: create -> invitee receives WS invite; accept -> becomes member; decline -> no membership; rate‑limit returns 429 with reset header.
- WS sequencing: subscribe to campaign; assert event order and idempotency on reconnect; presence/talking events throttled.
- Voice/text coupling: join channel -> voice room presence mirrors membership; captions received in text stream; push‑to‑talk/VAD state reflected in presence events.

UI (Playwright)
- Global channel banner visible; join/leave/mute and volume work and persist; captions visible with ARIA live.
- Create ad‑hoc channel; invite flow end‑to‑end (create, notify, accept/decline); membership roles displayed; permissions UI enforced.
- Send/receive text and captions; unread counts and switcher updates; invite notifications actionable.

Non‑functional
- Rate limits honored under load; invite burst blocked; WS reconnect maintains channel subscriptions and resyncs last cursor.
- Privacy/isolation: cross‑campaign access attempts denied in API and WS; no events leaked in multi‑campaign test.
- Persistence: pagination returns stable ordering; retention purger (if configured) removes old messages without breaking pagination.
